Summary Heading: Cute, efficient hotel close to the water and downtown
Summary: Stayed here for three nights after some business travel and it was the perfect affordable hideaway in Laguna Beach. Yes it was during the heavy LA rain but it still really worked out.  Wifi is pretty good at the hotel but I wouldn't recommend it for zoom or Teams video calls, it was a bit more spotty then. Location is fantastic, easy access to the walking paths and beaches. About a 10-15 minute walk downtown and right by some of the free trolley stops too. And about a 4 minute walk to the grocery store.  Bed is incredibly comfortable, shower is small, bathroom is very small. I also didn't have hot water while there which...isn't great in January, even in California. That is the only thing that would really keep me from going back.  It is located right on the PCH so even if you
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was really pleased that hubby was glad with my choice of stay in Laguna Beach. Clean. Efficient for everything we needed. Near enough to the main shops, restaurants and of course the beach. Sadly, the pool was being refurbished, but it was not needed when we brought rain with us!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I was young, and lived in Laguna Beach
Summary: Friendly and hospitality are the hallmarks of my preference staying here while visiting my childhood memories . . .   having grown up and graduating from the schools in this small artist Beach community.  LBHS Class of 1970
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: "we were young, and grew up in Laguna Beach"
Summary: . . .   my favorite "go to" lodging for multiple reasons -  host hospitality; cleanliness of room(s) and common grounds; local history of the Laguna "charmer," location to "all things Laguna Beach," and my personal preference supporting small businesses . . .   con una sonrisa     Tony
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved our stay the Tides! The front desk could not be more helpful, the pool area with fireplace was charming, and the room was comfortable and super clean! We won‚Äôt stay anywhere else in Laguna Beach! We will be back! Thanks for making our trip the best!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were overwhelmed by the charm and character of this wonderful place. We were welcomed and given all the information we needed to help us have the best time in Laguna and has a wide range of equipment to loan for the beach.The pool area was great and the room was light and bright and spacious. It was quiet and we had two great nights sleep. The location couldn‚Äôt be better for both beach and downtown restaurants. When we return to Laguna we would choose to come Bach here. The owner clearly works incredibly hard to make this place unique and special.

Summary: We love staying at The Tides each summer!   The hotel has a great salt water pool, the beach is across the street.  The hotel is close to stores, art galleries, and restaurants.  The Innkeeper, Anderson, is friendly and helpful throughout our stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The good: great service, nice people from booking to check-in to check-out.  Quiet room (213).  Clean. Bad: dip in bed, old scuffed furniture, no microwave, not updated.  319.00 for 1 night.  Wow.  I know that during the pageant prices go up but . . .
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Liked it, but needs some repairs
Summary: We had Room 109. Ok size room with a small fridge, microwave and Keurig. Also a very small closet with too many hotel hangers so ours didn't fit. Bed and pillows were comfy. Room was clean but needs paint and maintenance. Painted furniture had stains and marks. Walk in shower with a bit of mold, loose towel bar. A very small shelf in the bathroom for storage. AC worked just fine. Large tv. We picked this room to avoid road noise and that worked great. We didn't hear footsteps from room above until daytime hours. Parking is super tight, especially with many guests having suv's. Staff was great - super helpful and friendly. They will get you buckets of ice if you need.  Hotel has loaner beach chairs and other stuff. Great location for walking to Pageant/FOA, Sawdust, Art-a-fair,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay in LagunaBeach
Summary: Great staff and great location, We so enjoyed our stay at the tides at Laguna Beach. We booked 2 rooms, one with a kitchen; they where both perfect! The staff was friendly and informative. If you are looking for a place to stay in Laguna Beach this is it!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a cute little hotel. We stayed in room 101 & it has a kitchenette / own room / and If I am traveling with two other people or so there is a day bed. Maybe a total can sleep 4 in that room.   The shower was small but good running water. The place is clean and airy, u can have windows open.  Its close enough (like 5-10mins) to the beach and downtown area and the beautiful Heisler Park. It is also close to the trolley shuttle.   I would love to return one day.  We had a late check in & I wish they had a late check out though.   The front desk were nice & easy to get a hold of.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to give us your feed back and review. We're so happy you enjoyed your room as each room is unique and has its own character. We do have an excellent location to the beaches and downtown and most of our guests just leave there cars parked and walk around. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again should your future travels bring you back to beautiful Laguna Beach :)

Summary: I really just felt a bit uneasy and grossed out in our room.  Room was incredibly dated.  No d√©cor, paint chips, squeakiest bed, could hear the TV of our neighbors, bathroom had things falling apart.  The whole room was about the size of a walk-in closet.  Our room was one RIGHT on PCH.  The ear plugs they provided don't help.  I would definitely not recommend staying in one of those rooms on PCH (we were 201).  If you can stay at the remodeled and gorgeous Laguna Beach Lodge for the same price (which we did for our second night), it's a no brainer.
Manager Response: Hi cocomo227, we appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback and review. We strive to offer the best value in Laguna Beach in terms of location, accommodations and rates. We sincerely apologize for your experience in the room you stayed in. All of our rooms are uniquely decorated and we want all of our guests to feel comfortable and at home. We will use your feedback to make improvements and thank you again :)

Summary Heading: Great location, lovely rooms and amenities, walkable to beach and restaurants, wonderful staff
Summary: We have stayed at The Tides Laguna Beach many times over the years, and we keep coming back! It's a terrific location, just a block from Heisler Park and the beach. Each room is unique, (some with kitchenettes) and the staff is warm, welcoming and so helpful. The pool and fireplace are lovely, and each reservation comes with a free parking space! (Rare for Laguna).  For this and many other reasons, we consider The Tides our home away from home!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Musty cellar odor, very noisy (you can ear your neighbours as if they were in your room), hot and cold shower, dark room, very little windows with a staircase view without possibility to be open because of trafic noise... I don't know if all the room are like that but if you have nber 101 room: run away. 195$ for that, it's a shame! OK it is close to the beach and shopping, restaurants but it doesn't worth this price at all and it is very unpleasant to stay in.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback and review. We sincerely apologize for your recent experience in room 101. Our goal is to make all of our guests feel comfortable and at home and we will use your feedback to implement improvements. All of our guest rooms are uniquely decorated and we do have rooms in different locations (i.e., upper floor, farther away from Pacific Coast Highway). We also strive to offer the best value as we have an excellent location to the beaches and downtown with shops and eateries and also do not charge any additional resort or parking fees. Thank you again.

Summary Heading: A Little Gem in Laguna Beach
Summary: Great location for dining and shopping and incredibly close to the beach.  This is a cute and quaint property with fantastic, personal service.  This is a gem folks and a great value!  I highly recommend staying at The Tides Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us and thank you for your wonderful review. We hope to welcome you back home should your future travels bring you back to beautiful Laguna Beach.

Summary: The Tides Laguna Beach is a gem. Located just minutes from everything. The beach, shops and restaurants are all within walking distance. Collette at the front desk was very helpful in recommending places to eat and how to get around.   The room we stayed in was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We had complentary ear plugs for the noise. But we didn't need them. My family and I had no problems sleeping in.   The pool area was very accommodating. Chairs and couches make for laying and hanging out pleasent. And the fire place was a nice bonus to lounge in front of and have a cocktail (available until 10pm).   Overall our stay was exactly what we needed. Thank you to The Tides team. We will definitely be back. I wish I would have taken more pictures.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice little hotel.  It‚Äôs an older property but they have done extensive renovations.   The property employees are very friendly and helpful.  They have beach chairs and towels you can use.  The pool is heated and salt water so really nice to use since the ocean water was really cold(April).  It‚Äôs also about a half mile walk to all the dining and shopping at Laguna beach.  The beach is just across the street.  The room is kind of like a small beach condo.  We like riding bikes so a bit disappointed that Laguna doesn‚Äôt have a lot of bike trails and is hilly.  Newport Beach has some great biking however.  Definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: So the pros: Cute, clean, well-maintained, older motel close to downtown, across the street from the beach access, walkable to Heisler Park, two blocks north of Urth Caffe, one block from the Laguna Museum, nice pool area, fireplace and BBQ available. Heated pool, enough free parking. Front office staff was friendly, helpful and the hotel cleaning staff was very kind and helpful. The towels are super nice, plentiful, the sheets and bed are comfy and the shower was good pressure and good, hot water. The kitchenette is well-appointed with a newer Keurig, mid-size fridge and dishes, etc. Really good for the small meals I made. Cons: I was in room 101, street-level, just feet from PCH/traffic/sidewalk. Not sure if these are the the only rooms that they put guests who have pets, but
Manager Response: none

Summary: This boutique hotel is close to art galleries, a few shops, and the beach. The hotel is on the north side of PCH but beach access is easy via Myrtle Street. This leads you to Heisler Park which is very nice. The room we stayed in was clean & had a kitchenette (mini fridge, small microwave, Keurig, & toaster, [no stove or oven] and serviceware for 2 people). It was perfect for us and the price was right!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We came down for the night to go to the Sawdust Festival. We arrived early at hotel, and we were given a parking pass so we could leave our car at hotel and walk to the festival. (I think it's about 1 mile) Hotel is in a perfect location. We could walk everywhere. (Beach, downtown, restaurants all very close by) Room (209) was clean and had kitchenette. We loved sitting out on our little "porch" with the adirondack chairs. We would definitely stay there again! Just a note traffic noise was a little loud, but hotel supplied earplugs and bottles of water in the room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As mentioned there are several endearing qualities at The Tides.  I like a smaller quaint properties with character.  It was clean and comfortable.  The towels were nice quality.  The sheets could use an upgrade.  But the biggest issue was the traffic noise and location right on PCH.  We like open windows and we were tucked in the corner on the upper floor.  The traffic noise is loud and non-stop to the point of constant irritation.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hospitality and very clean and comfortable lodging. We like to walk and this place afforded us great places to walk to see the theater and the beautiful coastline.  We enjoyed our visit very much.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed in Laguna Beach many times, but this is our first at The Tides. It's an older property, but super clean and sweet. The location is GREAT (right across the street from Heisler Park/beach) - an easy walk to everything downtown, and walkable for most to the Festival of Arts/Pageant of the Masters. There is a little nighttime traffic noise, but this is true of every hotel/motel in the downtown area. Nice little pool area, too. We'll definitely return.  P.S. I was able to take advantage of a birthday discount as we were staying 2 nights, one of which was on my birthday. Very nice surprise!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Walking distance to beach, restaurants, shops, Pageant. Very accommodating. Free parking. Nice pool area. Room was cute and a good size--had microwave, refrigerator, AC. Close to the street, so they provided ear plugs, but I didn't need them. Very happy with it. A+
Manager Response: none

Summary: My boyfriend picked this hotel for our 2 night getaway this past week in Laguna Beach and I can't rave enough about our time here. Anderson, who answers the phone in a way that makes me think he never leaves work, was incredibly helpful, friendly and patient. I asked for a table so I could do some work while there. He provided it. I asked for an upstairs room.  He made it happen.  I asked for a refrigerator, and Anderson made sure our room had one. He answered all of my questions. Just made it all EASY. The room was lovely, nice decorations, windows with cool air coming in, room was clean, pleasant, the beds and pillows, for me, wonderful. Bottles of water provided. Fresh fruit available in the office. Parking easy.  My ONLY complaint: The shower head could be more adjustable

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay in Laguna Beach!
Summary: The Tides has been our "go to" place to stay in Laguna for several years.  The location is great.  Heisler Park and the beach are one block away and downtown is within a 10 minute walk.  There is also a trolley stop located right on the same block as the hotel.  A large supermarket and several eateries are 2 blocks away.  We enjoy the property as well.  Nice, clean rooms.  We like the rooms with small kitchenettes; even though we don't prepare food it's nice to have some space for any take away meals.  We have always had positive experiences here and look forward to future stays.

Summary: I chose the Tides of Laguna Beach due to its close proximity to the Pageant of the Masters.  I wanted to walk to the event versus drive.  I was delighted with my choice.  I was warmly greeted by the staff and allowed to check in a few hours early since our room was ready.  I stayed in unit 104.  There was a parking spot available right in front  of my room.  The room was simple and clean.  I loved the saying on the wall.  "Let us have love and give love, talk love and live love." The room had two very comfortable full size beds. The sheets were butter soft.  The kitchenette was well equipped with everything we would need.  I loved the vintage style cabinets and the sink in the bathroom with the greenish blue tile brought me into the 1950's.  There is a pool at the hotel (which
Manager Response: none

Summary: Warmly greeted, Bed was very comfy.  Excellent location.  Loved the kitchenette.  Will definitely return, probably for the really cool birthday discount (2 day stay, they take your age off the bill).  Easy walk to downtown and the festival.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The grounds and pool area are nicely maintained. Good walking distance to downtown, restaurants and beach. Where this facility falls short is the rooms. Bedroom area offered very limited lighting.  The bathroom was extremely small!  Rocking toilet, broken paper holder, shower door hit toilet so didn't fully open, we are both small framed (5'2") and just about hit our heads on the shower head.  If you drop something you have to get out to retrieve it. Broken tiles in front of the shower and the hairdryer did not work. I choose this based upon the 4 star rating and was very disappointed!!  Poor value for the money.

Summary: First we had a late check in due to our flight being delayed and they called to let us know the office closed at 8:00 pm but they gave us our room number and left our key under the mat outside our room. We arrived after dark but could see this place was really cute. We got in our room and there was a sweet handwritten note inside welcoming us. Which I thought was a nice touch. The room was clean, spacious and exactly what we needed for our 2 night stay. The staff was all extremely friendly, the grounds very well kept and the location was perfect! Within walking distance to everything you need and 1 block away from the beach! We will definitely stay here again if we travel back to Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in the King with Kitchenette.  Accessible unit.  Very clean. Warm handwritten greeting and bottle of wine left on the table.   The hotel is older but they have done an excellent job at preserving this gem.  Our bed was comfortable and the room with small kitchenette was perfect for our brief stay.  I just wish the fridge had a small freezer.     Pool area is lovely and clean with salt water.  Beach towels and chairs are provided. Hotel is just a short walk away from Heisler Park which is beautiful place to sit with your AM coffee from Black Dot Coffee or PM Sunset with your URTH coffee and dessert.    Wonderful galleries within walking distance.  I highly recommend for an affordable hotel in a great location.  We will return.  Loved it!

Summary Heading: Great location to beach, tired hotel room, no breakfast
Summary: People stay at this hotel because it is close to the beach and cheap.  There is no food at the hotel so you go down to the street and go to the Urth restaurant to eat ( get in line early as there is always a long line).  The room was pretty tired with broken window shades, bent curtain rods, and marks on the wall.  It would not have taken much time to fix these items, but they used their time instead to write me a welcome note.  That was nice, but maybe they should redirect their time to fixing up the rooms.

Summary: This was our first stay at The Tides in Laguna and it won't be our last!  Our room was perfect and very clean and the personnel were kind and very helpful.  Shout out to Anderson and Cheryl!  Thank you and we'll see you soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a long overdue review. The Tides holds a very special place in our memories. We loved our extended stay from Nov-Dec 2020 at The Tides. We felt welcomed and appreciated there, so we want to give a special shout out to the entire staff: Anderson, Sarah, Cheryl, Larry, Angela, Jasmine, and Martha.   The Tides is a charming, quaint and well managed place. The rooms are always clean and fresh; you can trust that they do a very thorough and sanitized cleaning. Their attention to details and customer service is second to none. If we ever needed

Summary: A pleasantly quaint place.. perfect for the Easter weekend. We were greeted very warmly by Sheryl. We even received a sweet welcome card from the staff. The room we got had some view of the beach- which was just a few minutes walk from the hotel. We love the display of plate collection accenting the room, which adds to its unique character.  This room was perfect for a family of 4, it has a dining area and a kitchen too üòä. Based on the reviews we have read, it can be noisy at night, but it wasn't  during our stay.  Definitely a wonderful place to go back to once we go back in the area.

Summary Heading: Quaint and lovely in every way!
Summary: A cozy and well maintained vintage motel right across the street from Heisler Park. Free onsite parking. The room was incredibly clean and adorably decorated. Pet friendly with reasonable pet fees. Hand written welcome note and two bottled waters. The bed was comfortable, and the windows did a great job of blocking out the street noise. The pool area is so pretty and relaxing. There are lounge chairs as well as a fireplace to gather around at night when it gets chilly. Walkable to eateries, shoppes, and the beach. The sunset was spectacular! Area felt very safe. Anderson at the front desk is the epitome of a good inn keeper/host. Please don‚Äôt ever lose him! I can‚Äôt wait to go back for my birthday visit!

Summary: I searched for a place to take my family of four and The Tides was a great choice. The location was ideal and walking distance from Heisler park and the streets are filled with art galleries, restaurants and many different shops. I enjoyed the scenery and my family was able to comfortably swim thanks to their heated pool. The staff was friendly and accommodating and the room was well decorated with an ocean view. They‚Äôre affordable and a cool place to stay! I went for my birthday trip FYI they do have birthday discounts just require two nights stay. Also they‚Äôre dog friendly!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Love the Tides! Will be back.
Summary: This was our second stay at the Tides and we love this place. It‚Äôs been our little COVID retreat - somewhere where we can get away while still having accommodations with a full kitchen so we can adequately social distance. It‚Äôs quaint, adorable, clean, the rooms are cute and kitschy, and the pool is a fab added amenity.   The star of the show is Anderson who works the reception. Summary: What a wonderful little gem!  Yes, it is off a main street but once you enter the driveway, the trees, landscape and pool make you feel you are somewhere else. Summary: We were looking for a quick getaway for our granddaughter's 7th birthday, it had to be near the beach and dog friendly. This was our first time staying at The Tides and I have to say it was outstanding! I can't remember the young man's name that greeted us but he made us feel extremely welcome, like we were returning guests/friends! The location was perfect just minutes walk to two pristine beaches and endless choices for dining out. I nearly forgot to mention that when we got to our room there was a birthday card on the table which I thought was really thoughtful. We will definitely stay at The Tides again.

Summary: We stayed a night in the middle of the week and it was memorably pleasant. A very quiet, clean and comfortable(good AC)room just like their website photos clearly show. It appears to be run by a very hospitable family and is family friendly. The Tides are conveniently located close to the center of town and a very short walk to public parks and beaches. Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. We strive to offer the best value and service and to give our guests a clean and comfortable place to stay. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed our excellent location to the beaches and downtown. We look forward to welcoming you back home :)

Summary Heading: GREAT spot for a get away!
Summary: We love this spot for a quick and less expensive get away in Laguna.  It's walking distance to good surf and beach spots; as well as all of the downtown shops and restaurants of Laguna Beach.   The staff was extra accommodating, we just had a lovely time.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to give us a wonderful review and are so happy you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. We look forward to hosting your next visit to beautiful Laguna Beach and thank you again :)

Summary: the room was dirty especially the floors...I wouldn't let a child on them. The pool is filthy. no amenities to speak of. room wasn't ready until 4 p.m. and still dirty. Manager Response: Dear HorribleMotel,  We sincerely apologize for your experience with us. Taking care of our guests is our number one priority and we really tried with you. The way you were berating and treating us in a condescending manner with insults, profanity and pointing fingers in our faces was not right, especially in front of other guests with little children. Summary: love this place in Laguna Beach.  We wanted a affordable room with a kitchenette and pet friendly, although we decided not to bring the dog.  We asked for an upstairs room and it was very bright and clean, tastefully decorated, and the bed and pillows are all very comfortable.  It has a nice pool area with BBQ, fireplace and seating area. The only drawback is that the hotel is right off coast highway so can be noisy from the traffic but all you have to do it close the double paned windows and can barely hear anything . Summary Heading: Fun stay right by the beach!
Summary: My daughter and I had a great 4 night stay at Tides. The pool area was a highlight with fireplace and bbq. We also loved being a few blocks from the beach! Summary Heading: A Very Happy Family Of Five
Summary: Stayed at this well kept property for three nights.  We loved everything about it; location (not once did we use our vehicle to travel around Laguna), personal touches, the friendliest and attentive staff, intimate and quaint. We found our place in Laguna!  Will definitely visit again.

Summary: I was expecting the hotel to be a bit shabby for the price in this location. I was very pleasantly surprised to find it so charming and well kept. Check-in was a breeze. The bathroom was a bit small but that would only be a problem if you are very large.

Summary: We continue to return to The Tides every year as they are an excellent host, thank you Anderson.. The place is always  clean and everyone takes very good care of your every need. The rooms have a kitchenette which Is very helpful. It‚Äôs the perfect location for a family vacation.

Summary: This is the third time I‚Äôve stayed at this hotel . It has the best customer customer and so clean! It is so relaxing and quiet . Clean pool , great amenities like a fire place and patio . I look forward to coming every chance I get
Manager Response: none

Summary: We hate to share word about THE TIDES, it's a grand little hide-away right on N PCH, steps from the ocean, restaurants and galleries. A perfect escape place within walking distance of all that Laguna Beach has to offer...plus this small hotel has it's own heated pool, patio and inconspicous location (maybe 20 units) for a low key escape. Summary: I loved this place. I booked a last-minute room for a last-minute get away to Laguna. Found the place on Hotelstonight.com. The customer service was over the top. Amazing beach basically across the street with coves and tide pools. My room was very basic, but the clerk who checked me in gave me a choice between two rooms and was honest in their description. The place was spotless. I wish I had taken the time to enjoy the pool area, which looked great. I will definitely return and highly recommend. Summary: I love this little hotel. It is a hidden gem. How can you afford to stay in Laguna Beach? This is the place. Say hi to innkeeper Anderson and his  German Shepherd. By the way, pets are welcome. Close to restaurants galleries and of course the ocean across the street. Loved it.

Summary Heading: Good place but watch your car parking
Summary: Nice place, good location. Watch out for the parking though. Our car was side swiped while parked in front of the pool. Summary Heading: QUAINT and CHARMING - This Little Place HAS IT ALL!
Summary: After 6 weeks of travel my partner and I arrived back home in Laguna Beach, CA. only to learn that we needed a few more nights away from home! An unexpected plumbing repair made getting back into our home something that just  couldn‚Äôt happen!  While we felt no need of a STAYCATION, our plumbing problem deemed such was necessary!  As one would expect, in a vacation destination like Laguna Beach, a quick online search, brought up a whole host of lodging options!  Many, for price reason alone,  were easy for us  to eliminate!  Remembering we‚Äôd just finished 6 weeks of travel we both knew the AFFORDABLE OPTIONS were the only ones to get our consideration!  Pictures and price lead us to our selection of  a room at The Tides- A QUAINT and CHARMING 21 room inn, that in no time at all,

Summary Heading: Your vacation awaits you at the The Tides
Summary: My friend and I loved our stay at The Tides. Can you imagine for our first visit how close were were to everything fun like the beach, the great restaurants and bars, and shopping? We also loved it because we felt like we were "away from all the action" once we retreated to the room. The room was comfortable-a comfortable mattress-a cute kitchenette, a solid shower-everything was clean and cozy. In the evenings, the fire by the pool was the perfect place to relax. We had a hard time with the fan (a/c?) in the room--we tried everything to get it to run (except ask for help), but the windows open created a nice breeze. Yes, you'll hear the road noise, but they have earplugs. We talked about coming back and staying at The Tides. The people there couldn't be nicer.

Summary Heading: This was our second stay at the tides and we loved it. Very clean rooms, convenient to everything, and extra friendly st
Summary: This was our second stay at the tides and we loved it. Very clean rooms, convenient to everything, and extra friendly staff. They will bend over backwards for anything that you need. The rooms are large and very comfortable. I would highly recommend staying at the tides!

Summary: Great location for exploring Laguna Beach. Parking is free for 1 car but large vehicles need to park behind the hotel. My room had a kitchenette which was useful. The only negative point I can say is if you are in a ground floor room, you hear anything above you. Pet fee is a bit steep $25/pet per night. I have 2 dogs so that slapped $100 to my bill. I used DoorDash and had my dinner delivered to my hotel room almost like room service.

Summary: Check in was quick and easy with very friendly staff. Room was a good size and having a kitchen was a plus. It was only a short walk into town so a great location. We requested a second night and were given the same rate. This motel seems to be very well run with great staff.Would definitely recommend this motel in Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Clean, cozy, and a great location!
Summary: We booked here last minute and what a great choice we made! The staff is so attentive, and able to suit every need.  There is free parking on the premises.  We had a room with 2 queen beds and kitchenette.  The beds were very comfortable.  The room was spacious and super clean.  They have beach towels and chairs if needed.  Bathroom had a stand up shower.  They also have a salt water heated pool.  It has rooms on 3 levels and is a block across from a great park overlooking the beach.  It is walking distance from the main city area- plenty of shops and restaurants.  Would definitely return here.

Summary: Excellent stay.  Anderson was amazing and a real help. Sara was awesome too. They both take care of there guest. Very close to the beach 2 min walk. Walking distance from urth coffee awesome place. Pavilion grocery is 5 min walk. As I visited with family and small kids a grocery store near was a must. Walking distance.  I recommend adding a sofa and making the dining table small so to accommodate the sofa.

Summary Heading: The way EVERY Hotel should Operate
Summary: An adorable, old school beach hotel.  So welcoming, accomodating and the staff just so authentically nice.  They let us check in early, called us when our room was ready and even wrote us a personalized thank you note for staying there.  The location is near everything and private  enough to go back to your room to relax.  Dishes, glasses, microwave, Keurig, fridge all in the room.  We will be back again. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Summary: Excellent time at The Tides.  I stayed at The Tides due to its price and proximity to the Laguna Art Museum.  The room was clean & comfortable, as well as safe.  It also had a charming decor.  On site is a pool & parking.

Summary: We stayed one night and this had good reviews on Booking.com.  We had a queen size suite with a kitchenette.  The room was quaint with a day bed in the living room.  There were 2 TVs. The hotel was centrally located around town and close to restaurants.  It was one block from Heisler Park, which was lovely and right on the beach.  We enjoyed beautiful sunset.  We were in room 101.  It was on Coast Hwy and it was loud even at night.  This along with the limited parking are our only complaint.  The people at the front desk were nice.  We‚Äôll stay here again and ask for a room at the back where it is quieter.

Summary: This place is cute as can be. It's right on the main street but easy to miss (I drove right by it the first time). I spent hours at the outdoor activity area with fireplace and heated saltwater pool. Anderson in the front office was always available to help. The room was spotless and the bed was comfortable. Easy walk to the beach and restaurants/shops. I would def recommend this hotel to others.

Summary: Another perfect stay at The Tides.  No surprises, always clean, friendly and helpful.  Great location with the feel of old Laguna, laid back and comfy.  Great location, easy walk to beach, restaurants, shops, and Laguna Playhouse.

Summary: I booked this hotel bc of the great deal/price for an impromptu birthday weekend get away with my little one. Such a cute hotel.. room was clean and Beachey themed.. location is great, staff is absolutely wonderful, accommodating and friendly. I even had a handwritten card waiting in my room upon arrival. Summary: This motel has a great location, very close to the beach and downtown LB. There is plenty of great restaurants close by. The rooms are really nice. The front desk staff very pleasant and easy to work with. If I am in LB again, I would definitely stay there!

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly atmosphere, good rooms
Summary: Stayed for 10 nights, and really enjoyed our stay. Initially disappointed by lack of facilities in the kitchen (only a microwave and coffee machine - so couldn't even make tea), but this was swiftly rectified by Anderson and his colleagues. Kettle, hot-plate etc all provided.    The location is great - around 10mins door-to-beach, and decent supermarket around the same distance. Central Laguna Beach is maybe 15mins away (and there are walks into the hills to the East).      The pool area is pretty good (though traffic noise - not really noticeable in the rooms - was an issue at times).     Overall, really nice friendly place to spend 10 nights. Wd certainly return and recommend.

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights for my wife's birthday and will definitely be back! As others have mentioned, the location is PRIME. The front desk staff were all very kind and knowledgeable too..they even had beach towels/gear for us to borrow. The one negative was the shower head in our room was sort of crappy (it worked fine but was angled weird and hard to navigate), but everything else was so great I didn't feel this was worth taking a rating away.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights in October. Nice accommodation friendly staff. We had a room with a kitchen area which was very useful. Pool is nice. Summary: The Tides Inn has a great location and the rooms are clean and spacious.  Many have kitchens.  The place has a 1960s feel to it that is quite charming.  Best of all are the staff people who are helpful, kind, and efficient.

Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Affordably comfort in a beautiful town.

Summary: The Tide is just a short walk into the heart of town and beaches.  We parked our car the entire time there. The host was always there and ready to offer ideas for visiting the area. Summary: Fifth year staying here, excellent and friendly staff, great clean room. We love the location, close to the beach, we can walk downtown to all of the attractions. There is a free bus on Sunday for us to go visit the south end of town/beaches. We plan to be back!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for continuing to keep us in mind. We appreciate and are so grateful for you. We will make sure to share your remarks with Thomas and our entire staff as we're sure they'll be thrilled to hear about it. We look forward to welcoming you and your hubby back home again. Summary: We have stayed in most all of the rooms except the street rooms. Even though it is all close to PCH the traffic gets quiet at night. The rooms are charming and beds comfortable. Staff is very attentive. This was a winter trip and I really enjoyed it!

Summary: This place was very clean , comfortable and very centrally located . Staff very friendly and helpful !!  The minute we walked in , the room smelled very clean , had all the amenities. I would definitely stay here again!!

Anderson was most helpful when I had a crisis at 5:30 one morning! I can't thank him enough for his help! Our location is perfect as it is situated across the street from beautiful Heisler Park and just a couple blocks north of downtown Laguna Beach, all within walking distance. We stayed in 209 which was on the high end pricewise but included 2 beds, a very small bathroom, a 2nd room with refrigerator and microwave and small table with 2 chairs, and a sliver of a view of the ocean in the distance above the rooftops. It also had 2 chairs on the balcony outside the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a detailed review of your stay. Manager Response: We're so happy you found us and enjoyed your stay. We appreciate you taking the time to give us a wonderful review. Manager Response: You are our family and we'd like to think we are your 2nd home in Laguna Beach. We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us along with our convenient location to the beautiful beaches and coves and downtown Laguna Beach. We agree, our pool area is a relaxing place to be especially at night when we have the fireplace on. Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback and we hope to see you again :)

Summary: The Tides Laguna Beach is a quaint hotel close to the beach and downtown Laguna Beach.  The staff was so helpful and friendly.  The room was perfect, clean with a nice kitchenette area.  The pool area was the perfect place to relax and take a nice swim.
Manager Response: We're so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us and thank you for taking the time to give us such a wonderful review. We hope to see you again and thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Best Way To Celebrate a Birthday
Summary: This was our 5th visit to The Tides. We took advantage of the "Birthday Special". As always, we had a wonderful stay. Our room was spacious and bright. I was surprised to find a birthday card with a handwritten note inside, and a package of cookies, waiting for me. What a lovely touch! Everything we needed was just a 5 minute walk- dining, shopping, and the beautiful views of the ocean from Heisler Park. We even had the time to enjoy the inviting pool. Thanks to everyone at The Tides for your kindness and helpfulness.
Manager Response: We are so grateful to welcome you back and be a part of your special day. We like to think that we are your second home here in beautiful Laguna Beach. We also love the fact that we are within short walking distance to Heisler Park and the wonderful shops and restaurants Laguna has to offer. Our heated salt water pool is a nice place to be and hanging out by the fireplace at night after a long day exploring is so relaxing. Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to see you again :)

Summary Heading: We love this place, would you...?
Summary: I can gush about how terrific this place is, and it is. Easily the best deal in Laguna Beach, but not ‚Äúcheap.‚Äù There‚Äôs four star service, lovely facilities and stellar management. The thing to consider is that this is a lovingly renovated older motel. Quaint room layouts, beachside decor. Some aspects are a bit dated. But come here, be willing to love this amazingly affordable, pet-friendly motel, across the street from the beach. This is a secret gem for good reason, and those who love The Tides know why. Find out for yourself.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review and for the kind words. It means a lot to us. We strive for service, value, and cleanliness and want our guests to feel that this is their second home in beautiful Laguna Beach. All of our guest rooms are uniquely decorated and we have an excellent location to Heisler Park and other little local beaches along with downtown Laguna Beach. It's a pleasure having you stay with us and we look forward to your next visit. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: This hotel is a great place to stay in the heart of Laguna Beach. I stayed here after my daughter's wedding, & also got a room for her & her new husband. We chose the 2 quietest rooms (you may select your rooms). There was an outer door before getting to the actual room door so yes, very quiet. Room was small but very clean. Nice personal touches (personal welcome & thank you notes from management along with Milano cookies, water bottles, earplugs & Keurig cups) were appreciated. My only complaint was with the AC which cycled on & off much too frequently. Best of all & one of the main reasons I chose this hotel was that, unlike others in the area, there was no charge for parking in their lot and no resort fee. They are also pet-friendly although we didn't need that. Las Brisas
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us such wonderful and positive feedback. We appreciate you and are grateful to be a part of your daughter's special day. We're so happy you enjoyed the rooms you booked and that we were able to make you feel comfortable and at home. Our service, location and value are a few of the reasons why guests love to stay with us. Overall, we hope you guys enjoyed beautiful Laguna Beach and congratulations to your daughter. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Love this hotel. Cute clean rooms. Comfortabl beds.We had the kitchenette. It had everything we needed, plates, silverware, etc. Nice pool area with fireplace that had comfortable seating. BBQ with nice size side bar and mini fridge. Some beaches, market and restaurants are walking distance. Very friendly staff.
Manager Response: We love you too! Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We're so happy you enjoyed your room along with our pool area with the heated salt water pool, gas grill, and of course the fireplace where you can relax after a day of exploring beautiful Laguna Beach. We are grateful to have had the opportunity to host your recent visit and look forward to seeing you again. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Very clean and super friendly.  Even gave us a bottle of wine and card for my husband's birthday - and got the birthday discount.  Convenient location to our favorite restaurant a few blocks away - Urth Cafe.  We'll be back!
Manager Response: It was a pleasure having you and your husband stay with us while celebrating his birthday. We are grateful to be part of his special day and are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us in beautiful Laguna Beach. Our birthday special is a little gift to you. We look forward to seeing you guys again. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Local Who Comes Home For Visits
Summary: I wouldn't stay anywhere else! I come 'home' to Laguna every summer. The Tides is an authentic Laguna experience. If you so choose, you can park the car and walk everywhere during your stay. The kitchenettes are a wonderful option to have so that you can 'eat in'. The staff is helpful and welcoming, they make the whole package!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review and for your kind words. It means a lot to us as we'd like to think we are your second home here in beautiful Laguna Beach. We want to make you feel welcome and as comfortable and at home as possible and we were able to do that with you. We agree with our convenient location to Heisler Park and downtown Laguna Beach that you can take a nice stroll to and enjoy the atmosphere of Laguna Beach, which also includes many art galleries. Thank you for the opportunity to host you and we look forward to your next visit with us :)

Summary: As soon as we arrived in our room, I noticed our duvet cover wasn't clean. I called the office about it, in which she quickly asked if there were orange stains on the duvet. I said yes, but before i had a chance to say that the duvet looked used, she went on to say that their washer (or dryer?) causes these stains when they wash the duvets. You would think they would buy a new washing machine if it's making their duvets look stained. But as I had stated earlier, the duvet looked like it had been used from previous guest without having been changed, so i flipped it over, which was much better. Then i discovered there's was no remote control in our room, which later I wondered if they removed it on purpose. My husband went to the office and got a new remote, but it didn't work.
Manager Response: Hi Cheryl, thank you for taking the time to give us your candid feedback. We sincerely apologize for your experience with us this past Labor Day weekend. We are in the process of replacing our washing machines today and would like to reassure you that we always wash and replace our duvet covers especially for new arrivals and during a guest's stay as needed or requested. Since the TV in your room is mounted higher up on the wall and Julie had leg surgery she asked your husband if he could see if the TV power plug was loose from the outlet. We had to reprogram the TV remote for your room and before leaving the room your husband actually tested the remote to make sure it worked properly and it did for him while we were there. Again, we apologize for the mishaps in your room, but we're glad they were able to be resolved.  We're glad you found the jets from our heated salt water calming and relaxing. It is a nice place to be especially at night when we have our fireplace going.  Room 214 is labeled the "Marilyn Monroe" room by some of our guests and some that room specifically. We agree with the location of the room and also the fact that you can see a slight view of the water from across the street from its location. Sunsets are definitely beautiful from there as well.  We have other room types and all of our rooms are uniquely decorated. Our rates were higher than usual this past weekend, as it was for other properties in the area, due to the fact that it was a busy Labor Day weekend. We pride ourselves on service, cleanliness and value and we're confident that compared to other properties in Laguna Beach, our accommodations and location cannot be beat. We also do not charge for parking and do not have any resort fees associated with your stay.  Thank you again for your feedback as we appreciate and value you sharing your experience with us. Should your travels bring you back to beautiful Laguna Beach, we hope you can keep us in mind the next time to show you what your experience at The Tides should have been like. We want all of our guests to feel comfortable and at home when they stay with us. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Cute older hotel with a great location
Summary: Enjoyed my stay. The location and ease of getting to the beach were definite pluses. The staff could not have been more courteous or helpful. Only two negatives are the size of the shower and the window air conditioner cycling on and off. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: It was a pleasure having you stay with us Dale and we thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We are so happy you found our location convenient to the beautiful beaches as all of our guests do. We want to make you feel welcome and at home and we're glad we were able to take care of you during your recent visit to Laguna Beach. We look forward to having the opportunity to host your next visit. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Heisler Park, Laguna Art Museum, Royal Hawaiian, Urth and the Laguna shoreline ALL a short block across PCH. Employees competent,  welcoming and attentive. Place is older but clean and well kept. Price for high season across from the beach is pretty dang good! Parking a little tricky but all in all a great value.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We are so happy you enjoyed our convenient location to the many good eateries and beautiful beaches. We'd like to think that we are your second home in Laguna Beach. Service and cleanliness are what we strive for and we're glad we were able provide that for you. Yes, summer is our peak season and we're glad you found value in staying with us as we have an excellent location across from Heisler Park and do not charge for parking or have any resort fees. We hope you keep us in mind the next time you visit Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: We were in Laguna for the Pageant and some fun, Just an overnighter but what a wonderful place!! We were able to get into our room earlier than expected which complimented our day. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Julie gave us directions and hints for our art experience as well as bringing us Ice. Great amenities such as real cream for our coffee and free water! What a quaint and charming hotel would definitely stay again!!
Manager Response: It was a pleasure meeting and having you ladies stay with us. We are so happy you guys enjoyed your stay with us while visiting for the Pageant of the Masters. Julie is wonderful and we are so happy she was able to take care of you guys during your stay. We hope to be able to have the opportunity to host you guys again the next time you are visiting beautiful Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Great stay close to the Festival of Arts
Summary: Our room (#206) was spacious and clean.  I was worried about the traffic noise, since the property is on a busy highway, but we ran the A/C unit all night and we didn't hear anything else.  The property is close proximity to the main beach, restaurants and the Festival of Arts.  We were able to walk and leave our car.  The bed was extremely comfortable, and we had a good night's sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review, Liz! We are so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay in room 206. One of the main things our guests love about staying with us is our proximity to the beautiful beaches, shops and eateries, and of course the Festival of Arts and Pageant of the Masters. We can't forget about the Sawdust Art Festival as well. We love taking care of our guests and are glad we were able to that with you. We hope we are able to host you again on your next visit to beautiful Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: This was our second stay at the Tides in Laguna Beach. We lived room 104. Two nice beds, small kitchen area, dining table, great water pressure in the shower. Beach chairs and towels if you need them. Love the pool area with fireplace. We enjoy the location and close access to everything. We will definitely return
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review Michael and for staying with us a second time. We're so happy you enjoyed your stay in room 104. We love our pool area too with the heated salt water pool and gas grill along with the fireplace you can sit and relax at after a day spent in beautiful Laguna Beach. All of our guests love our convenient location to the beaches and downtown Laguna Beach. We look forward to your next visit. Thank you again for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: This hotel was was fabulous, it‚Äôs location, the pool, the clean and spacious rooms, but most of all was the service. We were cared for by the kindest hotel staff. Everything we needed was delivered to us. The staff went above and beyond, which made our trip to Laguna Beach even better. We definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful and positive review as it means a lot to us. We are so happy you and your family enjoyed your stay with us in beautiful Laguna Beach. Our goal is to make you feel comfortable and at home during your visit and we're glad we were able to do that for you. We look forward to hosting your next visit. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Family stay at the Tides Inn. Had a few issues with our room but these where resolved by the management.  The Tides is a 10 minute walk from Main Beach, nice pool, rooms are old and fairly basic. Free parking is a bonus in Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback as it will help us improve for the future. We're glad you enjoyed our convenient location to Main Beach along with our heated salt water pool. Parking is limited and a premium in Laguna Beach and we're happy you enjoyed our complimentary parking. We hope to have another opportunity to host you and your family in the future so you can see the upgrades we will be making. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: This little motel has Sweet grounds with lots of character, quiet and comfy rooms.    We found the staff, Julie and Anderson very friendly and helpful during our short stay? One of our rooms had a kitchenette and had all comforts of home. We definitely will be back!
Manager Response: We're so happy to read that you enjoyed your short stay with us. We appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback and are glad you felt comfortable and at home as we'd like to think we are your second home here in beautiful Laguna Beach.We look forward to hosting you on your next visit and hopefully a longer one. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: This was my first stay at The Tides and I am looking forward to an opportunity to stay there again.  I arrived very early on a Sunday morning and, although it was too early to check in, Anderson allowed me to leave my bag in his office while I went "exploring".  He called me when my room was ready and even placed my bag in the room so it was there when I returned. There was also a nice, handwritten "welcome" card addressed to me on the nightstand.  The room was clean, bright, and very comfortable with a full kitchenette that proved to be a plus for me.  The location was perfect for me because I did not have a car and was able to walk anywhere I wanted to go.  Anderson and his staff were very friendly and accommodating; I look forward to staying with them again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a such wonderful review and for your kind words. Hearing such feedback from our guests is such a compliment and means a lot to us. Our goal is to make every guest feel comfortable and at home and we're happy to read that we were able to do that with you. Our guests love our location due to the easy and nice walk to the beautiful beaches and downtown Laguna Beach with all the good eateries and shops and our staff is always here to help however we can. We look forward to the next time we can host your visit to beautiful Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Our only regret: we stayed just three nights
Summary: The biggest regret we had about the Tides is that we only stayed 3 nights.  Like most of the Laguna Beach accommodation, the Tides is located on a main road. But this did not bother us at all. We did not have any problems with traffic noise. The Tides is a short walk to the beach and to the main town for Laguna restaurants, bars and cafes. What really made our stay were the Tides‚Äô friendly and very helpful personnel. Would we stay again at the Tides? Yes. Would we recommend the Tides? Definitely.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words; it means a lot to us. We want to make every one of our guests feel comfortable and at home and we are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us. Our guests love our convenient location as we are far enough from the "craziness", but close enough to walk to the beautiful beaches and downtown for the shops, eateries and art galleries. We look forward to your next visit with us. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: We have stayed at The Tides quite a few times. The owner and staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are nice with keurig coffee makers and some with kitchenettes. The location is great and within walking distance to two great restaurants that serve breakfast. It is also with walking distance to town. In the summer parking can be difficult so this is a real plus. We will return to The Tides.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your review, Lynn. We're all here to make you feel comfortable and at home when you are visiting beautiful Laguna Beach and we're so happy to read that you enjoy our rooms and convenient location to the good eateries, beaches, and downtown Laguna Beach. Parking is limited and a premium in Laguna Beach and we're glad to offer complimentary parking for our wonderful guests. We look forward to your next visit with us. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: I've been here many times. This is my prequil to my upcoming check-in on my birthday. I love this place, and Anderson is a joy. I can't wait to enjoy the wonderful room, lovely amenities and fabulous location across the street from Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words and we can't wait until your birthday either. Our guests love our Birthday Special as it is our little gift to you and we're grateful that we can be part of your special day. We look forward to your visit and thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: old school motel with contemporary flair
Summary: Loved our stay at The Tides. Sparkling Immaculate. Hardwood floors, spacious room w/fireplace, bath, comfortable beds, nice linens. immpecible attention to detail. Gorgeous pool and outdoor fireplace.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us your feedback and for your wonderful words. We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us in beautiful Laguna Beach and we hope to see you guys again. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Great location but needs an update
Summary: Pool area with bbq and fire pit was great. Lovely touch in the evening (we were there 6 nights and made use of the bbq one evening for dinner). Location is great. 5/10 minutes walk to Downtown Laguna and 5 minutes to the beach. Also 5 minute walk to a large supermarket. Only down side was the room. It was very outdated. When we arrived there was almost an old, dusty smell in the room. Air conditioning was poor. Kitchen was ok. Bathroom was very small and my 6‚Äù4 husband could barely fit in the shower.
Manager Response: Shannon, we are so happy to read that you and your husband enjoyed our lovely pool area with the fireplace and gas grill and also our convenient location to downtown Laguna Beach and the beach. We appreciate your feedback and will take them into consideration when making future improvements. We hope to be able to have the opportunity to host you in the future if you come back to visit beautiful Laguna Beach. Thank you again for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Would of loved to give a five star , the staff were great , the pool area was lovely . However our room did not live up to expectation, we were on the second floor in a corner , no fridge or microwave not a biggie , but the room was so small , once we put our 2 cases down there was no floor space . The shower was really small and needed an update . All very pretty but unpractical. No iron or board , no clock . I‚Äôm sure if we had of asked they may have sorted these things out , but for one night with lots to see and do it really didn‚Äôt seem worthwhile .
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback Christina. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed our staff and lovely pool area. We do have items like irons and ironing boards upon request and are always more than happy to assist you in any way we can during your stay. Nevertheless, will use your feedback to improve for the future. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Great place in Laguna Beach, Big room and we got kitchen also with fridge, Kingsize bed is very comfortable. Many restaurants in walking distance and great breakfast at Urth Caffe close. Short walk to nice small beach, Yes I would stay at The Tides agian !
Manager Response: We're so happy you enjoyed your stay with us in beautiful Laguna Beach. We hope to have the opportunity to host you again. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Tides is not only a family-run business; they truly go out of their way to make you feel at home. Whether it be sand toys for the kiddos to enjoy at the beach or extra towels for pool time - they are always on call. Rooms are super clean and venue is only a block away from the beach! Awesome place for business, personal, or family travel!
Manager Response: Your wonderful review means a lot to us and we thank you and appreciate you taking the time. We're so happy to read that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to seeing you guys again. Thank you so much for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: I was here for a week in May. Stayed in room 103. So cute! Room was perfect for my stay, the kitchenette was a plus. Nice clean room, staff was very nice. The weather was not beach weather so I didn't really get to enjoy the pool, but it was right outside of my room. Nice fireplace and a place to chill at night. Free parking was a huge plus.  Breakfast every day at Urthh was so good! You can walk to it in minutes. The beach is right across the street. Great location, very comfy hotel, I would definitely go back here.
Manager Response: We're so happy that you found us and enjoyed your stay in room 103. We love it that you were able to enjoy the fireplace at night along with our complimentary parking and convenient location to the wonderful eateries and beaches in beautiful Laguna Beach. We hope to see you again. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: I loved this hotel! It's location is awesome, close to the beach and the main attractions. The heated salt water pool is just awesome bc Cali can be cold at times and we know that ocean is cold too :) The bed and pillows are so comfy!!! My husband and I slept better than home!  The room is cute and functional, loved having a kitchen and a bathtub is nice! I also liked having the ac/heat unit by the bed bc it created a nice noise to drown out any noise.  The staff is great! There's free parking and beach towels/chairs. I'm so glad I booked here!
Manager Response: Jessica, thank you so much for taking the time to give us such a wonderful review; it means a lot to us. We're so happy to read that you thoroughly enjoyed what Laguna Beach has to offer and that you enjoyed your stay with us as well. We appreciate and value your feedback. We hope to have the opportunity to host you and your husband in the future. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: The Tides Laguna Beach is an older place but the rooms are nice. The location is right on the main highway and there is free parking. The ocean is only a block away and the motel is within walking distance to shops and restaurants.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay in beautiful Laguna Beach and thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Stayed here by happenstance with a girl friend on a California road trip. We both loved the old California feel so much. She even booked it for her daughters and granddaughters for the art festival. Would love to come back
Manager Response: We are so happy you guys found us and thank you for sharing your experience with. We look forward to seeing you guys in the summer for the Sawdust Art Festival. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Very quaint hotel in a lovely location
Summary: Stayed here for 1 night while visiting Laguna beach and it is set in an absolutely stunning location with easy access to the various sandy beaches on offer.  The only thing preventing me giving it 5* is the bathroom. We stayed in a room on the ground floor and the shower sprayed water everywhere and the toilet was loose. There is no fan in the bathroom so it smells damp and the blinds in the bedroom don‚Äôt fully block out the light.  However you get a fridge, toaster and microwave as well as coffee in the room which is awesome.  I‚Äôd definitely stay again if visiting Laguna beach
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a review Martin. We are so happy to read that you enjoyed our location to the beautiful beaches in Laguna Beach. We will address the check and address the issues you mentioned and appreciate you letting us know. We hope you had a wonderful time and look forward to hosting your next visit to Laguna Beach :)

Summary: Stayed here in March 2018.  Went with my son and family and stayed one night.  Small but very cozy room and within walking distance of beach, shops and restaurants.  Would stay here again and recommend this Inn.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed a family get together at the tides and have to say that the personal service makes you feel like you are being invited into their home. We have stayed at many places in Laguna over the years, both pricey and budget, on the beach and B&B and for us the tides is the best. Best pricing/value, best location-walking distance to everything, best personal service, great pool. We had some parking needs and they remembered to address our needs months after we had inquired. Not something you would expect them to care about but they did. We suggest that you book a room on the back of the property so as to avoid the street noise on PCH. Other than that, the tides is our choice hotel in Laguna. The best.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Homey, clean, accomodating to ones personal needs. The staff is wonderful! Anderson and Julie, the best!
Summary: I always go here when I want to relax without any fuss. It's simple and clean.  I somehow gather my thoughts here without distraction. It's super close to everything necessary that anyone would want to see or do in Laguna yet seperate from the hustle and bustle of the touristy beach community.  And... it's so close to the gorgeous and more private beaches around Laguna, it's hard not to enjoy this more laid back part of Laguna. And...the clientele isn't the party kind so you can be sure to have a restful night of sleep. It's safe and quiet for couples, families and individuals. You can hear a bit of Hyway One but it's not horrible at all. The pool is preety and clean. Have fun.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The whole stay was perfect.  We received wonderful personalized service.  The reservation and check-in and out were great.  I just love this place and look forward to returning often during my trips to Southern California.  The room was adorable and very comfortable and clean.  The whole stay was just great!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Old school vibe, clean. Great location
Summary: We stayed here for three days last week. The hotel is quaint, very old school vibe. Our room was clean and we liked the pool area with fire pit. Families would enjoy that area a great deal. They even have a nice gas grill and forks for s‚Äômores at the fire pit. Our only issue was the actual room. We were in room 201 on the street facing room upstairs. It is extremely loud due to the highway traffic. Yes they put earplugs in the room but I cannot sleep with those in. The room needs a new mattress and new pillows. Our backs were killing us by the time we left. We would stay here again in a different room that wasn‚Äôt as loud and more updated. The staff was friendly and the location to everything is great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful place great location right near the beach and town, great value for the money. The staff was so kind and gave advice on where to go to. The room was big and homey and the pool and fireplace was an added bonus.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Tides is a charming and comofratble, clean and near SOCal style spot. My bf and I were very happy to walk out and be on the beach in 2 blocks and walk in the sand and wade in the surf. Plenty of yummy food and cafes all in wlaking distance.
Manager Response: We are so happy you and your boyfriend enjoyed your stay with us and thank you for taking the time to write a review, Kiki. We look forward to hosting your next visit to beautiful Laguna Beach. Thank you again for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: We had no previous experience in the area but lucked out in picking The Tides as our place to stay.  Cozy layout, king bed nice pool.  Located in the centre of the shops and restaurants on Coastal Hwy.  We both recommend The Tides.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for choosing The Tides, Diane :)

Summary: My husband and I stayed at The Tides, late July, for three nights. Very clean, didn‚Äôt notice any noise (though earplugs are provided), beautiful location (short walk to view the cliffs and beach), relaxing fire/pool area for evenings. Loved the Keurig and decent sized mini fridge in the room. First trip to CA so we spent our days exploring from San Clemente, Santa Monica, Hollywood, etc...really nice room to come back to each evening. The town is nice. We were there during an art festival so lots of people out and about. We look forward to coming back.
Manager Response: We're so happy to read that you and your husband enjoyed our relaxing pool area in the evening and the beautiful beach across the street. We hope you had a wonderful trip in California and look forward to hosting your next visit. Thank you for choosing The Tides Sandi :)

Summary: Close to market and bbq poolside. Very quite and uncrowded. Every one very helpful, walking distance to ocean, bars and restaurants. Rooms are nice and affordable. Easy check-in and checkout with free parking
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review Vivian. We hope you had a wonderful time in beautiful Laguna Beach and look forward to hosting your next visit. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Great location - great staff and that is basically where it ends.   Our room 101 faced the street which is fine, but we found earplugs in the bedroom and YES they are needed.  Not too mention traffic, but when the room upstairs has someone taking a shower it's as though your in the same room.   The furniture leaves a lot to be desired.   We had folding chairs and a table.  There was a day bed but no couch or seats to relax.   The room smelled musty and it could use a coat of paint.  The air conditioner is in the kitchen area and not in the bedroom.  Thank goodness the nights were cool.  It was clean and well stocked and in a great location of Laguna Beach
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed our convenient location to downtown Laguna Beach and Heisler Park. We know not all beach properties have AC/heating and are happy to say that all of our guest rooms have heating/AC. The room you stayed in does have a ceiling fan in the bedroom area. We very much appreciate and value your feedback as it will help us improve for our future guests; we want your stay to be as enjoyable as possible. We hope you had a wonderful time in beautiful Laguna Beach and hope to have another opportunity to host you in the future. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: My two friends and I made a last minute decision to spend the night at the hotel and we were very glad we did. They had free onsite parking and wifi which was great! They provided a complimentary keurig and there was a mini fridge. The pool area was small but cute with a fire place and lounge chairs. Definitely a nice quick getaway where we could walk 5 minutes to the beach or a relaxing coffee shop. Occasionally we could hear our upstairs neighbors a bit louder than expected, and the views from the actual hotel were not great. But that really did not seem to be a big deal. We‚Äôre glad we stayed.
Manager Response: We're so glad you and your friends decided to stayed with us also Ariel :) Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed our complimentary WiFi and parking as we know parking is very limited in Laguna Beach. Many of our guests enjoy our pool area as well along with the short walk to Heisler Park across the street and to downtown Laguna Beach. We look forward to hosting you again. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Who wants to sleep wearing earplugs?
Summary: We recently stayed at the Tides last week and agree with the below reviews that it is in a great location and the staff is very nice but we had a very bad experience due to the loud AC unit in our room.    We were in room 105 (dog friendly) and the wall AC unit is located by the bed and made very loud noise all night long. They provided ear plugs but who wants to sleep in earplugs?  Couldn't sleep at all.  We thought about complaining... but the fact that they had earplugs by the bed indicated that they'd heard it before.  Overall, if you are looking for a dog friendly hotel with a kitchenette (and are a heavy sleeper) for a short stay...this might be your spot.  It just wasn't for us.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback as we very much appreciate and value it. We're so happy to read that you also enjoyed our location and service but sincerely apologize for the noise from the AC unit in your room; we will look into correcting this matter. As a courtesy, we provide earplugs in all of our guest rooms as we understand every guest is a different type of sleeper. Nevertheless, we hope you enjoyed your stay in beautiful Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: I never expect perfection but I do expect that a place actually CARES about getting it right and The Tides does this very well, they have given thought to little details and you can feel it. I tend to only want to go to the ocean but their saltwater pool was a pleasure to swim in and the outdoor fireplace was very welcoming. Staff was wonderfully helpful, Julie (so easy going) and Larry (on the phone Anderson, Sara) all great. Location is perfect, walking distance to choice beaches and downtown (but not so close that it's teeming with people). We were in Room 101 which is on the PCH side though the kitchen, small living room and bathroom act as a buffer for the bedroom, but we didn't really notice the noise at all. Plus liked how the door to this room has a quiet entrance only
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback as we very much value and appreciate it. Your kind words mean a lot to us. We're so happy you enjoyed our heated salt water pool along with the fireplace. Our location to the beach and downtown is one of the things guests love about our property and we're glad you did too. We hope we have the opportunity to host you again. Thank you so much for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: This little motel was in a convenient location and has a lot of charm about it. We even used the bbq and staff were very helpful in assisting us with extras. We ended up staying another night.  Rooms may have been in the small side but who stays in their room when you are in such an exquisite location.
Manager Response: We're so happy to read you enjoyed the gas grill in our wonderful pool area. Thank you for choosing The Tides and we look forward to hosting you again :)

Summary: The location was good. Pool was good too. Although could do with some more sun loungers on occasions. Our room was generally nice. Attentive staff, couldn't have been more helpful (Julie, Anderson and their housekeeping team)   Would recommend The Tides as a homely nice place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review Lesley. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay in beautiful Laguna Beach and appreciate and value your feedback. We hope to be able to host you again in the future :)

Summary: Thank you for making our stay so pleasant.  All of the staff that we met were fantastic.  Very pleasant and helpful. Our room was cozy and clean.  The hotel's location was close to a great coffee shop and Heisler Park.
Manager Response: We're so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and hope to be able to host you again in the future. Thank you so much for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Reasonable price and yet tastefully designed rooms in a great location just 3 minutes walking distance from the most beautiful beach in town. Friendly and helpful service. The close by restaurants were awesome. We will be back.
Manager Response: We are grateful and appreciate you taking the time to give us a review. We're happy you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit with us. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: On on road trip to US in California, Nevada. Arizona and back to California this hotel became our favourite. We stayed here our 3 last nights in US, and we only regretted that it was not longer. Our family of 4 really appreciated the location of Laguna beach and our room which was perfect. We appreciated the possibility of making our own breakfast in the kitchen, shopping bagels at Shirleys for breakfast and lunch, the wonderful pool and the viscinity to all the nice restsurants, the possibilities for jogging in the hills around Laguna and the free parking. The people working at the Tides were all very friendly. We'll be back next time in California!!
Manager Response: We are so grateful to be a part of your family road trip and happy to read that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We look forward to your next visit! Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: We stopped at the Tides for 4 nights on a road trip up the California coast.  It was a breath of fresh air, welcoming and helpful staff and a charming room which was light and airy with nice individual touches.  The lady who greeted us on arrival gave us lots of information about the hotel and area, and gave us some recommendations for restaurants which turned out to be very good. The nearest beach is a very short walk away and The Tides lend their guests beach towels, sun umbrellas and beach chairs free of charge.  There is a small but attractive swimming pool at the front of the property with water fountains.  Had we stayed longer we might have used it.  Our room overlooked the pool and it looked very inviting.  The Tides is beside the main coast road, but we found it to be
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a review as we very much appreciate and value your feedback.
