We're so happy that you stopped by to stay with us during your road trip up the California coast. What a beautiful drive, isn't it? We want each and every one of our guests to think of us as their home in Laguna Beach and are glad you enjoyed your stay with us along with the beautiful beaches nearby and downtown Laguna Beach. We hope to be able to host you if you visit Laguna Beach again. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: This is my second trip to the Tides.  The people that run the hotel are very nice and helpful. I plan on returning here multiple times in the years to come.  Love this place and location. Especially the Madison Square Garden breakfast nook, walking distance down  the street.
Manager Response: Thank you for keeping The Tides in mind when staying in beautiful Laguna Beach. We're so happy to read you enjoyed your stay and our proximity to downtown Laguna Beach and the many wonderful eateries. We look forward to your next trip with us :)

Summary: We have stayed at the Tides Laguna several times, after many years at a variety of places in Laguna Beach. The majority have become very expensive and we were thrilled to find The Tides was so reasonably priced. It was recommended by a friend who also had her staff use it several times. It was clean, the service was excellent, the pool is delightful, and you get FREE parking, which is a big bonus in this resort town. The rooms are small but the goal is to be outside. The location is quite walkable to the center of town or you can take free shuttles from this area. We are now going to continue to use The Tides for our annual summer retreat to Laguna.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words Bradzmom! We're so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback. We're glad we can be your second home here in Laguna Beach and look forward to hosting your next visit. Thank you, as always, for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: cozy and very clean hotel. great service. love the swimming pool with fireplace area. make sure to close the window at night so you don't hear traffic noise. it is in a good location. i will come back. üëç
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a review Yolanda; it means a lot to us. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to hosting your next visit to beautiful Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: I lived many years in laguna. Now that I am a visitor this hotel feels just like home. Clean and cozy old laguna beach charm. Kitchenette with everything you might need to make a snack or breakfast. Super comfy beds and linens. The staff is always right there and very helpful.  It's just steps away from the park the beach and downtown.  Nothing but love for this place.
Manager Response: We have nothing but love for you! We love all of our guests and are so happy we can be your home here in Laguna Beach. Thank you for taking your time to give us your feedback. We look forward to hosting you on your next visit :)

Summary: Anderson is the best host you can imagine - helpful and courteous. We really enjoyed our stay. He suggested we allow him to move us to a location away from Coast Hwy for quieter stay; suggested several good restaurants; mailed postcards for me; and allowed us to keep car parked for a couple hours after checkout while we walked into town for lunch.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review. We do our best to make sure our guests' stay is comfortable and we're happy to read that you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to your next visit with us :)

Summary: The space felt like home!  We had a room with a kitchen and dinning area and our kids were in an adjoining room. Service was excellent!  I accidentally left my iPad in the room and it was shipped to me free of charge. The staff was welcoming and helpful at all times!  I would recommend this place to all!
Manager Response: We'd like to think we are home here in beautiful Laguna Beach. We're so happy you enjoyed your rooms and look forward to hosting you and your family again. Thanks so much for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Perfect motel in every way for Laguna Beach!
Summary: Great place to stay for the 'Festival of Arts!'  Perfectly kept & updated older motel . . . great location just half a block away from free shuttle.  Rare self-parking, a plus.  Wonderfully friendly & helpful staff, especially Julie.  Totally enjoyable place all around.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a review. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed our location. Julie IS wonderful! Thank you for choosing The Tides. We hope to be able to host you again :)

Summary: Selected the Tides mainly for its location in the center of town, lots of attractions and restaurants within walking distance.  It's an older place, but well kept up and very clean.  We loved the fact that they actually furnish two luggage racks, something that even the higher priced places don't do.  We also liked the furnishings, a kitchen table and two comfortable chairs to relax and have a glass of wine at.  The bathroom was OK, just a bit on the antique side.  In the morning, we went to make a couple of cups of coffee, only to find that the coffee pods for the Keurig were absent!  The GF had to go to the office to obtain a couple of pods to get us going.  Close to the beach and good walking areas.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a review Donald. We're happy to read that you enjoyed our convenient location to downtown Laguna Beach and beautiful Heisler Park. Thank you for choosing The Tides and we hope to see you again! :)

Summary Heading: Awesome staff, great pool & location, good rooms
Summary: We had a bad experience and were fleeing another Laguna hotel/motel. We tried The Tides on a whim and were delightfully surprised. As other reviews have mentioned, the staff is delightfully cheerful, helpful, and welcoming. For its size, the pool area was exceptionally deep and nice (separate grilling areas, sitting areas, in-pool streaming "fountains" and a fireplace!) and beach access was a short (two block) walk away. Our room was completely clean and decorated/painted with light colors, which helped it feel larger. Although this motel is next to the main street, a large wall of mixed brick and ivy gives it a degree of privacy. After trying to rent a slightly cheaper room in a nearby motel, I wish I had paid slightly more and gone here first.
Manager Response: We are so happy you found and tried us. Many of our guests enjoy our spacious pool area along with our location to the beach and downtown Laguna Beach and we are so glad you did as well. We hope to be able to host you again in the future. Thanks so much for choosing The Tides :)

Summary Heading: Charming hotel - close to the beach
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at this nice and beautiful small hotel. The staff was very helpful. The room nicely decorated and very clean. Bed is very comfortable.The street is nearby and therefore there is a little bit of traffic noise, but that did not bother us. We enjoyed the short walk to the beautiful beaches, the shops and the restaurants! The hotel offers everything you need for the beach complimentary from towels over chairs to sand toys!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us a review Juliane. We're glad to read you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again! :)

Summary: You are paying for location!  This is not a swanky hotel but it is okay.  Older -- (old) hotel. Our toilet did leak and the management just had us put down a towel and that worked.  It has a Kerigic (ms) so coffee is good.  Refrigerator and microwave in rooms. Beds were very comfortable.  Floor is Tile.  It takes about 20 minutes to walk to Pageant of the Masters.  Restaurants easily walked to.  Parking is tight but very manageable ( I have a midsize car).  It is very noisy because PCH is right there so they do provide earplugs by the bed.  Shower was very good with plenty of hot water and water pressure was great.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is in a great location, walking distance from the heart of laguna, restaurants shopping and the beach. relatively quiet despite it being on the coast hwy. Quiet air conditioner. comfortable beds, ample free parking
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay near the beach with family
Summary: Myself, husband, mother and mother in law stayed here as a delightful detour on the way to visit family and attend a wedding. This hotel exceeded my expectation. My intent was to find a clean inexpensive inn for a one night stay. We were in California for about 5 days. Decided last minute to sneak off for a beach day as my mother in law is from central Mississippi and had NEVER seen a beach like Laguna. As it was an unplanned expense, no frills were needed. This boutique inn was clean and charming. The d√©cor is more "homey" than standard hotel d√©cor.  If you are looking for modern this is not the place for you. However, if you love a bit of charm, you are in the right place. The location is perfect within walking distance to restaurants, art galleries and best of all the beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose it for the location and a mid-price range.  It has onsite free parking, coffee machines and a cheerful staff.  The books and art pieces were a nice Laguna Beach touch.  Definitely a "family" place that allows dogs in some rooms.  Bad part: stains, peeling paint, food splatters, broken controls on AC unit, ongoing traffic noise, chipped furniture and a number of other areas of deferred maintenance.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Second Stay at This Boutique Inn
Summary: My family and I have now traveled to Laguna Beach twice over the past few years and have chose to stay at the same inn. The location is absolutely prime! It is located near the north end of town, but is within walking distance of downtown (less than 10 minutes) and more importantly for us; the beach! This inn is located within two blocks of Heisler Park which is my husbands and my favorite spot in Laguna. There are several art galleries and fabulous restaurants located very close; no need to ever take your car from it's Free Parking spot.  The staff are simply amazing! Traveling with a child can have demands of its own, but they met and exceeded every one of our requests! There are so many extras available for everyone to use from beach chairs, umbrellas, beach toys for the kids
Manager Response: none

Summary: I would disagree with the recent negative reviews of this property. It is a bit pricey, but come on, it's location would justify the price. Finding a better priced hotel in Laguna Beach is difficult to downright impossible, I should know I tried. We stayed here for 1 night , two families on a west coast trip. We reserved rooms 107 & 108, we found them to be clean, if a bit dated. The location of the hotel is within easy walking distance to the beach, ( Main among others ) and close to restaurants and shops . The staff was warm, friendly, and helpful . The pool area was nice and well maintained. Surely there are better accommodations to be found in Laguna, but not at this price. Would stay here again . Would suggest 2nd floor as first was a tad noisy .
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff at The Tides are all very well trained, accommodating, eager to please. That being said, the property is old, dated, not well maintained. The rooms look like they were furnished at a thrift store. Linens were thin, fixtures dated. There was a lot of noise from the street and the alley. Even the provided ear plugs didn't cut the sound of traffic nor garbage trucks.  Laguna Beach is a very expensive area, but The Tides was not worth the nightly rate. We'd have done better somewhere else.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I reserved this hotel for a two-night stay. The rooms was in need of maintenance and upkeep. Paint was chipped away in every room, all the towels, sheets and linens had weird orange stains.  They nicely offered to change the bed linens, but even the new linens had the orange stains (which they said are from their laundry service).  We found hair in the bed and ultimately decided it wasn't worth staying.  Though the management was kind enough to give us a full refund.   I know places by the beach tend to be more expensive because of the location, but I didn't think this was worth the price (about $250/night).
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Kind staff but hotel dirty and not clean
Summary: Two stars for the staff only. The customer service was great and the staff was nice but we could not stay in the hotel. The hotel was not cleaned to our standards. It is an older hotel but the walls were scuffed up and stained, and the furniture and lights were dusty. There was stains on the sheets and towels and hair on our pillows. When we called to complain they changed our sheets but the new sheets still had stains. The front desk apologized and explained they get their laundry done from an outside place and offered us a refund. We appreciated the kindness of the staff but we ended up taking the refund and staying somewhere else.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we made our reservation, we inquired about parking for large vehicles.  On arrival, we didn't even get all the way in the parking lot and she came out to greet us and explain that they had coned off a parking spot for us. (How did she know it was us?)  We weren't familiar with the area and asked for restaurant recommendations.  We went to two of the places they told us about and both were perfect, just like they said.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The pool was inviting.  We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, comfy beds, quiet room!
Summary: We stayed here for just one night while driving down the coast visiting several beach towns.  Our room was upstairs and faced a back "alley"/side street that was very quiet.  Had 2 double beds that were very comfortable.  They lent us beach chairs and towels both days which we really appreciated.  Loved Laguna Beach and would definitely return to The Tides next time we are in the area!
Manager Response: none

Summary: After reading many reviews, we decided to book a room at The Tides on our family road trip. We were so happy with our choice! This is a renovated motel and has been nicely done. Here are all of the reasons why we loved The Tides (2 teen girl/family road trip)  1) Great location and great price! - We are on a long road trip and needed affordable rooms, but wanted to get to the beach. The location is within walking distance of restaurants and Heissler Park- to the park, you merely walk to the intersection and cross the street and you can see the ocean. The park is beautiful and we loved the small, quiet beach area.   2) Well appointed rooms - it's the little things that make you feel "cared for" - great customer service, fluffy, thick towels, comfortable beds and sheets, clean
Manager Response: none

Summary: We often stay at the Tides, just a bit north...near the art museum and Las Brisis. Excellent service, quaint and accommodating rooms, and wonderful (and welcoming) staff. There are bigger, fancy and more expensive places, but none better for a getaway.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good old fashioned style and service
Summary: This quaint place is reasonably priced and walking distance to restaurants, market and most importantly three different beautiful cove type beaches beaches. Some of the rooms need new paint or flooring but that's minor to me and the pool is heated and clean and the BBQ area is lovely. They have beach chairs to use and staff are very helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: my favorite place to stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: I've been coming here for years and I've always had a wonderful stay.  Rooms are all differently furnished (some with kitchens), all with small fridge and pod coffee maker. Beds are super comfy and rooms are always spotless.  There is a lovely seating area near the pool with a gas fireplace (and it's always lit at night!). The hotel is on the opposite side of the beach, but you only have to walk across the street to get to the Heisler park and the beach, and the main beach is just north, a 5-10 minute walk. The owner, Anderson, is always helpful and kind. The office has wine glasses for your use too. We have often bought a pizza at Gino's next door and brought it back to eat by the fireplace (there is a low table and sofas around it) with a bottle of wine. Relaxing and
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Tides is a wonderful small hotel on Laguna's north side...and our favorite place to stay in Laguna Beach.  Anderson and the staff are friendly and helpful; just ask. Our room (top floor) was comfortable, great beds, with a full kitchen. The pool area is spacious and has a BBQ. The property is close enough to walk to beach, Heisler Park, art museum and downtown, but slightly away from crowds. We've stayed there several times, will do so again, and definitely recommend it to others.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This wonderful little property provides every amenity, amazing beds and everything you need for a wonderful beach-front getaway. And it is affordable! This intimate, beautiful little hotel features charming manager Anderson, who meets every request. Lovely!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Solid and affordable choice in Laguna Beach
Summary: Stayed recently for two nights at The Tides and I left happy with my choice.  It was close to town and everything was walkable.  The property and staff were all lovely.  The rooms are simple but comfortable and have everything you need.  The free parking helped top it off.  Also loved being able to borrow beach chairs.  Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We're so happy you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for taking the time to give us a review as it means a lot to us. We look forward to hosting you again when you visit beautiful Laguna Beach.  Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: The owners have done a lovely job with updating this property. Our room was rather small but laid out well, spotlessly clean. I also really loved the pool area and the location was very convenient. The only reason I am not giving this five stars is the noise factor. The property is old and the first night of our two night stay we had VERY noisy people above us, no voices but lots of bumps on floor, plus they left at 6 a.m. and had been up since 5. We'll be back but will most definitely request a top floor room (and promise to tread lightly). Oh, on-site parking is an added plus.
Manager Response: We are grateful for you taking the time to give us your feedback and for your kind words. We're so happy you enjoyed your stay and look forward to hosting your next visit to beautiful Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: Great little place to base yourself for a trip to Laguna beach. Within walking distance of the town center and everything that you need. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Hotel staff cannot do enough for you. This was a real find - it has so many personal touches that I wont spoil by listing them here! It really is a hotel with character. We cant recommend it highly enough.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. It really means a lot to us. We're so happy you found us and that you enjoyed your stay in beautiful Laguna Beach. We hope to see you again! :)

Summary: I first made my reservation online for myself.  We were in Temecula  for a wedding that weekend looking for a one night stay in Laguna.  They were also Bkg to accommodate daft length family members.  Loved my room!  Kitchenette with queen bed.  First floor a little noisy with traffic but died own about 11pm.  Clean & quaint room.  Walking distance to the park, ocean, restaurants and the close to John Wayne airport. I also left something in my room which when I called was immediately returned.  We will be back -  just loved the folks at reservation & checkin.... so accommodating !  .
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. We're so happy to hear that you loved your room and our convenient location to the beautiful beaches, shops and restaurants. We can't wait to host you and your family again :)

Summary: Turned up late afternoon to see if had a room - helpful receptionist booked us in no worries. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay, quick walk to all the great bars and restaurants. Big room. Great pool area. Nice and quiet, even off main road. Also worth the walk along the Heisler Park in the morning. Cannot fault!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to give us a review and are so glad we had a room for you. We're happy you enjoyed our service, room, pool area and location to downtown Laguna Beach and beautiful Heisler Park. Thank you for choosing The Tides and we hope to have the opportunity to host you again in the future :)

Summary: Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, nice pool and fireplace area. This is small property and not a resort, so it's not what everyone is looking for, but it's exactly what some of us are thrilled to find! Can't wait to return!
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to give us a review Debbie. It means a lot to us. We're so happy you enjoyed your stay and thank you for choosing The Tides. We look forward to hosting you on your next visit to beautiful Laguna Beach :)

Summary: We loved everything about this hotel.  We were greeted with a friendly receptionist.  When we went to our room  there was a personalized note to welcome us.  The sheets and towels were very soft.  And, the hotel was in a great part of town.  We highly recommend this place.  We will definitely go back.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a review Steven. It means a lot to us. We're happy you enjoyed your stay at The Tides and look forward to seeing you again! :)

Summary: Our group of 19 adult friends and family members, plus a one and three year old, considered The Tides Inn our private compound!  We loved the communal area, pool, barbeque area, the lounge chairs, and especially gathering around the fireplace to have a glass of wine sharing stories of the day's wedding events.  The Tribe will return!!!!
Manager Response: It was a pleasure meeting you and your loved ones. Every one was so wonderful and we're grateful to be a part of this special event. Thank you for choosing The Tides. We look forward to hosting you guys again! :)

Summary: Decided to call directly and make a reservation because we wanted an ocean view from the room. The staff was very helpful as to which rooms that would be and we can't wait for our 35th wedding anniversary time there!
Manager Response: We're so happy you've had a wonderful experience so far and can't wait for your visit as well! :)

Summary: Choose this motel for a 3 day visit to Laguna Beach for its price and location, and I think I made a good choice. I was greeted by name at the registration desk, and with a handwritten welcome note-card in my room. I had room 208, which is at the top of the building up two flights of stairs (not good news for my knees!) but it was a lovely room, with a comfortable bed, and a refrigerator in the dressing room/closet area. Fine bathroom with provided shampoo, etc. Free Wifi service was good.  Did not use the pool, but watched several families having a nice time swimming. A very easy walk to the cliff-side park, and to several local shops, galleries and restaurants. Ate dinner with a friend at Las Brisas one night, just two blocks from the hotel.  A few problems with noise from the
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to give us your feedback. We're happy you enjoyed your room, our complimentary WiFi, and convenient location to beautiful Heisler Park and downtown Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides and we hope to see you again :)

Summary: We checked in late about 10pm which at that time I would expect to get less then great customer service. I was met by Anderson at the front desk who was incredibly friendly and welcoming. He offered to match the less expensive price for lodging that I found online and helped us with our bags to the room. Room was small but very clean and did the job. When we woke up at Anderson's suggestion we walked down about two blocks to have breakfast on the patio at the Urth cafe which was really delicious. After breakfast we walked directly across the street to the beach. Clean, great service, and amenities!
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review. We're so happy you enjoyed our service, Urth Caffe and beautiful Heisler Park across the street from us. Thank you for choosing The Tides and we hope to be able to have the opportunity to host you again :)

Summary Heading: Perfect spot to enjoy Laguna Beach
Summary: Charming room with a very relaxed "beachy" feel...nice windows, air & light.  Very friendly staff & reception. Convenient location a short walk to the center of town, shopping, dining, etc. Just across the street from a beautiful park running along the cliffs to the beach.
Manager Response: We're truly grateful for you taking the time to give us a review/feedback. We're glad you enjoyed your room along with our wonderful location to Heisler Park and downtown Laguna Beach. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again :)

Summary Heading: A little piece of heaven in Laguna Beach
Summary: Very thankful for a last minute change in plans forced us to find a hotel in Laguna Beach.  It was an absolute cute and very quaint hotel - wooden floors and antique bed.  We stayed in a sweet Marilyn Monroe themed room...and enjoyed every minute.  Julie was great checking us in, and gave us a number of restaurants to try...enjoyed them all.  I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a great  location and place to stay.
Manager Response: We are sooo happy you enjoyed your stay with us and are glad you found us also. Julie is wonderful and we're glad she was able to give you suggestions on restaurants. We hope to be able to see you again :)

Summary: Loved this place - spent a long time researching where to stay in Laguna Beach and almost went for the hotel option but prices seemed ridiculous and so glad opted for Tides instead.  Had twin room on first floor at front - spacious, lovely light decor, clean - everything we needed.  Can't remember the guy's name who was on reception but he was incredibly welcoming and helpful, which was much appreciated after long drive.  Initially disappointed that couldn't get a room with kitchenette but as Urth Cafe was couple of minutes walk away, we never would have cooked anyway!  Great to be so close to beach but also to cafes and galleries.
Manager Response: We love you too! We're so happy you chose The Tides and that you enjoyed your room and our convenient location to the beach, good eateries and many art galleries in the area. Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback and we hope to be able to host you again :)

Summary: Perfect location across the street from Heisler Park and the beach.  Comfortable, clean and charming room with pool and fireplace and views of Pacific Ocean. A must stay when traveling to Laguna Beach for vacay!
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay with us Heidi! We appreciate and are grateful for you taking the time to give us your feedback and hope to see you again :)

Summary: The Tides is a beautiful small hotel with huge charm!  Short walk to the beach and super friendly staff.  Very reasonable rates and a nice pool and fire pit.   This is not a fancy and expensive place. It is quaint, very clean and homey.    Some guests noted that the location is too close to Pacific Coast Hwy and could hear traffic, but it didn't bother us.    We will absolutely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing The Tides! We're so happy you enjoyed our value along with our convenient location to the beach. We appreciate you taking the time to leave a review and look forward to your next visit with us :)

Summary: My brother, friends, charming and convenient hotel The Tides, good dining at The Driftwood and Hotel Laguna, good music in the days and evening, walking the many beaches and coves, and Dan Miller's jewelry.
Manager Response: We appreciate and are grateful for each and every one of our guests and thank you so much taking the time to write a review. We're so happy you enjoyed our convenient location to the many good eateries in Laguna Beach as well as the beautiful beaches. We hope to see you again! :)

Summary Heading: Great beach alternative to fancy resorts
Summary: This former motel, refurbished with excellent beds and period furniture, was the right spot for an overnight stay. There are costly lodgings everywhere on this part of the Orange Coast, and this one is the nice but not-so-expensive alternative. There's a pool but no spa, good in-room coffee but no lavish buffet, and fine local restaurants are in easy walking distance along Pacific Coast Highway.  The rooms vary in size and style. Ours was fairly large with king bed and two little seating areas and had a partial kitchen (no stove), which was nice for serving the pastries we bought nearby for breakfast.  The windows are new and double-paned, silencing any traffic noise. The small bathroom was updated, with double showerhead. The self-parking is a little tight, but it's included in
Manager Response: We are grateful for you taking the time to give us your candid feedback Judy. We're glad you enjoyed our value along with convenient location to downtown Laguna Beach. We hope you keep us in mind the next time you make a trip down to beautiful Laguna Beach :)

Summary: You surely get what you pay for. We have been here before in a room away from the highway.  It was fine and the managers are very nice.   This room, 201, is right on the highway.  Avoid this room. It very small and felt dingy. I would stay here just not in the rooms that face the street.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback, we really appreciate it. We sincerely apologize that the room you booked did not exceed your expectations and look forward to the next opportunity to welcome you back. You are welcome to contact us directly the next time to check availability and we will do our best to find a room, based on availability, that will better suit you. We appreciate your business and thank you for choosing The Tides :)

Summary: We stayed at the Tides in Laguna Beach. This hotel is a botique style hotel. The rooms are decorated beautifully, a little small but very cute. The property has free wi-fi and parking. There is a pool area and fireplace for making S'mores!!  Hotel is on the main highway and about a 10-15 min walk into town.  The staff were friendly and helpful,having a real family owned vibe.  We really enjoyed our stay here and Laguna is just as pretty as a postcard.
Manager Response: We're so happy you enjoyed your stay here and thank you for taking the time to write a review. We agree, Laguna Beach is very beautiful. We hope to be able to host you again :)

Summary: The Tides gives a visitor a choice of vacation types, such as quiet and calm or poolside chat and swimming. The kitchenette is not too modern and has all conveniences. The office personnel are cordial and solve minor problems promptly. The room and kitchenette are up to date and have fewer edges to them. Very comfortable.
Manager Response: It was a pleasure having you stay with us Leslie and we appreciate and are grateful for you taking the time to give us your feedback. We're so glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit with us :)

Summary: Wonderful place to stay extremely cozy. Beds very comfortable. Very clean.    Felt like vacation as soon S you walk in the door . Staff was extremely accommodating I would stay there again for sure.  Best little hidden gem I. Laguna beach
Manager Response: Robin, we are so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay. Your kind words mean a lot to us as we truly love all of our guests. We hope to be able to host you again :)

Summary: I am a frequent visitor to this motel.  It has never disappointed.  When booking a room, speak to Anderson and he will help you to pick the room that best suit your needs.  I do not mind the traffic noise.  And it is not all that bad.    You will not find any other property in this general location for this price.  Period.  I'll be back!
Manager Response: We are grateful and appreciate you taking the time to write a review Charles. It's always a pleasure having you here and we look forward to your next visit to The Tides! :)

Summary Heading: Lovely room, perfect location, and friendly staff
Summary: Our room has extra chairs and plenty of light for reading. To our delight there was a mini kitchenette. Walking across the street took us to Heisler Park for beautiful views of the ocean and the many coves. We found the staff friendly and helpful. We would recommend the Tides.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to give us your feedback and for your kind words Steven. We're glad you enjoyed our staff, the room and our convenient location to beautiful Heisler Park. We hope to see you again :)

Summary: It was my son's 21st birthday, we reserved 2 rooms for one night,  one for him and his friends and one room for my husband and I. It was perfect, reasonable rates, staff were amazing ( friendly and very accommodating, Rooms were nicely decorated and clean, walking distance to Von's , Starbucks, great restaurants. I would stay there again!
Manager Response: We're grateful to have been part of your son's 21st birthday and are glad you guys enjoyed your time here. Thank you for choosing The Tides and we look forward to hosting you again :)

Summary: We found this place by accident and can't wait to return.  Everything from the location to the room and furnishings were amazing.  The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel welcome.  The rooms take you back in time and make the entire experience unique.  We were walking distance to the beach and restaurants which only added to the stay.   We were only sorry we did not use the fireplace by the pool.   Looks like we need to go back!
Manager Response: Thanks sooo much for your kind words Ilene and for taking the time to give us your feedback. It means a lot to us. It was a pleasure hosting you and your husband and we're so happy you enjoyed The Tides and beautiful Laguna Beach. We look forward to your next visit with us :)

Summary: I want everyone to know that I look for the best in every situation and have never posted a negative review, but I feel obligated to share this with others.  We were looking for a boutique hotel in Laguna Beach and chose The Tides based on TripAdvisor reviews. It was a poor decision.  I'm wondering who writes these reviews? The rooms were the exact opposite of the reviews.  We were assigned a room with a queen bed for 2 people, as no king beds were available. The room was on the ground floor, near the street and the noise was deafening. Upon entering, we were accosted by a strong, musty smell.  The decor was dated, with frilly curtains on the windows and a dusty air conditioning unit protruding from the wall. The lock on the large front window was broken, so the window could
Manager Response: Hi Katesol,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your candid feedback on your recent visit to The Tides. To answer your question, the reviews posted on TripAdvisor are from verified guests that have stayed with us, the same way you wrote your review.  You booked your room last minute on a very busy Martin Luther King Jr. weekend where most hotels in Laguna Beach offered rates of at least $200+ for that Saturday night. The phone app you used offers competitive non-refundable rates, however, the catch is that you do not get to choose your room type. We gave you the bigger of the two rooms we had available at the time. We're not sure what you were expecting as our website, along with other 3rd party websites, provide pictures of our property and guest rooms.  Our property has exterior corridors and we are located on Pacific Coast Highway. We wish we could control the road noise more, but it is out of our control. We do offer double pane windows and complimentary ear plugs in all guests rooms for sensitive sleepers. We're happy to offer individual air conditioning/heating in our guest rooms as some beach properties do not have them.  We appreciate and are grateful for all of our guests and are always more than happy to answer any questions the best we could prior to you making a reservation to see if we would be the best fit for your accommodation needs in Laguna Beach.  The Tides offers old Laguna charm that is affordable and clean and while we understand everyone has their own preferences, we sincerely apologize for not meeting your expectations and sad that you could not enjoy the conveniences our property offers. One of the things our guests love is that we are right across the street from beautiful Heisler Park and only a short walk to downtown Laguna Beach where you can find shops, restaurants and art galleries among other things. Most say we are far enough from the "craziness" but close enough to walk. We're sorry there wasn't anything you enjoyed about The Tides but want you to know that we very much appreciate and value your feedback as it will help us to continue to improve.  Nevertheless, we hope you enjoyed your stay in beautiful Laguna Beach :)

Summary: The Tides is an older motel located in north Laguna Beach.  Our first night we had a room right on the street which we found dark and damp however we were moved to a nicer room the rest of our stay. I believe it was room 108 which is close to the heated salt water pool.  The staff are excellent and will go out of their way to make sure you are happy. Make sure you book a room with at least a fridge and microwave. They provide dishes, cutlery dish soap and tea towel.  We did our dishes in bathroom sink and enjoyed the large stainless steel gas BBQ they have. We also ate dinner at the stone bar around the BBQ.  The gas fireplace is a nice touch. They turn it on everyone night so have a nice relaxing night. The pool is also located in the same area so you can have some fun with
Manager Response: We're so happy you enjoyed your stay with us Cathy and thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback :) We hope to be able to host you and your family again!

Summary: A wonderful oasis in this wonderful oasis in California. The staff were delightful and the accommodation was perfect. Our two rooms formed a suite and we were most impressed with the facilities provided. The pool and outside seating area with gas-fire provided a lovely relaxing and entertaining area only 5 mins walk to Main beach past numerous restaurants that meant we didn't need to use the very good kitchenette facilities in our room-other than the spacious fridge and coffee machine. This hotel is great value for money and would certainly recommend this to any visitor to Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying with us and for taking the time to give us your feedback, it means a lot to us :) It was a pleasure meeting you and your wonderful family. We're so happy that you enjoyed our spacious pool area and convenient location. We hope to be able to host you again in the future :)

Summary: It's dog friendly, LOVE IT! I sure will return here again. The swimming pool, the bbq area, the fire place was a cozy space to lounge around outdoors. Plus the pool is heated, thumbs up! The room was charming, it was clean considering they allow dogs. They also provide post cards, amazing! I took 12 cards and mailed it to family and friends. Although, they need a new postcard with a photo of the hotel not just the swimming pool area. The front desk were helpful and informative. We definitely will be back, and it's close to the beach, (across the street Heiser Beach Park) and restaurants. We walked everywhere, no reason to drive.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay with us. We're so happy you enjoyed your room, the heated salt water pool, fireplace and BBQ area. One of the things that guests love about our property is that we offer complimentary parking and are just a short walk to Heisler Park and downtown Laguna Beach. Thank you for choosing The Tides and we look forward to your next visit with us in beautiful Laguna Beach :)

Summary: Accommodation in Laguna Beach is expensive and I think Tides offers good value for money. The room booked was small and dingy - no window in bedroom area. When we asked if we could up grade to a larger room the staff could not have been more helpful. We stayed in 2 different rooms both were spacious well decorated and clean. Lovely bedding and towels.   We did sit around the pool to read our books one morning. The area was well maintained. There is an outside fireplace with comfy seating and a BBQ area.   It's a 15 minute stroll to the main area where there are lots of places to eat. Less than 10 minutes to the sea to watch the amazing sunsets.   It is on a main road but that didn't stop us sleeping we didn't need the earplugs provided.
Manager Response: Hello Gin-Ginnie! Thanks so much for your candid review. We're so happy that we were able to accommodate you during your visit to beautiful Laguna Beach and glad you had a wonderful time. We hope to be able to host you again in the future :)

Summary: I was given a room with two beds a little kitchen and a sitting area outside. Fabulous! I felt very safe there. Anderson and Stephanie were unbelievably helpful. My phone got wet yep...in the ocean. I was under stress anyway, by the end of my stay in felt much better. The bed was very comfortable! I walked everywhere. The hotel is close to pretty much everything. As for road noise....the town of laguna is bustling  and the PCH is always busy. There's gonna be road noise. View of the ocean from my little sitting area.
Manager Response: We're so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you finally got to relax towards the end of your stay. Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We hope you had a wonderful rest of your Southern California trip and hope to see you again! :)

Summary: This was everything I hoped it would be & more! Last time we visited Laguna we stayed in a pricier hotel further down the coast but The Tides was a much better experience!  Everything was perfect; location location location especially! 5 min walk to Heisler Park and the beach which were beautiful, especially at sunset. Shops and restaurants all within a 10min walk. Uber available should you need it (we used it once but walked the same distance back as everything is walkable!). Staff were really friendly and sweet. Pool was lovely and quiet. Seating area by the pool with the sofas and gas fire was cute to chill out at.   I just thought this place was great value for money and it made our trip to Laguna a really special one, and we've fallen in love with the area even more!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review and kind words Kelly! It means so much to us that you enjoyed your stay and have fallen in love with Laguna even more. We hope you have a great rest of your trip and hope to see you again :)

Summary: After spending a lot of time in motels travelling the US, Laguna beach is our last stop before we go so we decided to spend a little more of our budget to stay here and I'm glad we did! Lovely little pool area that rarely gets busy - we had it to ourselves the whole day one day. There's a fire by the pool that's relaxing to sit around in the evening.   The room is spacious and clean with a lovely big bed. Shower has a good pressure however did occasionally go cold for a few seconds.   Located really well being a 10 minute walk from restaurants including Skyloft which is great for drinks in the evening. You're also a 5 minute walk from Heisler Park and the beach which are both just gorgeous - especially at sunset.   This is my 2nd time here in Laguna and we paid a lot more to
Manager Response: We're so glad you stayed with us also and that you enjoyed our location and value :) We hope to see you again!

Summary: I used to stay at another hotel, right across the street, that is way more expensive.  I am happy I changed to The Tides, where personnel is exceptionally kind and of service and where one has comfortable, albeit older looking, rooms and free parking.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for choosing The Tides and for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay with us. We're glad you enjoyed your stay with us and hope to see you again :)

Summary Heading: a nice tucked away place close to the beach
Summary: The Tides is a very clean well maintained motel at the North end of Laguna Beach.  Close enough to restuarants and night clubs without all the noise.  For the young people it is only a hop skip and jump to the beach.  There is free bus service between 11AM and 11PM to get you around the main street in town.  No need to hunt for parking spaces.  The Tides also has a nice heated pool and plenty of places to kick back and read a good book.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay at The Tides. We're glad you were able to relax and enjoy our property and convenient location. We hope to see you again in the future :)

Summary Heading: Great Location.  Great Customer Service.  Nice Room.
Summary: I booked this place because of location - walking distance to Heisler Park.  The guy at front desk could not have been nicer.  Very polite, professional, & helpful.   The hotel is an older bldg, but our room was clean & had plenty of space.  We didn't stay long enough to use the pool, but it looked nice.  I would stay here, again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We're glad you enjoyed beautiful Laguna Beach and hope you can come back to visit us again and enjoy our heated salt water pool this time :)

Summary Heading: Great hotel stay for the money
Summary: We were in LA for a week and took a little jog out to Laguna for a night.  The hotels are so expensive in the area we decided to give this one a try.  It was very affordable and it's an outstanding location.  It was very clean, spacious and the staff was very friendly.  As other reviewers have noted it's not a luxurious resort but it is exactly what you need for a nice comfortable stay, reasonable price, excellent location.  We walked to the pageant and if you do not want to walk there's a shuttle that basically picks you up right in front of hotel. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.
Manager Response: We're so happy you enjoyed our value and convenient location. Thank you and we hope to see you again in the future :)

Summary: We had booked room 205, which has a big comfy bed, one comfortable chair and a good sized TV. The bathroom (with shower only) is old but ok. There is a fridge and a coffee machine in the space between the bedroom and bathroom, which were handy. Location is so good ‚Äì short walk to Heisler Park and not too far to a good selection of restaurants. Loved the pool, and the staff were great. Would love to stay here again.
Manager Response: We would love for you to stay with us again! Thanks so much for the review Janie :)

Summary Heading: Quite Ok for an overnight stary
Summary: In Laguna Beach and right on PCH, thus, well-positioned for travelling the coast. Close to varied places for breakfast and dinner and all these beautiful beaches. But even with swimming pool and free parking not really appropriate for longer stay, especially if you can only sleep without having any constant highway noise getting through closed windows. (The hotel offers though some earplugs)
Manager Response: Thank you Dirk! We hope you enjoyed the rest of your trip and congratulations again! :)

Summary: We enjoyed our one night stay here! We slept well and didn't notice the PCH noise at all.. The room is a little small but a good value for the buck. We walked two blocks to the wonderful beaches and restaurants!
Manager Response: Thanks so much Moe9! We're glad you enjoyed your stay with us and hope to see you again :)

Summary: After a stressful month, my girlfriend and I needed a break and thought of visiting Laguna Beach just for a night to get some rest, peace and quiet and ocean air to unwind.  Did my homework and read a somewhat mixed review of The Tide Inn.  The staff are really nice and pleasant, but that's where it went downhill for me.  I was shocked that our room #102 was literally 15 feet from Pacific Coast Hwy!!  I have a picture attached that shows my front door, the sidewalk and PCH.  I immediately went back to the front desk and explained that we are both light sleepers and need to rest and would like to be relocated away from the highway.  She said "Sorry" all full (on a Tuesday) but the hotel does provide earplugs on our nightstand in our room - and I thought this was not a good sign.
Manager Response: Arnold, we appreciate you taking the time to share your candid feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We ARE a small property with exterior corridors, located on N Coast Hwy, and try our best to control the road noise by installing double pane windows and, as a courtesy, provide complimentary ear plugs for any sensitive sleepers. We were sold out the night you stayed with us and would have been more than happy to accommodate your request of moving to a different room, away from PCH, but we did not have any other options.  Thank you for the tip on calling and/or making requests through the reservation. We usually make guests aware of the room location when they contact us directly and we often refer guests to our website as it has a property map and brief description of EACH room, including the location and potential for road/traffic noise. We try our best to accommodate any guest requests as we want our guests to enjoy their stay in beautiful Laguna Beach as much as possible. We appreciate and value your feedback as it will help us to continue improving for our future guests. Thank you for choosing The Tides Laguna Beach and we hope you would consider giving us another opportunity to host you the next time you plan a trip to Laguna Beach, just this time, in a different room.

Summary: Have stayed here several times and have booked again for the future.   It is true paradise and the place is perfect in just about every way!  We come without a car, and can walk everywhere.  But lets not tell too many people, or we won't be able to get a room next time!
Manager Response: We're so grateful you have enjoyed your stays with us :) We love our guests and always say we have THE BEST guests. We can't wait until your next visit!

Summary: Found this amazing place while searching for a BEST place to stay in Laguna Beach.  BEST means price, location, amenities.  This lovely motel has it all.  Fourteen (14) members of our family stayed here for three nights while we attended the Pageant of the Masters, shopped, ate, swam in the salt water pool and played on the beach.  It was perfect in every way.  The staff is so nice, always accommodating.  Highly recommend!  We will return!  Thank you so much for providing the perfect place for an epic family adventure.  DHoover, Elderof5
Manager Response: It was such a pleasure meeting you and your family. Like we always say, we have the BEST guests! We're so happy to read that you and your family enjoyed beautiful Laguna Beach to the fullest. We are grateful and appreciative for you taking the time to write a review and for your kind words, it means a lot to us. We look forward to hosting you guys again in the future :)

Summary Heading: Wonderful kitchenette at fully remodeled, perfectly located quaint lodgings
Summary: Rooms are light, airy, and homey, looks recently remodeled.  Lovely pool, deck area and landscaping, covered free parking, books, games and puzzles in rooms, cordial and helpful staff.  Beautiful park with beaches and tide pools just across PCH and around the corner.  Walking distance to everything or take the trolley.  PCH is noisy during the day but who cares, you should be shopping or at the beach.  Easy half mile walk to Pageant of Masters and Art Festivals.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay at The Tides George :) Your kind words and wonderful review mean a lot to us. It looks like you had an amazing stay in beautiful Laguna Beach and we hope to be able to host you again!

Summary: This is an ideal hotel for anyone looking to stay fairly close to the beaches and nightlife of Laguna Beach without spending huge amounts of money.   Our room was very pleasant and a good size and was nicely decorated. It was possible to park for free either right outside or very close by.   The pool area was fairly good and was quite during our four-night stay. It gets lots of sunshine through the day, however the noise from the busy road next to the property is a slight let down. The road noise was also noticeable from our room however we didn't mind really as it was quite at night.   The lack of a breakfast service lowered the score for us but there are some good cafes nearby, particularly Urth Cafe which was excellent.
Manager Response: Thank you Jonathan for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay at The Tides. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed our convenient location, room and value. We sincerely apologize and understand that since our property is located on Pacific Coast Highway that there may be some road noise. We try our best to control that by having double pane windows and providing complimentary earplugs for sensitive sleepers. We also have some rooms farther away from PCH that may have less road noise. We do not provide any sort of hot breakfast here but do have fresh fruit in the office as we like our guests to go out and enjoy beautiful Laguna Beach and the wonderful restaurants nearby. We will definitely keep your suggestion in mind, however, when making future improvements/changes. Thank you for again for choosing The Tides and we hope to be able to host you again in the future! :)

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for the second year in a row while visiting Pagaent of the Masters. Still love the place. It's a great location, very clean, friendly staff, and loved that our room had a little kitchenette. Loses one star because the room could use a little painting.
Manager Response: We are so grateful and appreciative for you staying with us again and taking the time to give us your feedback as it will help us to continue improving. We're glad you still enjoy our location, staff and room. We hope you enjoyed the Pageant of the Masters this year and hope to see you again next year! :)

Summary Heading: Stopped in Laguna for one night with my daughter
Summary: I searched for a hotel for about a month before our stay.  They were all quite pricey and finally decided on The Tides.  What a pleasant surprise!  It's a great location right across from the ocean in the center of town.  We walked to the pageant it took about 15 minutes.  The rooms were very clean and basic but perfect for what we needed.  The staff was so feeding and just went out of their way.  They offer toys for the beach, umbrellas, towels, chairs, equipment etc...checked us in early and free parking is right there.  Parking is very tight but you will find that any where in Laguna.  Vending machines on site with pop for $1, haven't seen that in years!  There is a pool there it's small but it does the trick and they have free wifi.  The beautiful ocean is literally a five
Manager Response: We are so happy that you and your daughter had a wonderful time during your recent visit to beautiful Laguna Beach. We are grateful and appreciate you taking the time to share your experience and eagerly wait for your next visit! :)

Summary Heading: Great location to walk to the beach
Summary: Cannot beat the location. Easy walk to the beach. Pool to cool off in after the walk back to your room. Lobby staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were a bit on the small side but great for a beach visit in Laguna.    We were a party of four and rented two rooms. No pullout options available.  Enjoyed the stay and we would repeat.
Manager Response: Thanks so much Eric and we look forward to your next visit with us! :)

Summary: All though we only stayed a night based on that stay we would go back and stay longer. Very centrally located in Laguna Beach across the street from Heisler Park ( a very easy walk to get to), lots of restaurants and shopping, trolleys pick up right next to the hotel can take you to all the art festivals, etc.  They have a nice pool, they let you borrow beach towels and chairs!  This is what I would call a boutique hotel, the room we stayed in was very small but very quite and perfect for one night, everything was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and extremely helpful, parking is provided with your room reservation (another plus!).  Thank you Julie!! We will be back to try the birthday special!
Manager Response: We are so happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us and wish you could've stayed longer also! Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We're glad you enjoyed the complimentary parking and our convenient location to Heisler Park, Downtown Laguna Beach and all the art festivals. Thanks so much for choosing The Tides and we look forward to your next visit with us! :)

Summary: Friends suggested the Tides in Laguna and I was not sure what to expect. Was told it was an older funky hotel but my friends love it.  Was pleasantly surprised.  The room was nice sized and had a small kitchenette. The bathroom was a bit small as was the shower. Room was immaculately clean which I appreciate.  The Tides is 2 short blocks to the beach which is an easy walk. Perfect location to walk to shops, bars, restaurants etc. Has a pool in case you don't want to beach it.  They have free WiFi and don't charge for parking which is nice.  Check in and out was fast and pleasant.
Manager Response: We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us and grateful for you taking the time to give us your feedback. We hope you had an amazing time with the birthday celebration and hope to see you again if you are ever in the Laguna Beach area :)

Summary: This was the PERFECT accommodation for our Girls' Weekend in Laguna Beach for attending the Pageant of the Masters.  We were completely impressed with our overnight stay.    In a nutshell:  Clean, Best location for a short walk to center of town, quaint & charming room, across the street from Heisler Park ( one of the best beach in Laguna Beach-love the morning beach walk for few people there), free parking, saline pool, walking distance to the Pageant of the Masters.  We were welcomed with a lovely note, almond treats, & sparkling lemonade in our room.  Awesome surprise!  I highly recommend this place and would not hesitate to come back.
Manager Response: We are so grateful that you took the time to write about your experience at The Tides. We very much appreciate and value the wonderful and positive feedback. It looks like you guys had an amazing time exploring beautiful Laguna Beach. It was a pleasure meeting you and your friends and we look forward to hosting you again! :)

Summary: I booked this hotel after reading all the reviews and was not disappointed. This was a perfect location for the Pageant of the Masters, beach, and Art Festival. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful, loaning beach towels and giving advice on food options nearby. The room (209) was very clean and had a nice balcony with a slight view of the ocean. The only negative I could give is the bathroom was small and could use some updating. For the price and location, I feel that it is an excellent choice. We will be staying here again!
Manager Response: We're so happy you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback as we very much appreciate and value it. We can't wait until your next visit with us!

Summary Heading: Great Beach spot and perfect if you're in town for the Pageant of the Masters
Summary: The rooms were so clean and the personnel were so nice.  They helped my semi-handicapped mom get comfortable.  The rooms are so beachy comfy.  This is the perfect place to stay in Laguna.  Parking is easy and access to all areas of Laguna are right there.  The air conditioning is wonderful.  I highly recommend this place!
Manager Response: We enjoyed meeting you and your family and are glad you guys enjoyed your stay in beautiful Laguna Beach.  Thank you for taking the time to write a review. It would be our pleasure to host you again! :)

Summary: I just stayed here last week in room 207 which was a king room with kitchenette. Let's get one thing straight upfront: this is NOT a luxury hotel, whatsoever. It's a budget hotel, so I am reviewing this on that basis. For a budget hotel style place, it's very good overall. The location is spectacular, it's a 3 min walk to the nearest beach at Heisler Park, which is a lovely park and within it lies a pathway to a very pretty beach with plenty of lounging space. It's also walking distance to several cafes including Urthe, and a five minute walk to Whole Foods. So really, the best thing about the place in my eye is the location, as I only was in the room to sleep and get ready. They have free parking and we were able to score a covered parking spot, and there is free wifi as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide candid feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We're so happy to read that you enjoyed our location along with complimentary WiFi and parking. Thank you for your suggestions as we very much appreciate and value it and will take it into serious consideration for future improvements. We strive to offer exceptional value and service with old Laguna charm when compared to other properties in our area. We hope to see you again!

Summary: Received a terrific welcome by the co-owner, Anderson. We were allocated to a quiet room with plenty of space. Full of amenities including delicious snacks and bottles of water waiting for us upon our arrival. I will go back to this friendly place.
Manager Response: We are SO happy to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at The Tides and for your kind words. We hope you and your friend had an amazing time in beautiful Laguna Beach. We look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: Absolutely loved staying here!! Got the special birthday rate! BBq by the pool. Everyone was super nice that worked there. Conveniently located close to town, the beach and the grocery store. Hop the "wave" shuttle to the beach, or transfer and head up to the sawdust art festival.
Manager Response: We have the best guests! We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience at The Tides and are so glad you had a wonderful time here. Thank you for spending your special day with us! We're glad you enjoyed the staff, BBQ, our convenient location and the free Laguna Beach trolley. We hope to be able to host you again in beautiful Laguna Beach. Happy Birthday!

Summary Heading: After a rocky start, a fine experience
Summary: Checking in, I learned my particular room, reserved 2.5 months prior, had been given to another guest that day! Staff made it right and were very hospitable. Room nicely decorated with very comfy beds. Location is in Gallery Row, north of Broadway. A bit of a walk to the main area of town, but a nice respite from traffic. Kindness of staff made it a joy to stay here!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review and for your kind words. We appreciate your understanding regarding the room number situation as your reservation was made during our transition in April. We're glad your sister had a blast and to read that you enjoyed our staff and the room you stayed in. It means a lot to us. We hope to be able to have the opportunity to host you again the next time you plan to come down to beautiful Laguna Beach!

Summary: Our trip to Laguna was so fun we so many exciting things and got to experience the great resort to stay at Tides.  The team was super friendly and helpful. The town was great.  Whole foods was convenient.  Fun to watch the surfers. Visit The Beachcomber for breakfast! So good!
Manager Response: We're so happy to read that you had so much fun during your visit to beautiful Laguna Beach! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at The Tides. We hope you can come back again to visit us again and also to enjoy more of the amazing people, weather, and food!  Kind Regards,  The Tides Laguna Beach

Summary: Lovely american dream type place. Great base. Walk to mostly anything. Short taxi or uber to everything else. Great burger place up the road. Make sure you try the Husky burger. Downtown is 5 mins walk.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay at The Tides Laguna Beach. We're thrilled to read that you found our location convenient and enjoyed some great food. Thank you for choosing The Tides and we hope to be able to have the opportunity to host you again in beautiful Laguna Beach!

Summary Heading: Very friendly place to stay in Laguna
Summary: We used to stay at the Laguna Beach House but traveling with 2 young kids (3 and 1), we decided to book the suite at the Tides, with a separate bedroom, a dining room and a kitchen. We had a wonderful time besides the weather being a little to chilly to enjoy the pool. The owners were very responsive, and so friendly, always had a word for us when they would see us. I am not a fan of the decoration in the dining room, hundreds of plates from different places in the world hung on the walls of the dining room, it makes the room seems smaller. The bathroom has an enclosed shower, a sink, a little cupboard and a window. The bedroom has 2 very comfortable queen size beds, a drawer dresser and a closet. There is a lot of noise from coming from the Pacific Highway but we slept with the
Manager Response: Thank you sooo much for the wonderful review! It was a pleasure meeting you and your beautiful family and we hope you enjoyed your visit to beautiful Laguna Beach. We wish the weather was warmer for you but are happy to read that you enjoyed the room and our staff. We appreciate you taking the time to give us feedback regarding your recent stay at The Tides and thank you for your kind words. We hope to be able to host you and your family again!  Kind Regards,  Stephanie, Anderson and the rest of The Tides Laguna Beach family

Summary: We booked the tides Inn for a birthday celebration.  The new owners, Stephanie Chen and Anderson Le were so accommodating.  We had several families staying and visiting the hotel  for the party. The Inn is small, but meets all the needs.  The prices for a room with kitchenette, free wifi and parking are moderate for Laguna.  We loved the property amenities and utilized the pool/bar area and firepit. After a day of fun, the firepit was a big hit with more socializing (and smores)! The location is directly across from the beach and Heisler Park .  Within walking distance is a Pavillon's with Starbucks and a full service deli  / bakery.  We are locals so we know the area, but for tourists, a trolley runs year round at no cost, or it is an easy walk to the center of  town full of
Manager Response: It was a pleasure meeting you and your family and we thank you for taking the time to share your experience at The Tides. We are so happy you enjoyed our amenities and convenient location. Your kind words mean a lot of us. Thank you again and we look forward to having the opportunity to host you and your family again!  Kind Regards,  Stephanie, Anderson and the rest of The Tides Laguna Beach family

Summary Heading: One of Laguna's beat kept secrets! Aforable and adorable.
Summary: I booked a room for my daughter and her boyfriend, he was headed to Laguna from NY to propose! The room was warm and cozy with a kitchenette.  Most of all, it's not one of the pricey waterfronts with no amenities, the Inn at Laguna no longer has their special breakfasts just a box of coffee from Starbucks. So skip them and join the Tides, just walk across the street to the museum, Heisler Park, and it's almost next door to the Madison Square, best breakfast and lunches in Laguna! Enjoy!
Manager Response: We are so happy to read that your daughter and her fianc√© enjoyed their stay with us and are blessed to have shared this special moment with them. We are glad they enjoyed the value and convenience of our location and we hope to be able to host them again in the future. We appreciate you taking the time to write a review. Congratulations to them and we wish them a long and happy life together!  Kind Regards,  Stephanie, Anderson and the rest of The Tides Laguna Beach family

Summary: The whole staff was Amazing ‚ù§Ô∏è love the rooms we all had. My daughters , Brother and parents all had a blast there, very clean, close to allüòéüòâüå∫üåª we will be back for sure ü§ó Pool area was perfect for a small birthday get together. Thanks to The Tides‚úåüèΩÔ∏èüòé
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at The Tides. We are so happy you and your family had a great time celebrating your mom's birthday. It was a pleasure meeting all of you and we look forward to your next visit with us!  Kind Regards,  Stephanie, Anderson and the rest of The Tides Family

Summary: My wife spent 10 nights here in May, so this is her review. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The staff is super friendly and very very helpful. Coffee maker and coffee in the room with kitchenette. 5 minutes walk from Heilser park/beach.
Manager Response: We appreciate you and your wife for taking the time to write a review on her stay. We are glad to read that she enjoyed the room, bed and our convenient location. It would be our pleasure to host her again and we hope to be able to meet you too!  Kind Regards,  Stephanie, Anderson and the rest of The Tides family

Summary Heading: Still the Best Value in Laguna
Summary: Our family of 4 returned to the Tides after 4 years for another vacation.  After considering other lodging, we decided to stay at the Tides for 4 nights. The motel had just changed ownership. The new owners Stephanie and Anderson Lee were very enthusiastic about  their new venture. They were friendly and accommodating with quick responses to our needs or requests. We stayed in room 213, which was nicer and quieter than our previous stay on the first floor. The room is on the second floor in the back with a nice cottage decor and a fireplace with white, clean, and fresh towels and linens. We kept the windows open most of the time to allow the nice ocean breeze to circulate. There was an anteroom to the bathroom with a small closet and a refrigerator. We were very happy that we
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at The Tides. We are delighted to read that you and your family enjoyed the room and our convenient location. Your kind words and compliments mean a lot to us and we can't wait until the next time we have the opportunity to host you and your family.  Kind Regards,  Stephanie and Anderson

Summary: We really like The Tides. We had a nice view from our room, and a constant breeze through the window. The comfortable beds and cool ocean breeze will make you want to laze in bed all morning. We had a kitchenette with a large fridge, microwave, toaster, and keurig machine. Staff was very friendly and made us feel at home. There is also a salt water pool, fire place, and bbq for guests to enjoy.
Manager Response: We are so happy to read that you enjoyed The Tides. We appreciate and value your comments and would like to think that we can be your home away from home. Thank you for being our guest and we hope that you keep us in mind the next time you are in the area.  Kind Regards,  Stephanie and Anderson

Summary: We stayed 4 nights at The Tides. To cover the key points of the visit: Location: Good, near town, the beach and a number of eating places. It is on N Coast Highway, which is really busy. Noise levels in the room are however acceptable, and there are earplugs for the sensitive, though I think they were unnecessary. Also the walk to town is around a mile I reckon, with a pretty steep incline coming back! Service: Front desk people are all great, and housekeeping quick and efficient. Parking: is tight, but I think there's a space for every room. Parking in town is very difficult. Check -in: fast and efficient. Room: no problems, but no safe or microwave in the room. Amenities: heated pool, and the place is kept immaculate and well maintained. Breakfast: none, but Keurig coffee
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your insightful feedback. We are pleased to read that you enjoyed our convenient location and that you received excellent service from our team. We're glad you enjoyed the room and all the great places that are within walking distance. Should your future travels bring you back to Laguna Beach, all of our rooms are available to look at on our website, some furnished with kitchenettes and a few with a full kitchen. It would be our pleasure to host you again.  Kind Regards,  Anderson

Summary Heading: Best little hotel in Laguna Beach!
Summary: This hotel is perfect for family! I went on spring break and have been going there for 5 years in a row! The rooms are very cozy! Room 101 has a full kitchen and a dining room. Perfect for families wanting to save money and make meals and go down to the beach which is less then two blocks away. The pool is a salt water heated pool with a nice fireplace to chill by at night! It is right by Heisler Park which is beautiful clean and awesome. You and your family can take long walks and come back Bbq at the gas grill that is at pool side. The staff is so nice and helpful treat you like family. And the best thing for me is that it is also pet friendly! I will always stay at this little gem!
Manager Response: We are elated to read that you enjoyed your stay with us once again and that we're able to accommodate you and your family during your visits to beautiful Laguna Beach! We very much appreciate and value your compliments and look forward to your next visit with us.  Kind Regards,  Anderson

Summary: Beautiful hotel nestled on the hills, cute romantic rooms with clean smelling linen and helpful staff, coffee machine, clean bathroom and right across the ocean, few walks away, flowers , cute little balcony, makes it cozy and not to leave.loved it, free parking for guest and free wifiüíêüíê‚ù§Ô∏è
Manager Response: We love you also.  Thanks very much. Linda

Summary: Hotel staff - very helpful . Hotel is a small friendly place . Nice location, across from beach and close to stores and restaurants . Pool area is pretty and nice size. There is lots to do in Laguna Beach .Would definitely recommend this hotel !
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to tell others about your stay at The Tides  and of our lovely town.  We appreciate your compliments and are pleased to know you enjoyed your visit.  We do hope you will return to visit again soon.  Kind Regards, Dale

Summary: Staff friendly , rooms on Pacific coast highway street side noisy ,and noisy between rooms..( ear plugs provided).  water pressure for shower very low ,more or less across street from outstanding Heisler Park on ocean side  ...probably reasonably priced  for room with kitchenette and location
Manager Response: We are happy to know that you found our staff to be friendly and our prices to be reasonable.  We strive to provide clean, tasteful and affordable lodging. Thank you for your review and for being our guest. Kind Regards, Dale

Summary: Super clean, super convenient, each room decorated distinctively, friendly hosts, reasonable rates, great pool, pet friendly. Ask about special birthday rate. If cost is a consideration (some Laguna hotels charge upwards of $1,000 a night) then this is a great choice. We can hardly wait to visit again.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to write.  We appreciate our guests comments.  Looking forward to your return.

Summary: We really like the Tides. Pet friendly. Great location; you can walk everywhere. Prices good. Staff excellent. Parking. Wi-fi. Terrific pool area. Recommendation: if you stay here more than 3 days, try to secure the kitchenette (room 210). Only one comment about room 206: This was the same room we stayed in on our last visit 2 years ago. In the guest book, we commented on the rusty pipe under the bathroom sink and in the shower. We also commented on the paint peeling on the ceiling. We were really surprised that these have not been attended to. While the room is very nice, these conditions are a detraction. On this visit, the hair dryer plate fell off the wall. It was not secured properly.  C'mon Tides management, you have a great place here. Spruce it up to make more
Manager Response: OK Howard, we are having the pipes repaired/replaced.  So sorry we missed this comment completely.  The hair dryer has been secured.  Good help is hard to find.  We do try hard.  Room 210 is very small and does not have a kitchenette.  We do have several rooms with kitchenettes and a few with a full kitchen.  We do appreciate your time and your words of wisdom.  Thanks so much. Linda

Summary Heading: Great for a night or two.
Summary: Stopped off here on our way back to LA to catch a flight back to UK. Well placed right on PCH with plenty of shops/restaurants etc within a few minutes walk. I am a light sleeper and slept very,very well in the most comfortable huge bed. As others have mentioned it is an old motel type property and could do with some upgrading in parts but also has a lot of charm.  Our room had a large kitchen area which would have been really useful if we had been staying longer. Bathroom was very small but did the job. A/C worked very well.  Would not hesitate to recommend.
Manager Response: Annie,  Thank you for taking the time to tell other readers  about your stay at the Tides! We appreciate you having done so and are pleased to know you slept very well in our "comfortable huge bed."  We pride ourselves in giving our guests "The BEST BANG FOR THEIR BUCK" in Laguna Beach, hence upgrading our older property is an ongoing and continuous task.   Again, thank you so much for recommending the Tides to other TripAdvisor readers.    Kind Regards, Dale Johnson

Summary: We stayed one night in room #213. We had a late check-in so they left the key under the doormat. The room was very nice, but needed a bit of upgrading. The sink water tasted like old pipes, the AC only worked at night, there was rust everywhere in the bathroom, and the walls needed soundproofing. Everything else was great.
