Friendly staff, pet friendly, cozy inn kind of feel, and a couple blocks from dog- friendly Main Beach, which was great for my bulldog. Anyways was a great 2 night experience and would come back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell others about your stay at the Tides. We are pleased to know that despite the fact that you found places in need of some upgrading, you still had a great 2 night experience and  you'd like to return.  We would love nothing more, and until that time we will continue with our on going efforts to improve and upgrade.  Providing our guests with great customer service and  a stay so enjoyable that they leave wanting to return is important to us. Thank you for your comments and suggestions.  Kind Regards,  Dale Johnson

Summary: Lovely hotel on PCH. Medium sized room with comfortable  King size bed. Small bathroom with shower. Rails all round in the shower so if your balance is not good you have something to hold on to. Coffee machine, fridge and microwave in room so you can get your breakfast from local store and eat in.  The owners are super friendly and helpful and reception phoned to make reservation at restaurant for me. Room was kept very clean and towels changed daily and bedding after 2 nights.  Lovely heated pool area with fire pit which would be lovely on a warm evening to sit around. Also big barbecue available. Only downside was the noise from the room above - sounds as though people are in boots moving around! Select a room other than on the ground floor! We booked a couple of months before
Manager Response: Thank you for recommending the Tides to other readers.  We love our town and are pleased to know that you, too,  love Laguna Beach.  We appreciate your recmmending that others stay at the Tides when visiting our lovely seaside village.  We do hope to have you as our guest again.   Kind Regards,  Dale Johnson

Summary: Old style inn. Right on the PCH with ocean views. Good value in my opinion.   My wife stays here every time she comes to Laguna. She loves it and I enjoy it too.   It's an older property but they keep it up as well as they can.   Love the pool and fountains.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review.  We are all very happy that you enjoy The Tides as much as we do.  Looking forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary: The first time we stayed here years ago we stayed in their largest room and it was a better experience. This time we stayed in one of their regular rooms.  Positives:  The Tides is near the ocean and a short distance from downtown Laguna Beach. The staff are friendly and helpful and the inn allows dogs.  The room was very clean and the property well maintained for its age.  Negatives:  Like most of Laguna, parking is limited and the spaces very small.  Dated interior and very, very small bathroom. Really didn't like that the room had soap, shampoo and conditioner in pump bottles attached to the wall. Really, really cheap and made it hard to use since it took a lot of pumps to even squirt a little out.   That said, this is Laguna Beach. Like when you travel to Santa Barbara, get
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to write about The Tides.  We truly appreciate our guests' comments.  All of our rooms are completely different and can be viewed on our website which helps with decision-making.  Our parking is limited but complimentary.  It is so ironic that you mention our pump bottle amenities as it was a big decision for us to upgrade from those tiny bars of soap--so much more expensive for us as is the liquid soap.  We have had nothing but problems with the pump dispensers and constantly order different ones.  We do try hard to please.  We sincerely hope you were able to enjoy our gorgeous beaches and sunsets. Linda

Summary: I stayed here (still am here, check out on 31st) with my husband and 6 year old son. It has been the best place we have stayed in a long time. Firstly, the staff. Wonderful. The motel - comfortable and very clean. Facilities are top notch. The location is brilliant. The kitchenette was fab. Laguna Beach is pricey to eat in and as were were staying 17 days at the Tides Inn we saved alot by getting ready meals and microwave porridge. I am going to miss Laguna Beach. Its a really lovely place. The Tides Inn made our trip much more affordable. Thanks to the staff and cleaners for looking after us.
Manager Response: Thank you so much.  How great to have the opportunity to stay in this amazing town for 17 days.  Also, how lucky are we to have you stay with us.  Please return as often as you can. Linda

Summary: Booking online can be a crap shoot.  How does one evaluate price vas value.  Tripadvisor gives, "The Tides Inn" an 7 out of 22 Hotels in Laguna Beach, CA.  Trip Advisor Contributors give it a 4.5 out of 5 stars, but I am only able to give it a "2" out of "5 stars.   It is clean enough.  The rooms are individually decorated and quaint enough.  It even has a very well kept heated salt water pool!  The staff gets an "A" plus"  However there is an elephant in the room and only gets a 2 star from me!  In Real Estate, they say, "location, locaTION, LOCATION!  On the surface, The Tides Inn has "LOCATION" - LAGUNA BEACH. However,, though it has a name that exudes "LOCATION", it does not have any combination of the letters l o c a t i o n.    It is not on the beach, it isn't close to the
Manager Response: You are exactly right!  Booking online is a crap shoot.  Most informed travelers realize this and call the hotel direct.  It is the only way to go.  You can ask a real person your questions.  We do not advertise that we are on the beach or that we have a view.  We are clean and quaint and our staff is the finest.  We wish you the best staying with the other 7 hotels in Laguna for 30% less.   Linda

Summary: We have been coming to Laguna Beach for years always staying for just one night while staying with friends in San Diego. This was our first time in the Tides and we loved it. The staff were brilliant and very helpful. Room perfect and it was very clean. The best thing is that you are not charged for parking and can just literally drive off the main road straight in to the hotel car park. That and a lovely dip in the swimming pool in the morning - a great hangover cure after sampling the delights of the many bars and restaurants in Laguna Beach. Would highly recommend.
Manager Response: Sounds to us like we are all on the same page!! Great staff, Clean, No extra charges, Swimming in a salt water pool, Drinking, Eating. Looking forward to your return as we are sure you are too. Thanks so much for taking the time to comment. Linda

Summary: Enjoyed my stay, location was great but was not happy with the amount of money it costs to have my 2 small dogs stay. They had a nice outdoor area with pool and barbeque and the rooms have a kitchenette. Just a short walk from downtown Laguna and across the street for Heisler Park and the beach.
Manager Response: Having a pet or two is certainly expensive in every way.  It does take extra time for our amazing housekeepers to clean rooms after a pet has visited.  We would rather have our guests travel with their pet than not.  (boarding a pet is very expensive and unhealthy for the pet)  We are very glad you enjoyed your stay with us otherwise.  Thanks so much for your feedback. Linda

Summary: Long time beach bum who has not been to Laguna Beach in years. After a family death and funeral had to get away for a few days. Remembered the Tides from days of old. Never stayed at the Tides just saw it there on PCH. Well, anyway we arrived and what a WONDFERFUL result. Walked in and greeted by a warm friendly person who made us feel more than a check in customer. This is an old throw back motor lodge that has been updated. Close to Broadway and PCH: close to main beach;close to "Laguna Beach" in general. Traffic noise from PCH, yes but they give you ear plugs. I like the traffic noise, so should you!! Just cannot say anything bad about The Tides Inn. Will be back, will not hesitate to recommend The Tides Inn to you. Travel a lot, can afford to travel and do not generally rave
Manager Response: Your review is very appreciated by all of us.  We try hard and are oh so happy when our guests enjoy The Tides as much as we do.  Thanks so much and we look forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary: Our King kitchenette room was clean, spacious, pleasantly decorated and the staff were great hosts personalising our stay. The air conditioner was noisy, but cooled the room and the bed was very comfortable. Well positioned near the beach, restaurants and a short walk to the shops. Nice pool area. Positioned on the quieter end of the main road meant some road noise was present, but not too loud on our weekend stay.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review.  We all appreciate your thoughts and hope you plan to visit Laguna Beach again real soon.  November is always gorgeous here. Linda

Summary Heading: Nice Motel - Terrible Management and Staff
Summary: Manager and Staff have no clue about Customer service. Charged one person in our group for 3 rooms instead of one. Charged numerous rooms to me after I had called (at their request) many times to update them on who was paying for each room !! Threatened to kick me out of my reserved room when I complained. I brought in approx. 25 room/nites to  their Motel for a wedding, worth around $5000 and they threaten to kick me out - geez ! Terrible Customer Service = will not stay there again, would highly recommend staying somewhere else. Buyer beware
Manager Response: We realize that our loudest complainers are often our biggest fans.  We know because you took the time to write which shows you have passion. Nobody is flawless. Your wedding weekend is the reason we will no longer do wedding parties at The Tides unless the wedding party rents every room. We were as frustrated as you were.  We recommend The Ritz Carlton or The Montage for your next visit to Laguna Beach. Thank you. Linda

Summary: Lovely little hotel with charming rooms.  It took a while for the air conditioning to cool off room as it is a unit hanging from the ceiling, but was fine after a few hours.  They honored our request for a min-fridge, which was appreciated. We loved having the beach supplies they were able to provide-boogie boards, sand toys, beach umbrella, and towels.  The location was great, a block from the beach and 10 minutes from center of town with restaurants and bars.  We would love to stay there again sometime.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If your lucky enough to visit Laguna Beach , then please stay in this beautiful Inn. Situated 5 minutes walk from the beach , The Tides Inn really has great staff.  Restaurants are 5-10 minutes walk away which all do lovely food.  Everyone in Laguna Beach is just really nice !
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Cozy, charming, friendly and great value
Summary: My friends and I stayed in the two largest rooms for a couple of nights this October. It was the most expensive place on our generally hostel-based road trip but well worth the premium and very good value by the standards of Laguna, or anywhere actually. Beds were huge and comfy. Everything was perfectly clean. Pool area, though we didn't use it, was pretty to look at. Location is great, v close to the centre of town and even closer to a great cliff walk down to the beach. We were at the back and didn't hear any road noise. Staff were vv friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Walking distance from the best beach in Laguna and lovely hotel
Summary: We stayed here to visit Laguna Beach and it was the perfect choice. It's walking distance from the beach near Heisler Park which we love. The motel itself was lovely. Loads of parking including additional spaces behind the hotel. Check-in was easy and staff were very nice. The room felt very cosy and we felt at home. The A/C worked well which we appreciated on a toasty October day. We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Such a beautiful and homely place to stay: Cant wait to go back
Summary: My Boyfriend and I stayed her in our summer tour around california. Although we were on a budget and this was slightly out of it, we couldn't resist its charm and elegance. The room was impeccably clean and fresh. The rooms are extremely homely all individually designed. The bed was extremely comfortable the best nights sleep we had all trip. some great recommendations on restaurants as well a warm welcome by staff and a sad but warm farewell the next day.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Absolutely loved the tides inn! Clean and charmingly cozy rooms, amazing service, nice pool and great outdoor fireplace by the pool. Fantastic location, close to shops, restaurants and the beach. All this awesomeness and for a great price! No complaints whatsoever! Would definitely recommend and I would most definitely stay there again. It felt like home!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Would you like to kick around Laguna Beach enjoying art galleries, garden cafes and walks on the beach? The Tides Inn is the perfect location to enjoy all of this in addition to resting comfortably with all the amenities. We chose a room with a kitchen and dinette, great to have a place to snack after long hikes and snorkeling. The staff was super as well. Coffee in the morning and wine in the evening......that's California Beach living!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at The Tides, a great location to explore Laguna Beach on foot...easy to walk to restaurants and shops... We loved the outdoor fireplace by the pool in the evenings, and met some new friends. Our room #208 located at the top of the property was decorated in a mod zen style and even though on the smaller side it met all our needs and the bed was comfortable. Clean and tidy throughout, the hotel is quaint and has a certain charm all its own. The staff was super friendly and we felt like we were treated well. They also have beach chairs, towels and umbrellas to check out at no extra charge. Overall a good value for your money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Normally, when traveling to Laguna Beach, we stay at another family owned motel overlooking the beach. That location can't be beat. However, that room runs me about $400/night.   Since we were traveling with our daughter and SIL this time and needed 2 rooms, we decided on The Tides because it was almost half the price and had good reviews. The Tides location is very good, on the north end. It is across from Heisler Park access, near galleries, the art museum and a few restaurants (Las Brisas, Gina's pizza, Madison Square and Garden, etc and the soon to be opened Urth Cafe). It's walking distance to downtown and main beach. We also walked to the Pageant of the Masters (easy walk) and took the trolley home. The location negative is that it is at the top of a hill from downtown. We
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It's different in a great way
Summary: The Tides inn is a really cute unique hotel in a great Laguna beach location. The PCH is a busy street, but I had no problem sleeping on the second story facing the ocean. These rooms are a great price and very charming. Our room said that it was built in 1949 and that style remains in the furnishings and room d√©cor. It comes with a kitchenette (sink, small fridge, cabinets with dinnerware and utensils, keurig coffee maker) and a small bathroom. The king bed was a little firm but comfortable. The furniture is unique and very homey. The flat screen had many channels, the pool is small but nice and closes at 10pm. The hardwood floors are really great and good for those sandy feet. The AC is a wall unit and it was strangely hot in Laguna at the time so it took a while to cool down
Manager Response: none

Summary: My Husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Tides...we like low key small places like this. They make you feel like you are a guest in their private home. The Saltwater pool was heaven and swimming next to the Fireplace at night was amazing! Only 1 block to the beach, Trolley nearby and you can walk into town too! Also nice to have your own kitchen... Wish I was still there!!
Manager Response: You were our guest and we wish you were still here also.  Our staff is so lovely and hope you return soon. Linda

Summary: The Tides is a lovely, small property that is clean, very comfortable, and in a great location. We had two rooms and each had a small kitchenette, which is a great touch in pricey Laguna Beach. We would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: We absolutely look forward to your return visit.  Thank you. Linda

Summary: My wife and I stayed one night mid-week in conjunction with attendance at this year‚Äôs ‚ÄúPageant of the Masters‚Äù. Our stay was pleasant. This is a quaint older property, but it is conveniently located, well maintained and has sufficient amenities to attract anyone that wants to stay in central Laguna Beach. Our room did have a few minor issues; peeling ceiling paint, slow sink drain and a leaky shower pipe, but these will be corrected as soon as the busy summer season allows. The plus of being centrally located is also a minus because the property is directly on PCH and does get a lot of road noise, especially the west facing rooms and the patio. This made sitting poolside less than enjoyable, and I came away from the pool with more tension than when I sat down. The biggest kudos
Manager Response: Thanks so much for a helpful and honest review.  We appreciate your understanding.  This  summer has been our busiest since we purchased The Tides 12 years ago.  We are not complaining but it was quite frustrating for us not to be able to keep up with small fixes and carpet cleaning.  Hoping to see you again real soon. Linda

Summary Heading: Central Location, Friendly Staff, Great Accomodations
Summary: Amazingly easy to make a reservation, although they do book up well in advance. There are plenty of rooms, some with kitchens, most with refrigerators. The staff is amazingly friendly, helpful and willing to go above and beyond. There is a heated, salt-water pool with a great log-burning fireplace to sit and enjoy a beverage until 10:00 pm. The rooms are comfortable, with window air-conditioning units. Coffee service is in the room. Crabtree and Evelyn bathroom essentials. Comfortable bed and pillows. About 2.5 minute walk to the water and beaches. Great service and great location, less than 12 minutes walk to the Pagent of the Masters and all of the other galleries and things to see in Laguna.
Manager Response: We think you covered everything right down to the minute!!  Thank you very much.  Please return soon. Linda

Summary: Stayed for two days during pageant. Nice rooms, comfortable beds, everything worked. In room Keurig. Staff very attentive and friendly. Pool is clean and cool. Close to everything, walking distance to beach, shops and art galleries. Nice stay.
Manager Response: Thank you.  Short and sweet.  Great comments.  Hoping you return soon. Linda

Summary Heading: A cozy home away from home
Summary: Clean cozy room at a great rate. Staff was very pleasant and helpful in regards to dining nearby. Unfortunately our daughter fell ill and we did not get to spend the night. It might get noisy due to close proximity to the street but they did provide complimentary ear plugs. We really enjoyed our time by the pool during the day. A very inviting heated saltwater pool.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking time to review even though you did not stay.....Hoping your daughter is well recovered and hoping you will be back for a longer stay. Linda

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Tides Inn for one night in Laguna Beach and it was absolutely adorable! The owners definitely pay attention to detail in their property as visualized in the decor of the rooms. The place is in a PERFECT LOCATION; an easy five to ten minute walk to nearby shops, restaurants and even the beach!! Compared to other hotels near by, The Tides is reasonably priced and offered us everything that we could have possibly needed.
Manager Response: To us--you are a perfect couple.  Just look at that happy photo!  Many thanks for the kudos.  We are always thankful for kind words. Linda

Summary: I love this little hotel, this is the second time I stayed here for my birthday.  I never really hear any noise from PCH, I always request room 208 on the 3 rd floor you can even see the ocean from that room.  I love that the owner's have the birthday special it makes it affordable during The Pageant of the Masters.  The hotel is walking distance to town and their is a bus and trolley stop nearby if you need public transportation.
Manager Response: Many thanks from all of us for taking the time to write such kind words.  We work hard to make The Tides a great place to be and always appreciate a happy guest.  Yes, 208 is a darling room.  A past guest actually left that Buddha picture hanging by the window--I guess when they read the Buddha quote!!   Looking forward to your next visit.  Linda

Summary: Be prepared if staying with your pet. There is absolutely no where for them to go to the bathroom. I was advised to cross the busy highway and use Heisler Park. They also charge you by the weight of the dog which did not make sense. Upon check out I made a suggestion that they make a small area on the property available. Management just shrugged his shoulders and said it would smell!
Manager Response: Wow.  You almost make us want to change our policy to "No Pets." When we decided to be pet friendly, we knew there had to be some rules.  Pets are not allowed in every room because of allergies etc.  Cleaning a room after a dog has been a guest means much more time and work.  Large dogs generally have much more hair.  We insist on leashes.  As far as bathroom areas, we only have a paved parking lot and do not have a grass area at all.  The pool area is off limits.  The majority of pet owners who stay here are happy they do not have to board their animals. Linda

Summary: Nice little hotel and nice staff.  Convenient to everything.  Only downside is that you need earplugs between the traffic on PCH and the loud a/c is loud. Other than that its nice. Don't stay in room 201, way too loud.  They ought to price the rooms based on noise level.
Manager Response: We are as frustrated as you about the traffic noise.  We have tried hard to work with what we have by supplying earplugs, putting water shooters in the pool, having really loud air conditioners--- (sorry, just kidding about that!!)  We have replaced the air conditioner and thanks for letting us know.  Our 3 rooms located on the highway side of our property are priced accordingly.  We thank you for taking the time to review The Tides. Linda

Summary: The hotel is close to Main Beach and downtown is within walking distance. It's a great location. Everything is superclean and we loved the kitchenette amenities which we weren't expecting. The staff is almost always available with great recommendations. There are two things you need to know 1) it's right on N. Coast Highway which is very very noisy. It's not relaxing sitting by the outdoor pool. 2) the bathrooms are in desperate need of hooks!  There was a towel rack on one wall and one hook on the door and this wasn't enough for a family.  It's a great place to hang your clothes, shower and get out but not a place to spend a lot of time.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for choosing The Tides.  We do have a good location and our kitchenettes are quite popular.  We are located on Coast Highway so of course we realize there is traffic noise.  Very hard to change that scenario but we are hanging more hooks in the bathrooms.  Thanks for letting us know.  Hoping you return soon.  (a tip:  very quiet with gorgeous sunsets in the winter months) Linda

Summary: Stayed here with family of four for one night to attend the Art show and the Pageant of the Masters.  We were able to walk to the beach and the center of town. This is a motel with a nice pool and air conditioning. The owners were very helpful with recommmendations and directions. The motel is very clean and the rooms although not large were very functional with plenty of room for luggage and lots of shelves.   Laguna Beach is a beautiful place with a small town atmosphere and natural beauty. I would highly recommend The Tides especially after you check the prices of other lodging in that area.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the lovely review.  It means so much to all of us.  We look forward to a return visit. Linda

Summary: I took my wife to The Tides for her birthday. We have been to the Sawdust Festival in Laguna Beach many times & decided to go there in the evening, and spend the night in town. There are many nice places in Laguna Beach, but the Tides offers a good location with good value. We stayed in Room 214. It's upstairs & toward the back of the property. It has a kitchenette and you can see a little of the Ocean from the window. (But don't think of it as an ocean view room.) The room is nice with wood floors and a good bed. The bathroom is small with little counter space for toiletries and a small stall shower. They also provide ear plugs, in case you don't like the sound of the traffic on PCH. We live in a Very quiet neighborhood & we stayed here on a Friday night when the traffic should
Manager Response: We are happy  to know you enjoyed your stay and we want to  thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review.  It was especially nice to read your kind remark about our young summer time apprentice and helper, Faith.  Faith is a friend and neighbor who chose to make it her mission this summer to help us with guests services  and begin to learn the in and outs of the hospitality business.   We enjoyed her young and helpful energy and are pleased to read that you did, too. We'll hope to have you and your family as our guests again.   Kind Regards,  Dale Johnson

Summary: My family of four loved The Tides! We stayed over Fourth of July weekend, and had a wonderful time! Our room was near the back of the hotel on the second floor, and we did not hear any street noise. Our room was roomy enough for our family, especially with the kitchen as an added bonus.The manager was super-friendly and helpful, and so were the owners, who were there that weekend. We relaxed by the outdoor fireplace while kids played in pool, which had pool toys. We were provided with towels and chairs for the beach. The manager suggested Madison Square and Garden for breakfast, which was eclectic and delicious. Watched the fireworks on the beach from the pool area, which was the perfect spot. Will stay here again!
Manager Response: We think of our place as having a FRONT ROW SEAT for our annual fireworks show and we are thrilled to know that  you and your family enjoyed it,  just as we do. Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review, we will look forward to having you and your family as our guests again.   Warm Regards,  Dale Johnson

Summary: So, based on the reviews of this place, I was expecting something much more. Below is a summary of my experience:  PROS: Location--Beach, trolley stops, shops, and restaurants are all within walking distance. Staff--The staff is pleasant, knowledgeable, and helpful Price--It's not cheap, but it was definitely more affordable than other hotels in the area.  CONS Maintenance--All the walls in our room needed to be cleaned and repainted. The corners were dusty. Many of the appliances in the kitchenette were old and outdated. The blender had crusty stuff on it. The furniture was old. The floor, which is tile, had sand residue on it and we either had to wear shoes in the room or wipe our feet off before we got in bed.   AC--Our unit had a kitchenette/dining/living room area and a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beatiful place to stay, friendly reception, very close to the Beach.
Summary: Tides is relaxing.  Most rooms have kithcenettes that are very handy with microwave and a small refrig.  Rooms are nicely decorated and bed is comfortable.  We liked the location that is very central to all beaches and to the city.  If you want to spend your day at the beach, take the Mrytle street and you will be at the beach about  half a block.   You can walk to Laguna Beach (5 blocks or so) for the restaurants or night life or take one of the free shuttles that runs along the beach. Free parking at the Inn.
Manager Response: Thanks you for taking the time to write such a nice review, we appreciate your sharing both wonderful feelings about The Tides, as well as to inform future guest on ways to make their stay as enjoyable as you found your visit to be.   Again thank you and we will hope to have you as our guest again soon.   Kind Regards, Dale Johnson

Summary: John, Sophia and Karen were so accommodating and nice and so were the owners but I don't know their names. Clean and comfortable, close to everything, plus there's a free shuttle at the corner street..wifi, parking.... Such a quaint place, thank you for everything!
Manager Response: Linda and I receive so many wonderful compliments regarding Sophia, John,  and Karen.  We are ever so grateful for each and every compliment and we feel  blessed to have each one of them on our team.  Thanks you for taking the time to write such a nice review, we'll hope to have you as our guests again soon. Kind Regards,  Dale Johnson (owner)

Summary: This place is located in walking distance to everything you need.  The couple that run the place are helpful and the nicest people you will meet.  (Not to mention very helpful).  I plan on returning to Laguna and will stay here anytime I'm in the area.
Manager Response: Dale and I completely agree.  Sophia and John and Karen are the cream of the crop.  We appreciate your review and look forward to your return visit.  Thanks so much. Linda

Summary: Lovely room, really nice people very helpful when booking ( we are from the UK ), but they phoned us back as the Internet was playing up. Very good price for Laguna, five minute walk into town, maybe less. Ample parking, swimming pool if the Pacific isn't good enough for you. Try it.
Manager Response: I will make sure to pass along your compliments to Sophia and John and the staff.  Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us.  We are glad you found us and hope for a return visit very soon. Linda

Summary: We stayed in 214 for 2 nights. The room is a good size but could do with a good clean. The wooden bed frame had a a covering of dust on it. The bedding was clean. If you have a bad back I would like to make you aware the bed had no support and we both left worse backs than we arrived with. The wardrobe was adequate for a short stay but the draws look like they have just been picked up for a boot sale and I wasn't prepared to put my clothes in them. The bathroom was ok apart from the shower height, you can remove it from from the holder and this is how I managed to wash my hair. But the height is really only suitable for people that are under 5ft tall. The motel does have good parking facilities and a lovely pool area, also it is a short walk into the central town area and beach.
Manager Response: We encourage guest feedback, both critical and positive.  We always appreciate the positive remarks and are hard at work on the negatives.  Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review. Linda

Summary: Overall not bad, but definitely nothing special. It feels like an old motel but if you just want to hang downtown the location is in walking distance.  When I compared prices this one seemed like a good option for a quick trip.   They could probably update their decor as it felt a bit dated.
Manager Response: We like to say you can spend one night at The Montage or a week at The Tides.  Yes, we are old--built in 1949.  We strive to provide a wonderful experience and we thank you for giving us a try. Linda

Summary: The heart of Laguna is its charm. Without breaking the bank, a stay at The Tides, captures the charm, the beach and the perfect getaway. Freeway traffic on the coast highway is no bother because just steps away is the ocean. A new favorite for us!
Manager Response: We all loved the way you summed us up!  "Without breaking the bank" has always been our goal--so families can afford to come to this beautiful town.  We look forward to welcoming you back.  Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review. Linda

Summary Heading: 2 night stay on our California road trip honeymoon
Summary: This place is so gorgeous! So happy to have found it. The staff are so lovely and very helpful. The bedroom was great, beautifully decorated & very comfortable. The pool area is fun and in the evening they'll put the fire on for you and there's a lovely seating area where you can chill out and enjoy the stars by the fire. Wish we could've stayed longer. Plenty of parking which is free and there was wifi too. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: We are so pleased that you loved our room and had such a relaxing stay.  The outdoor fireplace is so lovely at night--glad you got to take advantage of it.  Now you have to get a star/constellation app!  We look forward to seeing you again and thanks so much for choosing The Tides. Linda

Summary: My daughters (10&12) and I stayed here for a week at the end of May. This was our first time at the inn. We usually rent VRBO. Since we are former Laguna residents, we are busy visiting friends and family and our favorite Laguna beaches and places. Room 104 definitely accommodated our needs with the kitchenette, pool, close proximity to the village and beach. The parking couldn't of been easier and the staff was always helpful and cheery. We slept well and the highway noise was not a problem even with the window open. The grounds are well maintained as well as the pool and it's surrounding area. The coffee in the room was a nice touch. If you are looking for the old Laguna beach vibe then this is the place for you.
Manager Response: We very much enjoyed having you stay with us at The Tides and hope you return every year.  It is always a pleasure to have happy, appreciative guests.  Reviews like yours make us feel terrific.  Thanks so much, Linda

Summary: My room was nicely decorated and very clean.  The pool is  good size and the staff is helpful.  The hotel is within walking distance to the main downtown but far enough from the crowded areas. I recommend going to the small cove beaches nearby instead of the main beach.  There is a free shuttle to get around town.   Many restaurants have Happy Hours.
Manager Response: Reviews like yours make us feel terrific.  Thanks so much for sharing.  Your compliments will be passed along to our staff.  We look forward to seeing you again. Linda

Summary Heading: Lovely One Night Stay on Road Trip
Summary: Booked ahead on a road trip and we were very pleased with our choice.  Very pleasant check in, friendly, helpful and professional. The room was great with some lovely little touches which set it apart from your usual Inn, good furnishings and facilities, fridge etc. The pool and surrounds looked great though we did not use, we would have had we stayed longer. Location was great on the edge of town with a short walk to the beach and town centre. You can tell that the owners take pride in their business, we were impressed having stayed at many Inns on our 3 week road trip.
Manager Response: We are so happy you stayed with us.  Yes, Sophia and John are quite the perfect greeters.  We all love that you noticed our "small touches" in the room but are anxious for you to try our lovely salt water pool on your next visit.  Please return soon for many more beach walks.  Thanks so much for your feedback. Linda

Summary: This hotels location is very good, 5 min away to the beach! The room that we stayed was very nice, number 205, clean and cozy. The staff at the reception was very kind and welcoming. On summer time there could be a bit noise but anyway...
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a lovely review.  We all appreciate your kind words.  We love what we do and we love Laguna Beach.  It is with great pleasure that we share our town with the world.  Looking forward to your next visit.  Thanks, again. Linda

Summary Heading: What a wonderful place to stay
Summary: We've spent two days in may at The tides and it was a great experience. The room, 214, is so elegant, everything is perfect, the bed is perfect, the armchair so comfortable, the kitchen and the bathroom so nice. The reception is very nice. The parking is perfect. We've had a very good time at the swimming pool. It's a wonderful place to stay after the beach. The beach is so close. When we will come back at Laguna we will back at The tides.
Manager Response: WOW!  Your review thrilled us and so did the lovely photos.  Room 214 is one of the favorite rooms.  Hoping you found the hidden quote in the kitchen so you realize why we call it the "Marilyn" room!  We hope to see you again when you return to Laguna Beach.  Thanks so much. Linda

Summary: My Husband and I stayed here for 2 nights as the starting point of our California road trip. We required late check in and this was arranged really easily with clear instructions on how to check in. The owners were really helpful in getting this arranged :) The room was nicely decorated with a big comfy bed and decent shower in the bathroom. Because of the location it can be slightly noisy, due to the passing cars. There were ear plugs on the bedside cabinet but we did not need to use them and slept really well. The parking is great and is right outside the front as well as behind the accommodation. We used the pool which is really nice and pool towels were provided which was good, so that we didn't have to carry wet towels in our luggage afterwards. The location is really good,
Manager Response: We are hoping you do stay here again on yet another fabulous California road trip.  Of course we definitely want you to stay at The Tides again.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your Laguna Beach visit and please return real soon.  Thanks so much. Linda

Summary: We stayed 3 wonderful days at the Tides in. The staff was very friendly and more than accomodating. The yard has a pool and a fireplace that is great for those nights where you want to enjoy the wonderful Laguna weather. We will definitely return -and though we went as a family, it would be a great romantic spot for couples.
Manager Response: Yes, please come back for a romantic vacation.  Laguna Beach has something for everyone and every age.  We hope you return to experience The Tides over and over again.  Thanks so your kind and thoughtful words. Linda

Summary Heading: Somewhere between average and very good
Summary: Small, clean, well appointed rooms. Has the feel of an upgraded motel, but it's well maintained, with good service and quality beach style touches to the fixtures and fittings. Cars are parked directly in front of the rooms, making it feel cramped, and the PCH runs right outside the rooms that face the street. Central location is 10-15 minute walk from the centre, but close to beach access. I would recommend it for those on a budget, though I thought it overpriced for the rate we paid ($300).
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to review The Tides.  We appreciate your candid feedback about parking and traffic--problems for all hotels on Coast Highway in Laguna Beach.  (happy to say our parking is complimentary as parking downtown is very expensive)  We do pride ourselves on cleanliness and good service and thank you for noticing.  We all hope you return soon.  Happy travels. Linda

Summary Heading: Totally pleased.  We couldn't have done better.
Summary: They have squeezed a lot of quality into a very small piece of property.   Nicely furnished rooms, lovely and spacious pool and outdoor bar area.    It's a very short walk to the beach and boardwalk which hugs the bluffs and sandy beaches in the area.   You can walk to the downtown which has not lost its charm and character over the years.   Lots of good restaurants and shops within a 10 minute walk.   Parking is very tight but that is the only drawback here.   Be prepared for some traffic noise but it wasn't intrusive.   I was amazed at the quality for such a reasonable price.
Manager Response: Thanks so much from all of us for the lovely review.  We enjoy hearing what you liked and hope to see you again when you return to Laguna Beach.  Our staff work very hard to make our guests feel special.  We certainly agree with you about not being able to do better!   Please return very soon and thanks again. Linda

Summary Heading: We would love to stay again!
Summary: I did a lot of research to find the best place for the best off-season price in Laguna Beach for a 2 night stay. And for me it has proved to be The Tides Inn, an older smaller Hotel (definitely part of it's charm) located on Pacific Coast Highway. We enjoyed a lovely fireside chat (at the pool area) with some folks from Ireland who stay at the Hotel for two weeks each year. Our room was on the second floor with a kitchenette; the bed and all furnishings exceptional, the linens clean, scented, comfy and plush, and everything spotless! We had a partial ocean view, and even though lots of traffic on PCH, our room was quiet and we did enjoy a good night's sleep. The Hotel's Management Team is very caring, they really do look out for all of their guests. Because of some mechanical
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to write.  Yes, we want you to return-drama or no drama!  Always love catering to such nice guests.  Always happy to help.  Sophia and John were delighted to be acknowledged.  They are the best.  See you in the spring! Linda

Summary: We had a very comfortable stay at the Tides Inn. The nicely furnished and clean room with king size bed was spacious & comfortable, and we really liked the kitchenette. Flatscreen tv, free wifi and beach chairs/towels (free of charge) made it even more comfortable. The front desk staff member went out of his way to help us with all our (special) requests. All in all, a very good deal.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lovely Inn across from beach in Laguna
Summary: I stayed at The Tides in April for one Saturday night.  Very professional, hospitable staff. The Inn is an older motel-like building, but it's very tastefully decorated, clean, and cozy. Gorgeous saltwater pool with BBQ, chaise lounges, etc.  The room was comfortable, with a large fireplace.  The location is ideal, in walking distance to the center of town and shops, restaurants and galleries.  Across the street from beautiful Heisler park.  Good value.  I would recommend that unless you really want and need to be right on the ocean, this inn is a great (and much more economical alternative) to those Laguna Beach hotels located on the water.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at The Tides twice now and have recommended it to our family and friends. It is very cozy and friendly. The rooms we had were large and nicely furnished with "at home" items like books, games, and interesting pictures. The parking is a little cramped so don't bring a big van or truck. It's within walking distance to Heisler Park which one of our favorites. Some rooms are quieter than others because of traffic noise.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Myself, my husband and 2 friends stayed here for 1 night whilst we travelled California. The rooms are beautifully spacious (we had 2 huge beds in one room, with a seperate kitchen and large bathroom)clean, and so well presented with a beachy theme throughout. The swimming pool is lovely and heated! There is also a table, sofas and a real log fire that you can use in the evenings - we ordered a pizza from up the road and stayed around the fire!It was beautiful, warm and a great friendly atmosphere. The staff could not be more helpful. I would say the hotel is roughly a 0.5 mile walk from the main little hub of Laguna town, however the walk is lovely and on flat ground. We could not have picked a better hotel!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at The Tides a few times over the years. I think it is the one of the best things about Laguna Beach! For me, it is just perfect. The price is right (very important), even though it is a little more expensive than it once was; the new staff are competent and helpful and the place is clean and well located so you can easily walk to the beach, Madison Square Garden restaurant, Pavilions grocery store and downtown. It is a two-minute walk from my brother‚Äôs house, which for me is its biggest benefit. The pool area is convenient and the pool is adequate and just the right temperature. The parking is tight and with my large truck it was very challenging, but the staff sorted it out for me and made a special effort so that the spot I needed was saved every time I left and
Manager Response: none

Summary: This small and quaint appearing hotel is on PCH and just a short walk to the main beach and even closer to the tide pools of Laguna Beach.  I had the occasion to stay one night for a wedding nearby.  I was traveling with family and had 3 rooms reserved.  This hotel is very reasonable and has great amenities like a kitchen.  Very classy, clean, and homey.  My room had a view of the ocean, and I left my windows open.  The downside to being on PCH is traffic noise and there were earplugs if needed.  I did not need them.  There is also a pool.  My hope is to go back and stay 3-4 days and use The Tides Inn as a base for visiting in the regions as I am originally from there.  Great staff; friendly and very helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just north of main beach and across PCH this small hotel is very clean and very reasonably priced. The proprietors were very friendly and welcoming. Location is convenient to all of what LB has to offer and we will be back. They have a nice saltwater pool and outdoor fireplace.
Manager Response: We are all so pleased that you were pleasantly surprised.  That makes us happy.  We love our  Tides and aim to please.  We look forward to welcoming you back. Thanks so much. Linda

Summary Heading: Classic Motel on PCH near bluffs - great location and well appointed
Summary: Pet friendly but lock in rate before going as it varies. You can stay here for the year of your birth as the rate on actual birthday but must stay at least 2 nights. I was born in 1944 so $44 and one night regular rate plus pet fee. It's darling with a bit of street noise which wasn't enough to bother us. If you've stayed in big cities it won't be a bother but if you live where it's super quiet might not choose this location. We loved our stay. Walk to the Bluffs area and Las Brisas.
Manager Response: Our rates are locked in when you book.  We do have a small pet fee of $25 per day and a large pet fee of $40 per day--only changes with the size of the dog.  So sorry if there was a misunderstanding.  The birthday special is hard to beat although you do have to stay exactly on your birthday and one more day--either before or after.   Thanks so much for taking the time to write so I could try to explain.  We do give a small discount if you book directly with us but we do not give discounts after the booking is made.  Hope I have helped. We do look forward to your next visit. Linda

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Tides.  The rooms are nice and the staff is friendly.  We were able to walk to the beach and to downtown Laguna Beach.  There is street noise from the passing highway which I'm sure is true with other hotels in Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: You speak the truth and we applaud you.  Thanks so much for staying with us. Linda

Summary: Stayed for 5 nights in. 2 double bed room with my daughter. Room had air con, flat screen TV, comfy beds and as a ground floor or one, small patio with chairs and table. Bath with overhead shower and soft, thick white towels. Toiletries provided and hairdryer. Pool towels also provided, for a very nice pool considering this is a motel style property. Close to the action but as on main road expect road noise. It didn't  bother us, the pluses of the place more than compensated. Best of all, the staff  were very helpful and accommodating. Would recommend and would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks so very much for calling us a "little gem."  Makes me want to change our name!  We are glad you had a wonderful parent/child vacation.  We hope for families to experience terrific vacations in Laguna Beach as there is so much to enjoy and learn.  Our art galleries are amazing and a visit to our Marine Mammal Center is a must.  If you are ever in Laguna when they release a recovered sea lion back into the ocean--it is pure joy and many tears. Please return soon and thanks again. Linda

Summary: One of my dearest friends and I decided on a road trip.  The Tides Inn provided VERY clean and comfortable accommodations.  The office staff were very friendly and helpful.  It's close (walking distance) to EVERYTHING Laguna Beach.  We loved the Inn, the beach, the shopping, the art, and the area.  Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: Traveling with friends is the greatest.  Thank you for choosing us.  We try hard to be clean and friendly and always helpful.  It is our pleasure. Glad to hear you are recommending and returning. Linda

Summary Heading: Cute, cozy, and a great location!
Summary: The Tides Inn was a lovely place for my husband and I to stay our one night in Laguna Beach.  We stayed in Room #208 which seemed more like a couple of little rooms in a vintage house than a standard motel room - we liked it!  Everything was cute and clean.  There are no elevators so be prepared for a few steps up if you're not on the first floor.  The pool area is lovely and even has a fireplace with couches grouped around it.  The woman at the desk who checked us in offered to build a fire for us if we wanted.  Heisler Park is just across the street which is an added advantage to staying here and there are many restaurants really close by (I recommend checking out Madison Square for breakfast).  PS  There were earplugs on the nightstand in case the traffic noise should bother
Manager Response: We are so happy you had a lovely evening at The Tides.  As our guests know (or I think they do) we have a quote in every room although some are hidden.   Room 208 has a quote from Buddha.  One of our fabulous and amazing guests actually left that Buddha picture for us when they departed.  Dale, myself, John, Sophia and Karen (who built your fire) all agree we have the nicest guests ever.  You make our job easy.  Thanks so much. Linda

Summary: After reading the amazing reviews, my daughter and I decided to stay at this vintage hotel that is in a great location. It turned out to be a nightmare where we got no sleep and had to change our own sheets. Here are a few reasons that I gave this a terrible review.   - The pillows are completely flat and old. Very uncomfortable - The sheets were itchy since they were such low quality - There were 3 different kinds of hairs on our pillows (long, short and shorter) when we first arrived. I had to put new pillow cases and sheets on our beds after a long day of travel. -There was hair and pubic hairs on the shelf in the bathroom. The desk woman had to bring up bleach and clean it. - The walls are paper thin and we heard stomping, crying, walking and talking (clear as day) all night
Manager Response: As every business owner is well aware, every so often an "impossible to please" guest comes along. It was clear from the beginning that you were unhappy with our hotel.  Sadly for all of us, no matter what we did to try to make your stay enjoyable, you continued to be unhappy here. In the end, we can see that our hotel was a poor fit for you. In retrospect, it probably would have been the best solution to let us help you find another hotel, as we suggested.   And while we are happy with our hotel, as are the vast majority of our guests, it is unfortunate that it was not an enjoyable stay for you. Linda

Summary: With parking at a premium in Laguna Beach it's great to have a hotel so well located - you can walk to just about everything. Parking is included in the room rate and they have a spot for each room so you can still find parking if you return late at night.   Thanks to input from previous reviewers we requested room 214 and were very happy with the room -  cozy furnishings, a small refrigerator, microwave and a Keurig coffee maker. If you run out of coffee the office staff will be happy to give you more tea or coffee. The kitchenette is well stocked with glasses and dishes for two. This room has its own flight of stairs so you don't have anyone walking past your room - nice bit of privacy.   There's no elevator so if you don't travel light you may want to request a room on the
Manager Response: WOW.  You really covered some territory!  We loved every word.  You are a great writer and reviewer--did not miss a thing.  Thanks for choosing The Tides and for taking the time to review us.  We always appreciate our guest's comments and strive to make you have a wonderful experience.Thanks again and please visit again soon. Linda

Summary: The Tides was directly across PCH from the beach and Heisler Park, which was great!  Our room (#201), though small, was cute and cozy. However, it was noisy since it faces PCH (as do rooms 101 and 102).  It's in a perfect location to walk to shops and restaurants. If you take a right out of the hotel, it's a 3-4 minute walk to a Von's with a Starbuck's in it.  If you turn left out of the hotel, it takes 10-12 minutes to walk to downtown Laguna Beach. We would recommend this hotel, but just be sure to request the rooms in the interior, not on the street side.  The pool area is nice too and includes a fireplace for cool evenings.
Manager Response: You are so right.  Those 3 rooms have a bit more traffic noise but are darling.  We try to always let our guests know about their location when they call to book and wish everyone would call direct to book as the problem most often happens when they do not book direct and are placed in a room fitting the bed description.  Thank you for making the most of it and taking the time to let other future guests know. (which is why I love reading reviews!)   We, of course, think you should not be in your room much and when you are in the room, be tooooo exhausted to hear any noise!! Please return soon and thanks again. Linda

Summary: My fianc√© grew up in Laguna Niguel and I wanted to go back and have her show me where she grew up.   We booked a room at The Tides based on the reviews here and we couldn't of been happier.   Our room was clean,  had a small kitchen with microwave,  dishes and utensils,  min fridge,  and a coffee maker.   The room had a cottage feel and walking distance to just about everything in main beach.   Free WiFi was a bonus and the staff was super friendly and attentive to the guest needs.   There are about 8 parking spots, which all required your dull attention when pulling in and out of. We read about a couple of units,  which might not provide as much buffer to the street noise,  but we were in 103 and nothing too crazy.   In fact,  if you're like me and need noise to sleep (a fan),
Manager Response: Thank you and we sure do hope you come back for every birthday.  That is such a fun and great special.  Also very happy you appreciated "no extra charges" -- parking might be tight but it is free and once you park the car, you can walk everywhere!  Glad you enjoyed our art-filled community and we hope to see you again soon. Linda

Summary Heading: Fantastic Cottage feel with Great Service
Summary: We stayed in the room at the top of the stairs.  Great views, cottage feeling, nice kitchen. John had suggested this room for myself, a friend and my daughter.  It is close to restaurants, shopping, the beach and the park.  The room was charming with a cheery, beach theme.  I like the antique/retro furniture.  And the bedding was very clean and comfortable.  Bed were comfortable too.  I would highly recommend for Laguna Beach, and would return to stay if I get a chance to visit this lovely town.  We enjoyed walking to shops and restaurants as well as the beach.  Traffic noise as reported by others didn't bother us.
Manager Response: We thank you so much for taking the time to write such a nice review.  You have no idea how much we appreciate the positive feedback.  Hoping to see you again in our lovely Laguna Beach. Linda

Summary: The location of this hotel is EXCELLENT! The rooms are a great value for the price.  I recommend highly.  It is right on the PCH and you can walk to the beach or downtown to the shops/restaurants/bars....
Manager Response: Short and sweet and to the point.  We loved every word and thank you for them. Linda

Summary: Every time we visit the the Tides the staff members are very cordial. This time, we had an especially positive experience.   I lost my iPhone and checked with the person in the office to see if it had been turned in. It had not been, but John offered to help me.   He went up with me to our room and called my phone with no answer. Then he showed me how to use "locate your iPhone app."    We went outside to the parking area where he used the app to help me find it between the seats in our car.   I was totally grateful and will always remember this act of kindness.
Manager Response: John is our gem.  He is also quite the "Mac Man" so with him at the desk, you chose the exact right time to misplace your phone.  He was also very pleased to help you and very impressed I might add that you knew your password.  Funny story with a happy ending! We appreciate you taking the time to write (it is so easy not to write) and look forward to your next visit to Laguna. Linda

Summary: The Tides Inn provided us with a very comfortable 3-day/night stay. While the Inn is somewhat older and does not have a particularly updated d√©cor, the room was clean and had all the amenities we needed. It is pet friendly, which was beneficial for us. The personnel were friendly and accommodating to our needs. The pool are was extremely nice with a fireplace and seating area.  The location was terrific, just a few blocks from the main center of Laguna Beach. Minor areas of our room (206) needed maintenance. The ceiling had several cracks and the washroom sink pipes needed replacing. We shared this with the office.  The location of the Inn is off of Coast Highway. While the traffic noise could be heard at night, it did not affect our sleep. We were advised that the end unit with
Manager Response: We are very happy you chose The Tides. We also appreciate the comments--the positives and the negatives.  We plan to re-do the ceilings upstairs soon (will be so messy) and constantly replace pipes.  Our favorite "Jeff the King" plumber is here often as The Tides was built in 1949! Looking forward to your next annual visit and we thank you for taking the time to write. Linda

Summary: We've stayed at The Tides a couple of times in recent years and have found it to be the best value for money hotel/motel in Laguna Beach. A small independent family affair who don't compromise on service or quality. The rooms are spacious and unique in decoration with good quality vintage style furnishings, but with all the desired facilities (coffee machine, high speed wifi, large flat screen TV's etc). Location is great and is within walking distance of all the best bars, restaurants, shops and beaches that Laguna has to offer. The Tides does also have a small (free) car park which makes it a great base to explore neighbouring Dana Point, Hunington Beach and exclusive Newport. Situated on the PCH means that there is some road noise, however it's never disrupted our sleep and
Manager Response: We could not have written a better review!  Thank you very much.  Hoping to see you back in Laguna very soon. Linda

Summary Heading: Perfect, low-key beachy place to stay
Summary: Dale who runs the property was extremely accommodating and gave us an upgrade upon our arrival. The room was beachy and artsy and the bed was extremely comfortable. Coffee/Tea machine in the room was a nice touch. 1 minute from Laguna Beach galleries, 5-10 minutes to the heart of town, across the street from the ocean.
Manager Response: We thank you for your kind words and the great review. Please return soon for another comfortable beachy sleep.  Hoping to see you in 2015.  Remember to check out our birthday special..... Linda

Summary Heading: We Already Made Our Return Visit Reservation
Summary: My husband and I celebrated our birthday weekend in Laguna and the Tides Inn was highly recommended to us.  Our room was absolutely lovely.  The bed was so comfortable (and the pillows!), impeccably clean and had everything we needed and more.   We could not have been more pleased with every aspect of our stay.   We have made our reservation for our anniversary weekend in seven months.  I anticipate becoming a "regular".  Thank you Linda, Dale and staff.
Manager Response: You are both so welcome.  We cannot begin to express how much we appreciate our regular "repeat" guests.  We are very pleased that you were so pleased.  See you for your anniversary! Thanks for taking the time. Linda

Summary: I stayed two nights at The Tides in Laguna Beach, and it was such a wonderful quaint place to stay. The view was so beautiful especially at sundown. The location was perfect and the attendant at the front desk was so caring wanting to serve my every need. The pool was warm and it had its own sprays across the pool.  Thank you so much, The Tide! We will be back..."
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment about our wonderful Laguna Beach sunsets.  Quite the photo-op!  Keep in mind that the fireworks on July 4th are directly in front of us also.  It is a WOW.  Happy that you enjoyed our salt water pool and the shooters.  Yes, we do have the most caring and happy staff and we all look forward to your return visit. Thanks again, Linda

Summary: I have been staying at the Tides Inn for a week now and am very impressed with this lovely, small hotel inn. The staff is extremely welcoming and attentive to both me and my dog. The rooms are a nice size, very clean, they have AC (if you want it), kitchenettes with microwave, coffeemaker and a small refrigerator. Each room is decorated in a very unique, charming manner. It's one block from the beach and also has a pool. There is free parking on the property, as well as free wifi and free coffee. There are two supermarkets very close by, as well as a pet supply store (for those that travel with their dogs).  The rooms on the second floor have a partial ocean view. But, most of all I appreciate the attentiveness of the staff. I will definitely be back!
Manager Response: We think you are charming and should work here.  You said it ALL and we ALL thank you for appreciating our hard work.  Makes us even happier! Thanks so very much. Linda

Summary: My fiance and I just got back from a trip to California and we decided to stay at The Tides in Laguna Beach. We weren't entirely sure what to expect as we hadn't stayed in many motel-style places. We were so pleased when we arrived at The Tides! Dale, the owner, checked us in and was absolutely amazing. He made sure we felt right at home in Laguna Beach and gave us a little run down of the town and the area. The hotel is clean, the staff are beyond friendly and the rooms are extremely comfortable. There is a little pool for casual swimming and a great area with a fire place outdoors that you can curl up near with a glass of wine. Perfect way to end your days in Laguna. They are currently doing some renovations (only painting when we were there) but the renovations did not
Manager Response: "Amazing" is one of our most favorite words.  Thanks so much.   The painting is complete and we are pleased.  We all thank you for putting up with those days!  Looking forward to your return visit, Linda

Summary: I stay in Laguna a few times a year.  I had been past The Tides many times in the past but had never stayed here.  There are several serviceable options in Laguna at reasonable prices and I'll now add The Tides to that list.  I got a room with a partial ocean view overlooking the pool with a kitchenette.  The Tides is old but well maintained and one plus with the age of the building is that it has character.  It's on PCH and there is quite a bit of road noise but I had a room toward the back so it wasn't a bother.   Linens and beds top notch, and the room spotless. The location is very close to downtown.  I parked the car and never used it.  One plus for this hotel is the free parking which you won't get at many of the other options in Laguna.  Within walking distance includes
Manager Response: The Tides is old (1949) and we also adore our location.  How can Heisler Park and the best of the art galleries be beat?  We are especially happy that you noticed we are affordable and clean--they have always been our goals.  Complimentary parking and wifi are the icing on the cake.... Thanks so much for taking the time to comment. Linda

Summary: Stopped here on our first night of a Cali road trip on our way out of the hole that is LA. Perfect location with good access to local shops, bars, restaurant and beach. Aircon was a little noisy, but apart from that, it was a great place to get over the jet lag on our first stop over to San D. Staff helpful too.
Manager Response: We all thank you for the kind words.  Please put The Tides on your next "road trip" for some more Laguna Beach fun. See you soon. Linda

Summary: Perfect location - right in the center of town, walking distance to restaurants, beach, etc.  The staff was really friendly and helpful.  Room was bright and spacious.  A bit of traffic noise from the PCH, but manageable.  And the price was right.
Manager Response: Short, Sweet and To The Point--we liked every word.  Thanks so much from all of us. Linda

Summary Heading: Perfect stay in lovely Laguna Beach
Summary: What a gorgeous little hotel in the heart of Laguna Beach. It was our first visit to Laguna Beach and we didn't really know what to expect and where to go, and didn't we pick the most perfect hotel! The manager and manageress were so kind and gave us as much information as we needed and even helped us with advice for our further travels to Los Angeles. The staff definitely made this place, however the hotel itself was lovely, our room was small but perfect for us with a very clean ensuite and the comfiest bed!! The pool area was really nice too, a place where you could chill with a drink after a day at the beach, there was even a BBQ area. We absolutely loved Laguna Beach and our stay at The Tides definitely made our visit so enjoyable. Thanks for such a lovely stay, we will
Manager Response: We thank you for liking and appreciating us.  Looking forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary Heading: Small family get together and Wedding
Summary: I just returned home from a three night stay at the Tides.  My husband and I got married at the gazebo in Heisler Park on 9/29/14 and were looking for a place for ourselves and our immediate family members to stay (We booked a total of 5 rooms).  The Tides offered comfortable rooms with kitchenettes - each with a lovely cottage-y charm.  All of the rooms were very clean, and the Tides offered free wi-fi, lots of free parking, and the staff were extremely accommodating.  Sophia and John allowed us to gather by the fireplace in the pool area for evening snacks and drinks, and they even left the padlock with us so we could stay past the typical pool closing time so our family could relax and talk as long as we wanted.  We were very impressed with the affordable rates for our rooms
Manager Response: We are most pleased your wedding was happy and your experience at The Tides was perfect.  We hope you plan all your getaway celebrations with us and we look forward to your return visits. Thanks so much for your very kind words. Linda

Summary Heading: Lovely retreat close to centre of town.
Summary: We stayed here at the beginning of September and really enjoyed our stay. Our room had a kitchenette (with a good sized fridge, microwave plates etc), more than adequate sized bathroom & bedroom. The ground floor room was clean & fresh & right across from the pool. We did manage to find a space for our Yukon XL rental car & pretty much only needed to use it only once because of the closeness to the centre of Laguna Beach. I would thoroughly recommend staying here. Our last visit to Laguna we stayed much further south on PCH and it was a long walk every time into the centre, this was so much better.
Manager Response: We are so happy you enjoyed your stay.  Also happy you could park a very large vehicle which is sometimes difficult.  Our location is terrific and as you know the vehicle stays parked because it is so easy to walk everywhere. We are looking forward to a return visit. Thanks again for writing to us. Linda

Summary Heading: Lovely Inn, great staff but needs improvements
Summary: We stayed for one night at the Tides Inn. The clerk at check-in was very nice and helpful.  The motel is located on the n coast highway and just some steps away from the beach and some very nice lagoons at the park. we got a complimentary pair of ear plugs for a noisy night. But it wasn't as loud as we thought so we don't need these.  The motel was very sweet, well-kept from the outside and had a very nice pool area with a small lounge with a fire place.   The room was small and the facilities were old school. The AC was very very loud and pretty old tool. My wife said it was very romantic. I think the room needs improvement. The phone was damaged and not working. The window of the bathroom was very small, rusted and shabby. The shower was old too.   Instead of the old
Manager Response: This is a tough review to respond to because you kind of liked us but our bathrooms are still small and some of our air conditioners make some noise.  Bottom line is your wife thought it was romantic which thrilled us and you would like to return which also thrills us. Thanks, Linda

Summary: The Tides Inn is great value in quite an expensive area. The rooms are a really good size (although the bathroom is very small) and very clean. The bed was really comfortable. We had a great nights sleep and didn't find it noisy despite being near the front of the hotel. Wi-fi was available in the rooms, but i found it a little hit and miss.  Parking is available and we were lucky enough to get a space just below our room.   The location is easy walking distance to a selection of good bars and restaurants and we were recommended places by reception, which were excellent.  Heisler Park is also just a short walk away where there is also access to the beach. Fantastic area to see the sun set.  Unfortunately we were only there one night so didn't have enough time to use the outdoor
Manager Response: We thank you for your review.  We love that you loved our comfy beds, had a great sleep, enjoyed our comp parking, location and even walked Heisler Park which is pure joy. FYI our Wifi has been updated and works great.  Please come back and stay longer. Linda

Summary: Motels in Laguna Beach tend to be pretty expensive, but the Tides is less expensive than the other places we checked. We were referred  to the Tides by the lady at the Visitor Center in town. We wanted a place that was walking distance to the town, and the Tides is only about 1/2 mile from town--but be aware that it is a moderate uphill walk from town. Rooms were not great but were clean and adequate. Our bed was comfortable. Our room was near the road, so we could not keep the windows open due to heavy traffic noise. If you go from the motel toward the ocean, there is a lovely walk along the top of the bluff with nice ocean views. Someone complained in a review about the window blinds letting in the sun. This is true, but if you turn the blinds upward instead of down, it is not
Manager Response: You called it exactly right.  We are affordable and clean--those were our goals! Your review (and thank you so much for writing it) is a stand-out and gets an A+ from all of us for that amazing tip about how to close the blinds.  Wow. Linda

Summary Heading: Watch your credit card bill carefully
Summary: The rooms are nice, the location is great (a block's walk to Heisler Park).  However, we had a surprise on the credit  card will when we received it.  A $200 penalty for smoking in the room (which we did not).   I called and asked for help. The desk clerk couldn't do anything and said he'd give a message to the owner "when she comes by".  A couple of days later, she called and left a message.  I called her back and still  have not heard from her.  Nothing was done by them to credit my account. Thank God I have a responsive credit card company.  They credited the bill and sent a letter to the establishment.  The Tides never responded, so my bill was adjusted by the credit card company...but that's not the way it should have been.
Manager Response: We charged a smoking fee because the room stunk of cigarette smoke and in the bathroom trash can we found many cigarette butts. We are a smoke-free environment and our policy is stated in the room and in the office and on your signed receipt. Linda

Summary Heading: Not a resort, but location and cleanliness are excellent
Summary: This hotel is clean and pleasant and is on Pacific Coast Highway, up the hill from Laguna Village (across from Las Brisas).  My girlfriend and I visited Laguna to attend the pageant of the masters.  This location was excellent because after the show the trolley dropped us off right in front of the inn.  Our room was decorated in a funky manner.  Even though it had two queen beds we were allotted only one parking space. It might be a good suite for a family of four because it has a kitchen and dining room.  The bathroom and shower are very small. The people in the office were extremely friendly and helpful. The mattresses were extremely comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your lovely review.  There is so much to do and see in Laguna Beach-so glad you were able to visit with your friend.  Believe us when we tell you we are oh so happy to have just one parking place per room in Laguna Beach (and complimentary at that!)  Please return soon as there is even more to see. Linda

Summary: After seeing all of the positive reviews for The Tides Inn, I was very excited for our stay. That excitement was VERY short-lived. This was my husband and I first overnight stay away from our two small children and the one thing we wanted was a good nights sleep. It seemed like The Tides Inn was dead-set on making that impossible!  The moment we walked in I laid down on the bed and felt the most *pathetic* pillows that I have ever experienced. It literally felt like someone stuffed a bunch of cotton balls in a pillowcase and called it a day. I've stayed at a Days Inn with better pillows. The sheets were scratchy, the bed saggy and there was a pubic hair on the decorative pillow...yuck!!  We called down to see if they had a better pillow and the lady working the front never
Manager Response: We sincerely aim to please everyone but it is impossible.  So glad you did find 2 good things about The Tides. Our location is ideal and our rates are affordable. Linda

Summary: This hotel is is by far the best place I have ever stayed at. The whole staff was friendly and EXTREMELY accommodating. John and Sophia made sure the littlest details were taken care of and Dale was so nice to allow a package to be UPS'd there last minute to save a bride from having a breakdown :) I love that each room is different and has it's own style. You dont feel like you are staying at a hotel, but rather a cute little beach cottage :)   You could see the ocean from the room (room 214), it was very clean, well stocked with little essentials. The bed was VERY cozy! The location is perfect - the beach is 2 blocks away and many delicious restaurants are in walking distance. I cant wait to return to Laguna Beach and stay at The Tides.  Thanks!
Manager Response: Yes, John and Sophia are the sweetest couple.  Dale and I are so happy to have them as our managers.  We are proud of The Tides and have worked hard to keep it clean and affordable.  It is always nice to be appreciated and we thank you very much.  We agree that the "Marilyn" room is one of the special rooms but we love them all for different reasons.  Hoping to see you soon. Thanks so much. Linda

Summary: After selecting this hotel on the Internet, sight unseen, we were a little concerned about what we might find.  We couldn't have been more ecstatic about the place!  Everything was perfect, everything.  The most helpful staff gave us much-needed info and brochures about getting around town, the owner helped us get our luggage up the stairs, got us ice, whatever we needed!  But the room was the star of the trip.  It had a wonderful view of the ocean and the pool, and the room itself was too charming to describe.  The bed!  We had our best sleep in that bed, with all the windows open, fresh ocean air coming in.  The kitchenette, coffee maker, hard-wood floors, all the windows!  Everything was perfect. We found all the staff, the property, the room so much more than we had hoped
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review The Tides.  We are all very pleased that you found it charming and especially glad that you had a great time in Laguna. We look forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary: We have stayed here twice, I like it because most rooms have kitchenettes, and I like that when we travel..of course when we go to laguna it's more of an eating vacation, so I don't even cook breakfast,..but I like having the option.  The rooms are adorable, and comfortable, and the pool area is very cool, room to lounge and BBQ, and even have a fire at night.  My husband prefers larger hotels, with a restaurant and bar but why would you need that?? There are tons of bars and restaurant's right at your finger tips..duh
Manager Response: Now we are looking forward to your third stay with us. We also love our kitchenettes and actually have 3 rooms with full kitchens.  I love that you do need the kitchenette!  Anyway, please remind your lovely husband that taking a short walk to eat and drink is really quite healthy. See you soon and thanks so much, Linda

Summary: I Contacted The Laguna Chamber Of Commerce & They Suggested A Few But "The Tides" Was IT!!!!!!!!!.Very Beachy Rooms Fully Stocked Kitchens, Huge Outdoor Fireplace By The Pool With Fountains & A Lg Gas BBQ. The Rooms Are Lovely & The Staff Make You Feel Like Family..I Can't Wait To Go Back!!!!!  Hugs To Dale & All The Staff !!!
Manager Response: Dale and the entire staff want to thank you for the kind review.  We are so glad you enjoyed your Tides experience.  We all agree that we have the nicest guests. Thank you for taking the time to write. Linda

Summary: I wanted to be kinder to this hotel than 2 stars, but it just doesn't deserve it.
