Firstly it's overpriced.  $230 a night for a room that barely fits  small queen bed and a bathroom that's small by Paris standards is not cool (the shower is the smallest I've ever been in).  The room had no windows save one small one in the bathroom.  The staff were lovely, no fault there.  If I return to Laguna Beach I will try Air BnB.
Manager Response: We are very sorry about your unpleasant visit to The Tides but thank you for expressing your feelings.  We do have 2 very small rooms which are of course the least expensive.  It is difficult to find a room on Saturday night in Laguna Beach in the summer for that price-hard to believe, we know! If you had called us yourself, we of course would have described the room.  When you request a room on line with a queen bed you can never be sure of what you will get.  Each of our 21 rooms is completely different.  They can all be viewed on our website, www.tideslaguna.com. We are hoping you return to try a different room and have a different experience. Linda

Summary: We stayed 2 nights and the location was super convenient to the Pageant of the Masters.  You can walk to it or take the free trolley that runs up and down this main street.  There is parking within the courtyard but spaces are narrow esp. for SUVs. There is a pool, as well.  From our room on the 2nd floor, we had a view of the ocean.  There was a coffee/tea set up, as well as, a fridge and microwave. There is also free wifi.  The only complaint is that the sink and tub drain did not drain properly.  Heisler Park is right across the street and in my opinion is the best site in the whole area.  There is a popular pizza place 3 blocks north and SEVERAL eateries a few blocks south.  Everything is walkable, but you can also use the trolley during the summer months.   We would stay
Manager Response: We are happy to hear you will stay with us again.  Our location is great.  All of us love to walk all over town also and agree with you about Heisler Park.  It is spectacular--kind of like walking in a postcard. We apologize for the plumbing problems. (hoping you told us so we repaired the problem before you left) and have had our plumber (Jeff the King) here practically every day all summer.  It is an old building but sand in the drains does not help matters one bit! We look forward to your return visit and please mention the plumbing. Thanks for writing about us. Linda

Summary: I don't want to give this Gem of a hotel the amazing review it deserves for fear of not being able to get a room every year when we come for the Pageant of the Masters. It's location is perfect, the staff is wonderful and the rooms are enchanting. Would not think of staying anyplace else.
Manager Response: We think with a review like yours, you will always have a room here!  Thanks so very much for your kind words. Linda

Summary: We stayed three nights at the Tides.  We came to Laguna Beach to see the Pagaent of the Masters.  This is an older, small property.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  The pool area is awesome with bars set up that you could use to entertain friends.  The location is outstanding with Heisler Park right across the street and many restaurants located within walking distance.  The beds were comfy.  Parking is very tight but not impossible. The noise from the Pacific Coast Highway (PCH) is loud during the day.  They provide ear plugs to help at night. I didn't give 5 stars only because it could use a little updating BUT it kinda felt like staying at Grandma's and we all love our grandmas.  :))
Manager Response: We all loved your review!  Cozy is good!  Our goal has always been to be clean and affordable.  Kind of like Grandma's!  Please come back to Laguna soon. Thanks so much for taking the time to write to us. Linda

Summary: Stayed one night for the Pageant of the Masters. We had the Marilyn Monroe room. Great room, friendly staff. Super comfy bed. Very relaxing. Close to  everything. Great pool area for entertaining. Parking was tight if you don't have a compact car.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing The Tides.  We are hoping you reserve again next year when you receive your Pageant tickets.  We are one of the few hotels in Laguna Beach who do not have a minimum stay.  Sorry about the tight parking--always feel free to ask us for help.  We are grateful to have one parking place per room! (and not charge extra)  Looking forward to a return visit and thanks for all the positive comments. Linda

Summary: Celebrated my wife's birthday.  Great little hotel.  Clean, super friendly staff, great location. We stayed 2 nights and really enjoyed the experience.  15 minute walk to downtown laguna beach.  Would recommend an inside room away from pch.
Manager Response: We are so happy that you took advantage of our "birthday special" for your wife and hope you do the same for yours.  Summer birthdays are a really big savings! Laguna Beach is a perfect place to celebrate anything.  Please come back soon to enjoy our town even more. Thanks so much, Linda

Summary: Pets are allowed which is fantastic for me. Under new management but seems to be doing well. Outdoor BBQ and fireplace available.mfurniture around pool and pool itself are really nice.  Some rooms are very tiny. Has a sort of doll house or cottage feel to the rooms. Parking is tight for bigger vehicles. Really nice staff.
Manager Response: Yes, we have new managers, Sophia and John.  They are terrific, happy and always positive.  Pure joy.  Dale and I are very content owners. We appreciate your taking the time to comment, so glad you enjoyed The Tides and hope to see you soon. Thanks very much, Linda

Summary: We took the family ‚Äì my wife and I and our 2 year old and 5 month old ‚Äì to the Tides for a brief family getaway in June, 2014. We were thoroughly charmed by the place and hope to make staying here an annual tradition. We are SoCal locals but having a room right across from the beach makes life so much easier, especially when kids are involved.   We had room 212, which is the largest room and looks out over PCH toward the ocean. You get two very comfortable queen beds and a full kitchen with oven, stove, fridge, microwave, plates, and utensils. There‚Äôs also an eating/sitting area between the kitchen and bedroom. All in all a very comfortable place to stay with the family. Noise from the road can be an issue if you‚Äôre a light sleeper. It wouldn‚Äôt bother me, but did wake the baby
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the lovely review.  We try to charm our guests.  Our goal is to be clean and affordable so more folks and families can enjoy Laguna Beach.  Children love our salt water pool.    Our plumber got right to work on the hot water/water pressure problems thanks to your comments.  We always appreciate those comments.  Looking forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary: Moved to the Tides for the weekend while in Southern California for business. While not ideal as a business hotel, it's perfect for a weekend getaway. The location is great, being only minutes from the oceanside parks and beaches. The staff are very nice and helpful - when I checked in, they suggested I move to another room because it's quieter. The Tides is clean, comfortable and has a good boutique feel to it.   Since it's on the PCH, there can be significant road noise for the rooms close to the road. The hotel provides earplugs.   I had room 213 which has two double beds, a fire place and faces the back alley making it the quietest room.  The only downside is there can be room noise through the adjoining doors between rooms. Only a problem if you're a light sleeper.
Manager Response: We very much appreciate your comments and are so glad you enjoyed your stay. Thank you.   We also sure do wish there was something we could do about the traffic noise.   Kind of tough on the hotels to have our gorgeous ocean next to PCH but it is convenient!  The Tides was built in 1949 and I believe the walls have not been changed except for paint--there can be some sounds from adjoining rooms on occasion.  Hoping you return soon.  Laguna Beach is gorgeous in the fall. Linda

Summary: Loved The Tides.  Staff friendly and competent.  Stayed in 104, lovely.  Our own little beach cottage, with dining area, kitchen and two very comfy queen beds, very nice flat screen TV on the wall.  Pool and fire pit area was great, and an easy walk to Laguna Beach proper and the stunning Heisler Park.  Free parking, which was great, but sometimes a little tricky when parking behind the building(some careful manuvering was involved).  Small price to pay for such a nice place.  Next time we visit from CT, will definitely stay at The Tides.  P.S.  Did not need earplugs, but their presence provided a good laugh.
Manager Response: We are so happy you had a good time.  That is exactly what The Tides hopes to accomplish.  Sorry about the parking problem--cars are much larger than in 1949!  We are just so happy to have a parking place for every room.  Looking forward to your next visit from Connecticut, glad you had fun and a good laugh.  See you soon, we hope. Linda

Summary: Booked the Tides Inn a few days before Memorial Day weekend.  The price was probably higher than usual due to the late reservation, but still significantly more reasonable than other properties in the area.  We were visiting family in Orange County and could have stayed with relatives, but we wanted to have a mini vacation getaway from all the obligatory family stuff.  Tides was the best arrangement.  Check in was smooth.  The office staff was genuinely nice and efficient.  We stayed in room 102, which is in the front and literally on the very busy North Coast Highway.  There is a decorational wall which serves as a barrier and provides a bit of privacy from the sidewalk.  Did not see too many people walking in the area and there were no safety concerns with the room facing the
Manager Response: Your review was charming and thorough.  Thank you. We appreciate our guests who notice details and offer suggestions.  The soap dispensers are a new addition, kind of driving us crazy too--lets just say "a work in progress."  A plastic bag is given upon request.   We look forward to your "earlier" booking.  Remember we have the incredible sunsets in the fall.  See you soon and thanks again for taking the time.  We very much appreciate that also. Linda

Summary: We went to Laguna for a girls trip and found the Tides Inn to be a very convenient location to downtown Laguna. The pool is small but has a nice fireplace where you can sit and enjoy a glass of wine. There is also a BBQ area that guests can use to cook food. Our room had a small refrigerator and microwave as well which was convenient. The rooms are clean and decorated nicely. We only stayed one night, so the price was a bit steep. However, it was justified as we stayed on Memorial Day weekend where most places charge a two night minimum. Parking was included as well.  If you are planning on eating out and enjoying Laguna, this is a nice place to stay and is ideal for a weekend.
Manager Response: We are a perfect place for a girls weekend.  Or a holiday.  Or both.  So happy to hear you had fun and enjoyed our therapeutic fireplace area.  There is so much to do in Laguna Beach but relaxing is the utmost!  Please hurry back and thanks for the review. Linda

Summary: This is our third stay at the Tides..cannot say enough great stuff about the hotel. Small so less people to deal with. Easy location, on the quieter north side of Laguna Beach. Steps to the beach and a few more to downtown Laguna with wonderful places to eat. Don't bring a really large vehicle though as parking is limited. average sized cars are fine.
Manager Response: Repeat guests are the greatest compliment.  Thank you so much.  We are small, we are easy, we are close and we try to be as quiet as possible.  Yes, parking large vehicles is limited but it is free.  My friends always tease me because from the time we purchased The Tides I have always said the best part was owning 22 parking places in Laguna Beach.  Keep coming back and thanks again. Linda

Summary Heading: Exactly what we were looking for!
Summary: My husband and I were in SoCal celebrating our anniversary, and Laguna Beach was one of our stops.  The Tides Inn is an affordable, very updated SoCal throwback.  The rooms are large, very nicely decorated and clean.  Ours had a small kitchenette, perfect for staying for awhile. There is also a pool and fireplace.  All this and a fabulous location just a block from the beach and Hesler Park.  The Tides loans it's guests beach towels, beach chairs, and umbrellas; everything you need for a wonderful day on this beautiful beach. 15 minutes walk from all the shops and restaurants in the heart of Laguna Beach (if you're slow). What a wonderful find! I would not even consider staying anywhere else when we go back.
Manager Response: We are thrilled that you found us--especially to celebrate an anniversary.  We hope you return for our "birthday" special.  Laguna Beach is the best place for any occasion.  Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review.  On behalf of our staff, we look forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary: My husband and I traveled to Laguna Beach on vacation.  We stayed at the Tides for our first two nights and were pleasantly surprised by how nice the place was for the price.  We were upgraded (without asking) from a standard king bed room to room 207, which features a kitchenette.  The staff was very friendly and allowed us to check in over two hours early without pre requesting an early check-in.  The bed and linens were awesome.  The bathroom was nice and clean.  The kitchen area was roomy and allowed us to make our own breakfasts and brown bag lunches.  The pool area was great -- they have a fireplace and grill for common use.  Although the Pacific Coast Highway is a little noisy during the day, it was quiet at night.  We did not have any problems sleeping.  The best part of
Manager Response: We love that you discovered The Tides and loved us.  It is with great pleasure we try to make our guests have the best experience as we know traveling is not easy these days.  We all look forward to your return visit and thanks so much. Linda

Summary: ...As one of your other reviewers stated.  Perfect location in Laguna Beach.  If you climb up you're on the mountain top, wander down to the gorgeous coves and beaches, wander left to the  restaurants and shoppy shops, wander right to the convenience of locally grown food and maybe a burger.  The hospitality from John and Sophia was over the top.  Our room was large and spotless.  We stayed 5 days and would recommend this little gem to anyone of any means who loves to visit beautiful places and meet interesting people.
Manager Response: You truly discovered ALL the joys of Laguna Beach.  We also adore our managers.  Nothing makes us happier than  hearing that you will return on your next visit to Laguna Beach.  Thank you for sharing your experience with us. Linda

Summary: We are picky people who have gotten a little used to high end properties.  There are certainly more expensive places to stay, yet I doubt they are as genuinely SoCal and would be no more comfortably appointed.  The staff is great, and this inn is just a short walk from everywhere in the main section of Laguna Beach.  The online photos do not do The Tides justice.  We'll maintained, the rooms make you feel very much at home.  The pool is perfect for winding down after a great day on the area beaches or shopping.  And did I say, the staff is great?  Provided us everything we asked for....better than I would've thought.
Manager Response: We are so happy The Tides met all your needs during your stay.  John, Sophia and Reid do an amazing job of making our guests feel at home.  Thanks so much for every word you wrote.  We look forward to your return visit with your family. Linda

Summary: We were very pleased with The Tides Inn.  It is an older hotel put is exceptionally well maintained.  The rooms are large many with Kitchenettes.  Are room with a very comfortable king bed and a small kitchen was perfect for two.   The management were great, helpful in every way.  They provided beach chairs, umbrellas and towels.  The location is right across the street from a beautiful beach park with sandy coves and tide pools.  They have covered parking.  The center of town and many resturants are an easy 10 minute walk.  We parked our car and didn't touch it for three days of beautiful relaxation at the beach.
Manager Response: Sounds like a perfect 3 days.  We are hoping you do it again. We are older.  We do have kitchenettes which are so convenient.  We aim to please with complimentary parking, wifi and all sorts of beach necessities.  We want you to walk everywhere especially across the street to the gorgeous Heisler Park with our exceptional local artists' artwork.  Thanks so much for taking the time to write about us.  We always appreciate hearing from our guests. Linda

Summary: We loved our 3-day stay here. Laguna Beach has a number of older hotels that have been refurbished/restored/maintained, but this is the only one we have stayed in and would love to go back to. The staff are universally helpful, and friendly. The room we had was a king with a kitchenette--comfy bed and big enough that we didn't feel stuffed into a shoebox. We travel with a dog, and they welcome pets. The Tides is just a block from Heisler Park, a beautiful park with walking paths and beach access. It's also just a short walk to the center of town for shopping and restaurants. Other reviews have mentioned traffic noise, but we never noticed it. I suppose it could be different in the summer. We will definitely try to book The Tides the next time we visit Laguna Beach, and will
Manager Response: Thank you for finding us.  We sure do hope you can return and do it again. We very much love when our guests appreciate our hard work and wonderful location. Sophia and John, our resident managers, do a fantastic job of keeping everyone happy plus Laguna Beach has so much to offer.  See you soon. Linda

Summary: The good:            The Bad: Affordable.            Thin Walls Clean.                  Traffic noise Pet friendly.          The bed in 205 is not really a king, but two mattresses pushed together Good location Friendly staff This place is nothing fancy but if you want a clean and affordable place to stay with your dog, it's perfect. We looked at other places that may have been a bit nicer, but were about $50 more per night and the reviews were mixed. This place lived up to our expectations. Ten minute walk away from the shops and restaurants. Traffic noise wasn't horrible, but you do hear it even though the building is set back off the highway.
Manager Response: We thought your review was better than a 3.5!  Thanks. Right On with all the good news.  The traffic situation is not easy to fix with PCH being next to the Pacific but we do have double pane windows and a good supply of earplugs. Because of your review I did learn that king beds always have 2 box springs and a single king mattress.   We look forward to your return. Linda

Summary: The Tides is a really charming motor lodge. Referring to some earlier reviews of other travellers, on the contrary I found this motel charming, very comfortable and great value for money. I was not disturbed at all by the noise of the street - and also not agreeing with other travellers, I did not find the location too good at all. The innkeepers are really friendly and do everything to make you feel comfortable. The room is charming like in a conch house and the bed is comfortable. There is a little kitchenette and the shower has unexpectedly good pressure. Parking is free. Location is just ok since the town center is about 10min away by foot. As advice for the owners, I would put a socket near the bed so I don't have to unplug the lamp underneath the bed for charging my phone.
Manager Response: Many thanks for calling us a solid product!  Very nice compliment.  We all hope and wish you walked to town via Heisler Park which is directly across the street.  It would have made the walk seem less because the local artists' public art is so amazing.  Please make your return visit in July or August when the free local open-air trolleys are running all over town.  Very enjoyable.  Looking forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary: I'm writing this review because there are so many places you can stay in Laguna and I think for the money this is a great deal. The rooms are nice and the staff is very friendly. I loved the outside fire place by the pool,and the gas grill. They also allow pets. We didn't bring our dog but I saw other guests with their dogs. The room was very comfortable. Also on the website for the tides you can see pictures of each room then chose which one you want, a really cool feature I thought.
Manager Response: We loved every single thing you said.  Thanks so very much.  We look forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary: We stayed here for 5 days in Room 103. The room was very nice - had a kitchenette which was handy. There was a mixup with the reservation but it was all worked out. The ceilings and walls are a little thin so stay on the second floor. There is a lovely outdoor area near the pool where we sat by the fire we made in the outside fireplace - very charming! Room could use a comfy chair or two. Hotel is well located.
Manager Response: Thanks so much.  We are happy you enjoyed your stay with us. Big thanks for suggesting the comfy chairs.  We are trying several different ones and always appreciate our guest's comments. We will look for you again. Linda

Summary Heading: Charm and Value in Laguna Beach
Summary: We love the Tides Inn for its style - every room is a different theme and has an inspirational quote. We love the Buddha room and it's view.  Old school motel charm with a great pool and outdoor wood-burning fireplace. There is a since of place...a warm and inviting place, that you'll want to return to.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you had such a nice time.  The "Buddha" room is a favorite because it is so bright and cheery but also quiet.  The name came about because of the quote, then a wonderful guest was amazing enough to leave the Buddha picture in the room which we promptly hung--the rest is history.  We look forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary: I was thrilled to manage to book our room the same day we arrived for a spur-of-the-moment one night stay.  I found The Tides through a dog-friendly website as we wanted to bring our dog.  They charge 2 different rates depending on the size of your dog.  I'm unsure of the rationale for this, but I have a large dog and when I balked on the phone of paying the higher amount, the man on the line stated he would charge me the lesser amount -- I assumed because he was happy to be filling the room for the night or maybe because I booked directly with them. Regardless, when we went to check out the following day, the woman at the desk asked if I had a dog as if it was never noted on the reservation. I told her that I had informed the man I spoke to about the dog and the dog's size.  I
Manager Response: Well, you did not miss a thing.  Great review! Congratulations on becoming a dog owner.  There is nothing better that the unconditional love you will receive.  We do have adorable dog blankets now although we have found most dog lovers travel with their own. Our housekeepers were notified of the dust.  We try so hard to be as clean as possible--not easy at the beach and next to a highway. The Tides was built in 1949--we admit to thin walls and small-ish parking places.  We bought this wonderful motel 10 years ago but decided not to do major reconstruction as we wanted to keep it a great affordable place for families to vacation. We do hope you return and try another room. Linda

Summary: Room and saltwater pool was wonderful. Very friendly mgmt. Not fancy but comfortable and charming with a touch of luxury, and gives an impression of the "real" Laguna Beach lifestyle. The kitchen was well equipped for small meals. Tides Inn is perfect for a getaway. The beach is close by and only a few minutes to walk, location is very convenient near downtown, restaurants galleries and shops.
Manager Response: Thank you.  Thank you.  We hope you return soon. Linda

Summary: Stayed here with a friend for two nights earlier on this month, quiet and very friendly staff who are willing to help. Location is good too, it's a 5/10 minute walk in to the centre and takes away any drink driving issues. Good cafe nearby for breakfast and go to the sandpiper for drinks...
Manager Response: We are so glad you had fun for 2 entire days in Laguna Beach.  Please check out our birthday special and come back for 2 more glorious days. Thanks so much--your thoughts are very appreciated. Linda

Summary: The name is misleading. It is not an inn...it's an old motel. When we pulled in I wanted to leave but couldn't as we had pre-booked. I can't believe none of the reviews mentioned this motel is on a very busy noisy highway. I do not exaggerate!!! On the bedside table is a note & a set of ear plugs compliments of management. Note says "if you don't find the noise of the highway romantic, block it put with these. " On the plus side -We stayed on the second floor so you could actually see the ocean in the distance. It was within walking distance of the beach & downtown which was great as parking downtown was a nightmare!! (And we were there off season). Room was big and we had a separate kitchen in a separate room. Bathroom was modern. So while it looked like an old motel from the
Manager Response: Your review reflects our goals.  Thanks so much.  We bought The Tides 10 years ago and it was a mess.  Our goal was to be clean and affordable so families could return to Laguna Beach.  We do and will always keep trying to improve. Linda

Summary: We just returned from a two night stay at the Tides Inn hotel. The hotel was in a great location, just a short walk to the beach or to the many shops and restaurants around. The rooms are small but comfortable and were not as noisy as we thought they would be. They do give you ear plugs if you are bothered by the traffic noise. There is a small pool but we didn't have time to use it. The owners are friendly and we had an enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: Thanks you for the lovely review. Yes, we also love our location.  We are looking forward to some wonderful new restaurants opening soon just a block or two away which will add to being only a block away from the gorgeous Heisler Park and walking distance to our amazing Laguna Art Museum. We are looking forward to a return visit. Linda

Summary: Stayed here for two nights at the end of October and loved it.  This an older property (built in the forties) that has been completely refurbished with each room individually redecorated.  This is not your typical chain motel. We had a room with a king size bed on the second floor. The room had wood floors, flat screen tv, comfortable bedding and a comfortable chair to relax in. We had a small refrigerator and a keurig coffee maker with an assortment of k cups to select from.  The bathroom had a shower only, which was fine with us. Two wing glasses and wine opener were provided.  The decor was soft beach colors with beach accents. Perfect!  The parking is tight-21 spaces for 21 rooms. The outside pool area is great. Outside fireplace that was lit every night, large BBQ that can
Manager Response: We thank you for all your positive feedback, for taking the time to write a review and for appreciating all of our efforts.  We look forward to a return visit. Linda

Summary: So we read all the reviews and they were all fabulous, I wish I could say the same but I really wasn't that impressed.  I'm not hard to please when it comes to hotels, there are a few key things that I look for, cleanliness is number one on my list, and I felt that The Tides was not really up to standards. I have stayed in hostels and $20 hotels in Mexico, as well as expensive ones so I have seen it all.  The room was cute and I liked the little touches of decorations and Marlyn Monroe everywhere, but I found it a little dirty.  The blinds in the bathroom were covered in dust and fuzz,  the screen when you opened the window was also chock full of dust and dirt.  The kitchen cupboards looked like the hadn't been wiped down for ever, they had dried bits of food and sauce on them.
Manager Response: Well, we liked the last part of your letter and are always grateful for reviews of all kinds.  That is exactly what keeps us in shape and we thank you for your scrutiny.   So, we have cleaned and cleaned.  The rug has been cleaned.  We do not have a gym but there are several close by.  We wish you had mentioned the problems to us at the time rather than let 5 days go by.   We think you will be happy at Casa Laguna or La Casa del Camino at the northern end of town. Many thanks for taking the time to write. Linda

Summary: Great location, friendly and attentive owners and on-site management team, lovely property. Rooms looked even better to us when we saw them than the photos indicated on their website. Across the street from beautiful Heisler Park, a nice place to wander and enjoy a sunset. We did the right thing selecting the Tides, and are thankful we did.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for staying at The Tides. We appreciate your review and our location.  Hope to see you soon again. Don't forget our birthday special. Linda

Summary: My husband and I spent one night here on our SoCal five-day road trip.  It's a modest hotel, nothing fancy, but clean and well maintained inside and out (nice pool area).  It's located directly on PCH within walking distance to the beach (the restaurants are a bit further south, a fair hike by foot).  We stayed in room 205 and paid $133.28 (all taxes included).  It's not a large room and the bathroom is a quite small.  It does have a small room before you enter the bathroom where there is a vanity area and small frig and a place to hang clothes.  They do supply earplugs and without the air conditioner on, you would definitely need them!  Also, the walls are very thin - we got an X-rated ear-full from the couple next door.  I've read all of the reviews and agree with most of what
Manager Response: We are happy with a solid 3+. Thanks, Linda

Summary: The Tides Inn has a great location and I enjoyed my stay. It was my first time there and the staff was great; although the hotel itself is not flashy. It is situated right on PCH between Crystal Cove and the main Laguna Beach area so it is central to a lot of things. They have a nice pool area set up to have your own BBQ with friends or just relax on a floatie. They also have an outdoor fireplace area that is pretty cool. I enjoyed my stay there and would definitely come back.
Manager Response: We very much appreciate your taking the time to review The Tides.  It is a great place for a single visitor as well as a family.  We have some darling small rooms and yes, our location is fabulous.  Parking for free and being able to walk all over town are wonderful perks. Please return soon--winters are also quite gorgeous. Linda

Summary Heading: They go all out to make your stay a pleasure
Summary: We couldn't have been treated more warmly or courteously.  No wonder this modest motel gets such high ratings from guests!  We chose the Tides Inn because our daughter was getting married in Laguna Beach at Heisler Park across the street.  The Tides management bent over backward to accommodate our requests and make our stay hassle-free.  My husband says, "It was like staying with family -- the kind of family we all wish we had."
Manager Response: We feel like we have the nicest and most courteous guests.  We all thank you for the nice comments.  Wedding and reunions are our favorite groups.  Hoping to see you visit more often and most of all for the "anniversaries-to-be." Linda

Summary: What a great place to stay in Laguna. Convient to everything. Beach is a block away, shops down the street, trolley stop right outside the Inn. I stayed at The Tides with my two kids and Fred and Denise made us feel like family. We arrived after the office closed, well Fred put our room key under our mat in case we were really late arrivals. The second day they upgraded us to the 1 bedroom apartment with a full kitchen. Very spacious and comfortable. With the kids we just went to the market and picked up dinner and ate in our "apartment". We enjoyed the fireplace that evening too.  . We really wanted to take advantage of the barbeque but since we were only there for the 2 nights we didn't want leftovers.  The pool was a little chilly but that didn't stop my kids. They liked the
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the wonderful Tides review.  You didn't miss a thing!  We are so glad you enjoyed every minute.  It is great to have a kitchenette, especially with children. Please return soon.  There is always so much to do and see in this town.  Very much like paradise. Linda

Summary: What a delight to find a hidden gem in beautiful Laguna Beach! Cute, quaint, and homey! We were taking a trip down the coastline and were only staying 1 night, but would have loved staying longer. We thoroughly enjoyed our room 102 for our family of 4. We loved the large table, which was perfect for board games and elbow room for the kids. The room had a cabinet with puzzles and Legos that the kids really enjoyed using.  Kitchenette and bathroom were a decent size and had all the amenities we needed. From previous written posts, some had mentioned the noise of the highway...we didn't notice it. Maybe it depends if you are a light or heavy sleeper...but our family didn't find it a problem, nor did we find it really that noisy. The air conditioner worked like a charm, although, we
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to write such a great review of The Tides.   Room 102 is a great family room because of the full kitchen and dining area.   We adore our place and love catering to happy families.  We strive to be clean and affordable so families can enjoy Laguna Beach--the community has so much to offer. Keep traveling and hope you return soon. Linda

Summary: Halfway through our trip from SF to SD on Hwy 1, we found ourselves in Laguna Beach and checked the Tides out on the web. We took a chance and stopped in finding 2 rooms for 2 nights. The location was convenient to groceries, beverages and restaurants and the vibe is typical SoCal. Here's what makes this unique. Great staff, great pool area, super BBQ in a built in outdoor kitchen and a perfect evening unwind around the fire. Add their mascot Fiona to that and the road noise, while apparent, quickly becomes a minor nuisance.
Manager Response: We are just as happy that you found us and hope you stop by on all your fabulous road trips.  There is not a more beautiful place to be than Laguna Beach, especially this time of the year.  The sunsets are spectacular. Thanks so much for the lovely review.  It means so much to all of us. Linda

Summary: No negatives about this place.  We really enjoyed our stay.  Unfortunately, we were only here for one night.  From the time we arrived until the time we left, all of the staff were wonderful and as helpful as they possibly could be (wish we could remember their names).  We stayed at three places during our time in California and this was the highlight.  Rooms were cozy and quaint.  Beds were lovely and we had a Kuerig coffee maker .  They have a small but nice salt-water pool with arching fountains.  It was a little cool in the pool in the evening but it was okay because they built a huge fire in the outdoor fireplace for us!  We were able to sit around the fireplace with our family (that was also staying at the Tides) and order a pizza and hang out for the evening.  Where else
Manager Response: Oh we love those positives.  And we love pizza by the pool, too. We really hope you and your family are able to continue to vacation with us. Thanks so much for the wonderful review. See you soon, Linda

Summary Heading: Good price for Laguna beach tiny windowless box though
Summary: We spent one night at The Tides to enjoy Laguna beach.  The hotel is just up the PCH from the shops and restaurants about a 10 minute walk.  The room we stayed in backed onto the PCH but noise was not really a problem we had no windows in the bedroom however just a roof light and a little window into the bathroom.  I found the room a bit 'stuffy' and too small to spend any time in but the pool area was quite nice though you do have to remember your right on the PCH!  You pay for what you get and the hotel does offer better standard of room if you pay more but I didn't get to see in any of them.  I would stay again as it was clean and tidy and the staff were pleasant but only if I had a better room.
Manager Response: We love a true review.  Room 203 is our smallest room with the smallest bed tucked in a corner.  The skylight is wonderful and opens for more air.  We also put a small fridge and microwave in that room.  It is great for sleeping and perfect for one person.  We have a regular who stays a month and calls it her "bird's nest." All of our rooms can be viewed on our website, www.tideslaguna.com.  Please pick out a larger room and make a return visit soon. Thanks, Linda

Summary Heading: Our new home away from home
Summary: My wife and I stayed here to celebrate her birthday. It was hands down the best service we have ever received. The staff were professional, courteous, and warmly welcoming. They made us feel like we were simply visiting family (the cool, non-intrusive, thoughtful kind). We sat out by the pool and watched a movie on our iPad using their wifi by the fireplace, and it made for one of the most memorable nights of our trip. The location could not be better, with quick access to Laguna Beach, Newport Beach, Huntington Beach, and our favorite, Crystal Cove. There's shipping nearby and lots of restaurants to choose from. You're a mere 35 minutes from Disneyland, so that's a big plus  The rooms at The Tides are really quaint. They're on the smallish side, but it was build in the 1950s I
Manager Response: Thanks so much.  Sounds like you did not miss a thing!  Crystal Cove is very special and gorgeous--we are glad it is open to the public now. Please do not wait till the next birthday to return.  Laguna Beach is perfect year-round. Linda

Summary: We LOVED staying at this quaint inn, especially for the price. The staff were very accommodating, our room was clean and comfortable, and you simply couldn't beat the location. Everything we could possibly want to do or experience was within walking distance. Once we checked in and parked we didn't have to fight the beach traffic. A gorgeous park and small, private beach are literally a couple blocks away. We will be back to stay here again.
Manager Response: When we purchased The Tides, our goal was to be clean and affordable (and fun) so more families could come to Laguna Beach.  We are proud to have free parking, towels and beach chairs available, free wifi and absolutely no extra charges.  We hope you plan a return visit real soon.  Thanks so much for taking the time to write about us. Linda

Summary: We stayed for the first time over Labor Day weekend for my mom's birthday.  They offer an AWESOME rate on your birthday night!  Its a 10-15 min walk to main beach/downtown and a 5 min walk to the beach across the street!!! The room was adorable (108).  Everything seemed clean and very well cared for.  The linens were nice and my mom thoroughly enjoyed the little patio.  I highly recommend the Tides.  We will definitely beyond a doubt be staying again next year.
Manager Response: We will be looking for you both on every birthday.  They should be perfect and we were happy to help with yours. Thanks so much.  Please return as often as possible. Linda

Summary: I stayed in room 208 for an enjoyable 5 nights, the room was bright and clean. I didn't hear any road noise only the splashing of the pool in front. I did have a small view of the ocean from my room.There is parking space for each room assigned which saved me having to park on the road. Walking distance to the ocean, and not far from coffee shops. Staff are friendly including Fiona the dog. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Room 208 is one of my favorite rooms.  The cross ventilation is perfect.  We do have a quote in every room--some are hidden and you must have noticed the Buddha quote.  The photo on the wall was left by a guest as a special surprise gift to the room.  We get the nicest visitors at The Tides.  Our wonderful new managers, Denise and Fred are the owners of that wonderful Princess Fiona.  I think she is the most photographed dog in Laguna. We will look forward to another visit and thanks so much, Linda

Summary: We stayed here one night with two other couples. We were in room 204 and it was a roomy room with a full kitchen. Bring paper towels and napkins if you plan to use kitchen. I did not see any kitchen towels.  Our friends were in room 104 and 214 and their rooms were also nice. The property and pool area are well taken care of and we would definitely stay here in the future. The rates for summer are in the $200 range which is expensive but normal for hotels in Laguna in the high season. The staff is very helpful and even loaned us some beach towels.  We were gong to Pageant of the Masters and Sawdust Festival which are both easily within walking distance just under 1 mile if you enjoy walking. There is also a free trolley/tram that can be caught just down the street from the
Manager Response: Thank you so much. We are so happy you had a nice summer vacation with us--even great steaks on the BBQ. Laguna Beach is the prettiest community with so much to offer.  Please return soon.  Linda

Summary Heading: Great value, friendly folks, perfect location!
Summary: Just returned from a quick weekend getaway in Laguna, and I wish we could have stayed a week! The Tides Inn was the perfect location - comfortable, within walking distance to everything, and relaxing. We did not even get to take advantage of the pool, outdoor firepit, or beach chairs that were kindly offered to us. Clearly, we need to return. We were in one of the front rooms on the street, and yeah, there was a tiny bit of road noise, and yeah, we could hear the kids in the room above running around playing with a ball in the morning. But you know what, it felt like home because that is just what life is like in my apartment. If you need a soundless superplush room, there are plenty of Laguna hotels at 3+times the price that might be more up your alley.  If you want a friendly,
Manager Response: Thank you.  Thank you.  You get us! You must come back just for the pool and fireplace experience and we think we can find about 100 other fun experiences to enjoy. See you soon. Linda

Summary: We spent one night in Laguna Beach and chose this inn after researching our options on Trip Advisor.  Our room was in the back of the property and had two queen beds, a wooden floor and a fireplace.  It really felt like we were staying at a favorite aunt & uncle's guest room, it was so homey and comfortable. I personally liked that the furnishings and bedding/bathroom decor looked more like a bed and breakfast inn than like  a typical hotel room.  Everything was clean and tidy, and the shampoo and soaps in the bathroom smelled wonderful!   There was even a little bookcase stocked with novels to read, and wifi available. The staff was welcoming and helpful, giving us great advice on how to make the most of our short time in Laguna Beach.  It was a pleasant walk from the inn to
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review. Sounds like you like everything we like! You truly made the most of your Laguna Beach visit. Please come back soon.  We all think this should be your home away from home. Linda

Summary: Recently, me and my boyfriend stayed here. Our room was very nice, and decorated very pretty and it had an ocean view without the price tag. It was so cool that the hotel room offered some books to read. And we absolutely loved the kitchenette!! But there was a few minor details that bothered us; our lock to our room looked like someone had tried to break in, the window looked out onto the stairs, it was a little dirty, and there was some water damage on the ceiling. The parking spots are very tight, especially if you drive a bigger veichile like an suv or truck. (We had to climb over to the passenger side to get out of our truck in all the parking spots.) But the pool was very nice and the offered a lot of "beach toys." Overall, it was defiantly worth the price we paid, and
Manager Response: We are always glad to receive feedback and to fix problems.  This summer was so busy (our best ever-a good thing) we hardly had time to breathe! The deadbolt lock has been filed - key always goes in wrong door lock. The windows are clean. The ceiling is patched and painted. Parking places are small but there is one for each room and NO CHARGE.   We happily look forward to a winter with more time to clean, repair, paint, make changes--our favorite things. Please return soon.  Thanks for your review. Linda

Summary: We have stayed at The Tides Inn numerous times and are never disappointed!  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  Plus the location is so close to the beach and the main street in Laguna Beach.  My husband liked it so much that he even proposed to me here 2 years ago!  Their cozy outdoor fireplace made it so romantic and perfect!  We highly recommend The Tides Inn!
Manager Response: A proposal at The Tides.  We love that!  Congratulations. Laguna Beach is quite a romantic art colony. We have the most fun when wedding parties or family reunion parties book the entire place for a several days.  Folks get to know each other before the event. Please return to celebrate as often as you like. Thanks so much, Linda

Summary: This was our first trip to The Tides and we were very pleased with our experience.  The facility is clean and well maintained.  The rooms are smaller but very well appointed and charming.  The atmosphere is very comfortable and relaxed, and the staff were extremely polite and helpful.  The pool area includes a fireplace and a BBQ area for guests which we also enjoyed during our stay.  We will be back again for sure!
Manager Response: We all thank you for such a nice review.  So glad you had a great time in Laguna Beach.  We had an amazing fun and busy summer.  We also think only the nicest people stay here.   Hoping you plan a return visit soon.  The most beautiful sunsets are just beginning. Linda

Summary: My husband and I were planning a long weeekend to celebrate my 65th birthday when we came across The Tides Inn in Laguna Beach.  This hotel was a great value, clean and so comfortable.  The pool area is so inviting and in the evening they have a fireplace in the corner of the pool area which makes it so inviting.  The staff is friendly and informative.  This hotel may have been built in the early 50's but the owners have upgraded all the rooms and area to make this one of the best values in Laguna Beach!  We will be planning another visit and have told our friends about this great place.
Manager Response: Thanks, Patty, for the lovely review. We are so happy that you enjoyed our salt water pool and outdoor fireplace.  Fred is the best fire-builder! Our goal was and is to be affordable and clean.  Word of mouth works great for us. Thanks again and hope to see you soon.  Linda

Summary Heading: Well Kept Inn with Caring Owners
Summary: My husband and I are on an 8 week trip across the country with our dog. We chose this hotel because they are dog friendly and had great reviews. The owners are very nice and take very good care of their inn. They were very nice to us. We had to change rooms a few times and they took care of everything.  I give the inn a very good because the location on N Coast Hwy across the street from the ocean makes it very difficult and dangerous to get to the beach. One corner has a traffic light that is so quick you practically have to run to get across the street in time. The other corner has a button you push that activates yellow blinking lights and a voice that tells you to be careful because the cars may not stop.  We loved the Sawdust Art Show and the Pageant Of The Masters. But
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review The Tides. We hope you can plan a return trip to Laguna Beach in September, October or November.  The weather is gorgeous, sunsets are spectacular, crowds have gone home and the prices are cut in half. We look forward to a return visit. Linda

Summary: This hotel is awesome and such great value. The team behind The Tides Inn desperately want you to have an amazing time at their hotel. The details just kept hitting you. The rooms are light, clean, modern with all details and comforts covered. The kitchen is well stocked, with coffee making facilities and we had a lovely bayview over the roof tops. The whole place smells of jasmine, the gardens are very well looked after and pretty. At night the lights are gorgeous and make the whole place feel magical. There is parking for everyone. The pool is heated, clean and refreshing. There are lots of comfy and new sun loungers. There is a BBQ area and a outdoor fireplace and they actively encourage you to make a fire and enjoy the cooler evening in their outdoor lounge area. The hotel
Manager Response: WOW.  Huge thanks.  Your review almost scares us--that is a lot to live up to!!  We do try hard and we do love our place.  Very thankful for your appreciation. We love Unami Burger also.  All of the workers and management stayed at The Tides during their construction and opening.  We adored them and their hamburgers. Thanks again so very much, Linda

Summary: This is our 3rd time staying at the Tides Inn, in Laguna.  It is so quaint, within walking distance to downtown, Heisler Park and the beach.  The grounds are beautiful and kept up so perfectly,  The rooms are decorated tastefully and very very clean.  They are pet friendly, so we brought our dog along on this trip and it worked out great!  This is the only hotel we consider anymore when we come in from out of town to stay for a weekend getaway.  They are so accomodating and easy to work with.  Thank you for another perfect time away and we'll be back again soon!
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your wonderful review.  We just adore our repeat customers.  You make all of our work worth it.  So glad your dog had a chance to explore our fabulous beaches! Looking forward to your next visit. Linda

Summary: This was our 3rd stay at The Tides and it won't be our last.  Each time we've stayed there we are always made to feel welcome by the staff who will go out of their way to make sure our stay is a good one.  It's a small hotel but the rooms are comfortable and clean.  There is a bbq island in the pool area as well as a fireplace which is great for cool evenings.  We would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to write about your visit.  Now we are looking forward to your 4th time at The Tides.  Our fabulous art festivals and the Pageant of the Masters begin June 28th and continue through July and August.  Also, the weather and sunsets are perfect in September and October. See you soon. Linda

Summary: If you are looking for lux, go someplace else.  This place is old and a bit musty, but very comfortable and clean.  I loved being able to walk to the boardwalk along the ocean, walk to shops and restaurants, and being a bit out of the traffic too.  Great location.  Bedding was good and I like the clean tile floors.  The comfy chairs around the outdoor fire pit were great.  It is pretty small so there is not much privacy and the bath needed some updates.  Overall, an affordable nice place to stay
Manager Response: Such a delightful and truthful review.  Thank you.  That is exactly what we want to be--affordable (for Laguna Beach) and clean.  We enjoy our guests very much.  We are working on the baths which is not easy as The Tides was built in 1949--were people smaller then? We look forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary Heading: Rented the hotel for the weekend
Summary: We got married in Laguna, and reserved the Tides for our out-of-town guests. All of our guests could not say enough wonderful things about the hotel, the owners, and their ability to make all of us feel like we were family. We booked the last weekend in March, and the weather was perfect. The owners allowed us to use their pool area to host a get-together, and repeatedly went above and beyond to accommodate us in every way.  If you are in need of a safe, cute, clean and welcoming place to host those you love the most, please consider the Tides Inn.
Manager Response: Congratulations again.  We are so happy everyone was pleased.  It is a perfect party place and we love parties.  Hoping you can join us for our annual "Elvis" party in August and please celebrate all your special occasions at The Tides.   Thanks so much for sharing your comments. Linda

Summary: The hotel staff were superbly helpful and they even had beach chairs, towels, and an umbrella for us to borrow for the beach. Since our flight wasn't until late in the day, after check out, They were kind enough to let us park there after check out while we enjoyed the beach and tidepools.  We loved that the Hotel is conveniently located across the the street from Heisler Park and the beach, and close to, but away from, the downtown area.
Manager Response: We aim to please and thanks so much for appreciating us.  It means alot.  We try hard. It will be our pleasure to welcome you back. Thanks again, Linda

Summary Heading: Mixed feelings; friendly, but be careful which room you get.
Summary: Very friendly, nice little pool, close to beach.  But some rooms are right on the road, traffic noise not good!  If you are staying for a few days then make sure you get a room at the back.  The location is great for beach, bars and restaurants.
Manager Response: We also love our location.  We love not charging to park your car also.  We do have 3 rooms on the street side of our property and always make a point to let our guests know that when they make their reservations.  There is traffic noise on Coast Highway-no doubt about it-and all the hotels are on the coast.  We do have double-paned windows which helps.   Thanks so much for your good traveler advice.  Hoping to see you again soon. Linda

Summary Heading: Nice Place close to the action
Summary: Nothing really much to add to all of the other reviews. The owners are very nice, the road noise is not really an issue but the walls are a little thin.  The rooms are clean and they provide you with a nice beach towel for your excursions there. Good pool area and plenty of parking. The place is larger then it appears from the outside along the PCH. It is also an easy walk to town and close to several beaches. Has to be the best place to stay in Laguna Beach for the money. I would return.
Manager Response: You made our day.  So happy you will return.  We think we are a great affordable secret in Laguna Beach and try hard to be exactly that--the affordable part.....We hope you return soon to shop and dine and relax at The Tides. Thanks so much for taking the time to review. Linda

Summary: Myself and 3 friends stayed at The Tides last night for our annual friends retreat. The staff couldn't be more friendly. Parking was free and they are within walking distance of a few shops, galleries, Starbucks and Main Beach. Our room was very nice but small with 2 queen beds. The shower was tiny but lots of water pressure and hot water. The room had a coffee maker and a small fridge. The sheets were great if you care about that. The staff set up a fire in the fireplace in the beautiful pool area we could light after dinner. There is comfy furniture to enjoy the fire and sound of the pool fountain. Free wifi. I didn't give a 5 star rating because there is always room for improvement and there is street noise. They do have earplugs in the room in case you need them. Thanks for
Manager Response: Well, we are looking forward to getting your 5-stars some day!  We are all for improvements which is why we love our reviews.  Our guests give us their best ideas and solutions.  Thanks for all the positives and we look forward to welcoming you back. Linda

Summary: The owners are the nicest people. The location was great. Right across the street from Heisler park which is perfect for strolling along the beautiful paths overlooking the ocean and main beach. The room was older, which was fine but I found the bed to be "springy" which caught me off guard. It made me miss my own bed a little. All in all it was a really nice stay at one of our favorite beaches.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the review.  We receive so many compliments about our comfortable beds, so we will check out "springy" and resolve that problem.  Thanks for letting us know.  We do love our place and our location as well.  On behalf of our staff and management, we look forward to your return visit. Linda

Summary Heading: Great Value in a Perfect Location
Summary: Last week we returned from a week's stay at the Tides.  We don't usually stay in one place for this long, but loved it so much, we wished we had several more days!  It was our first trip to SoCal, and Laguna Beach was the perfect spot from which to explore, anywhere from Los Angeles to San Diego.  The Tides was also the perfect spot in LB.  You are within easy walking distance (a bit hilly) of downtown and its restaurants, breathtaking Heisler Park (beaches!!), a good grocery store, the art museum and many galleries.  The Inn itself is charming, the owners fun, helpful and welcoming.  While it was too cool to use the pool, we spent time in the sun there, protected from the breeze.  If we had wanted it, a stone fireplace was ready to use, as was an outdoor barbecue and
Manager Response: Thank you for the lovely review.  Very happy to hear you will be visiting Laguna Beach again.  You must come back in the summer when our fabulous art festivals happen.   We also have the best restaurants.  We and The Tides are looking forward to your next visit--soon we hope--to your home away from home. Linda

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay, in a wonderful town !!
Summary: I just returned from 5 great days in Laguna, and the Tides Inn was the perfect place to stay. It was within walking distance of everything I needed, including a great grocery store.  A short walk to beautiful Heisler park, the gateway to the long wonderful beach and the main part of town.  The managers Joe and Judy were wonderful and helpful, and I hope to return soon with my wife.  (wish we could bring our dog, but he is too big for the plane)  Frank Johnson,  Santa Fe, NM
Manager Response: Nothing is better than to be called "perfect" in our minds!  Thanks so much.  We suggest putting that precious dog in the car and returning soon.  Big dogs need beach runs. Looking forward to your return visit. Thanks so much, Linda

Summary: Great place.  Close to the beach and the art galleries.  Nice pool with an outdoor fireplace to sit around after a walk on the beach.  Nice to be able to bring back take out or cook a dinner.  Hardly notice road noise and we're from the 'burbs.  Pool is great and the place has beach gear in case you forgot yours.  We'll be heading back soon.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for you nice review.  We love it when our guests leave happy and cannot wait to return!  Head back real soon. Thanks again, Linda

Summary: It was the only place left that took large dogs. There was a pet fee which is annoying but expected. The owner was there at check in and we were able to check in early at no fee. Nice walk to restaurants and downtown. The room wasn't fancy but bed and breakfast feel. Bed was comfortable. Free parking. Would stay there again. Really liked the owners.
Manager Response: So glad you liked us. We do charge a pet fee per dog per day but it is safer and nicer and less expensive than boarding your pets.  Cleaning up after (especially) large dogs is extra work for our girls also. We do have free parking, free wifi, free ice, beach towels and toys available and no extra charges at all.   We are hoping to see you again soon. Thanks so much, Linda

Summary: This is an old well maintained hotel on the North end of the commercial area of Laguna Beach.  You can walk to the Main Beach.   There is a salt water pool is surrounded by comfortable chairs, a nice wood burning fireplace, two outdoor bars where guests can serve their own food and booze, and a Jenn Aire BBQ.   When we come next time, we will buy a nice steak at Whole Foods in downtown Laguna Beach and broil it on the BBQ.    They have an abundance of plastic pails and shovels that kids can take to the beach.  The  beds are comfortable and the rooms are very efficiently laid out to make the most efficient use of space.  The Resident Managers are very cordial and helpful.  For example, they made us a nice fire in the fireplace where we enjoyed the warmth on a cool evening.  We
Manager Response: We thank you very much for the nice comments.  Joe and Judy and Dale and I are so proud of The Tides.  We love every inch of the place and very much appreciate our guests.  Please return soon to BBQ that steak.  See you soon.

Summary: The location of this motel is good with regards to shops, restaurants etc.  However, I had no idea how noisy the road would be.  Earplugs were provided in the room, which I thought was funny at first, but when I discovered why!  The road noise is constant all day and night.    The next issue was smoking.  I assumed that smoking laws where stringent in the US.  Unfortunately a number of guest were smokers and it wafted through the vents into our room  When we complained, they moved the waste can for cigarette ends to the pool area, so we had to endure them again when we went to swim.    Parking is tight, and the kitchenette in our room was under equipped for the number of people in the room.  There is also a limited welcome pack on arrival, basic to the extreme.
Manager Response: We are very aware of the traffic noise because of our location on Pacific Coast Hwy (as are most accomodations in Laguna Beach).  Our windows are double paned which helps.  We do not allow smoking in our rooms and in fact we enforce a $200 fine if our guests do.  Smoking  is allowed in our outdoor pool area.  I remember the horrible smoking problem in the UK when I was there.  We keep our kitchenettes well stocked--wish you had asked for whatever you needed.  The Tides does not ever give out a welcome pack.  We do have complimentary parking, wifi, beach towels, ice and fresh fruit and coffee  in the morning. We are sad to see when reading your other reviews that you are generally unhappy.  It is unfortunate you did not enjoy your stay.

Summary: Second stay here,and we love it. We stayed for 7nights from the 1st of January.Lovely room,big comfy bed. All you need in kitchen area,and very clean.good location-close to everything. We will be staying here on our next trip,when over from the uk. Only spoke to Joe and his wife afew times,and they are lovely,and make you feel welcome. Our little home from home. Miss you Tides and Laguna-,hope to be Back soon.x
Manager Response: none

Summary: we had a room on the upper level; from the shared balcony/walk-way   bright morning sun and evening  sunset views in a near distance. Lovely bed and linens, renovated with wooden floor s and tiles in dressing/bathroom. Some building noise and noise from celebration at pool. We were able  to leave the car at the INN and walk everywhere. Lots of art galleries close by. Los Brisas for dinner, Madison Market  for a light lunch, C'est la Vie for breakfast on deck  with beach view. heist Park a true gem with many benches, picnic areas, easy access to beaches with view of Catalina and coast.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking time to review The Tides.  We of course agree with you.  Having Heisler Park directly across the street with such fabulous public art from our own local artists AND having some of the best galleries just walking distance in the next few blocks is such a plus for our guests.  We look forward to your next visit--there are always so many interesting thing to do and see in Laguna Beach.  See you soon. Linda

Summary: My wife and son made a last-minute reservation at The Tides Inn yesterday to attend a family function and the experience was about what we expected. Not great, but not horrible either. Just average and a bit overpriced.  Pros: The property is conveniently located close to the bluffs and a gorgeous park with amazing walking paths and remarkable scenery. We watched the sunset over Catalina Island, and the views, complete with spouting grey whales, were absolutely spectacular. The property is also close to the downtown area, the beach, many restaurants and tons of art galleries that Laguna Beach is known for. Super convenient.  The room itself was fairly spacious, quaint and decorated nicely. All of the features in the room worked as expected and nothing was obviously broken or in
Manager Response: We thank you for your review.  We were wondering if you went through a 3rd party to book our motel as our prices are never that high during the winter season.  We apologize for peeling paint which was taken care of immediately.  The Tides was built in 1949--our goal was to be affordable and clean so families could enjoy Laguna Beach.  Yes, we copied the earplugs from a hotel I stayed at in Montana next to a train (far worse than traffic)  Just switched our soap and shampoo to wall hanging because it is so much cleaner and "green" with less waste.  Finally, we wish we were on the ocean side of the highway too (roaring waves vs. traffic)  May we suggest the Surf and Sand for your next Laguna Beach visit.

Summary: I honestly cannot say enough good things about The Tides! My husband and I got married in Laguna Beach on December 28, 2012, and most of our guests stayed, along with us, at The Tides for a few nights. Everyone raved about how warm and kind Dale, Judy, and everyone else was during their stay. The rooms are beautiful and clean, and they have a wide variety of options depending on what you are looking for--full kitchen, kitchenette, etc. Throughout the entire wedding planning process, Judy and Dale were so flexible and sweet. When our guests booked their rooms, they would call or email us to tell us how nice and warm the people at The Tides were. That meant a lot to us because we wanted to have a special, intimate weekend with our family and friends. In addition to the rooms, the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful compliments. We love having wedding parties stay at The Tides.  It is so nice to have everyone in the same place--friends and family become better acquainted and such amazing memories are made.  We just adore our Tides Brides.  Hoping you celebrate here every year. Linda

Summary: A fantastic place! Great service with a really friendly atmosphere!   Only a 5 min walk into the centre of Laguna.   The rooms are great, clean and individually decorated!  The pool area is a great area to relax with a beer or have a quiet swim.  Thanks very much!!!!
Manager Response: You are so very welcome.  Glad you found us and we look forward to your next visit.   Linda

Summary: Booked after we have checked the reviews on Tripadvisor and Expedia. The motel is on a noisy street, the rooms are used, old used furniture, the bathroom is a joke, aircondition is not working properly and is very old and noisy. Price is like a 3-4 stars hotel but quality is like max. 1 star. Overall a bad experience which we cannot recommend.
Manager Response: We are so sorry to read your review, as we aim to please everyone.  Our location is on Pacific Coast Highway as is every other Laguna Beach hotel.  We strive to be clean and affordable and our prices reflect that. May we suggest the Montage Resort - a real 5 star hotel - for your next Laguna Beach visit.

Summary: We just returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Tides Inn.  It's not your typical hotel as the rooms are in various directions, up stairways or around corners, giving it a much more private feel. In addition, the room we stayed in was more like a small apartment than a hotel (ours had a kitchenette with a full-sized fridge, microwave, sink, toaster and coffee maker, table for two, and plenty of plates, cups, knives, silverware, etc.).  A big window and small porch gave a view of the ocean, framed between a couple of distant palm trees.  And while it's not "oceanfront", it's an easy 1 1/2 block walk to a park with stairs down to a beautiful sandy beach (with tidal pools at each end, making all family members happy).    Everything was very clean and with on-site owners, things
Manager Response: Thank you for your lovely comments.  Very appreciated.  We feel very lucky to be located in the village and to be able to easily walk everywhere.  So glad you enjoyed our wonderful community.  We look forward to your return visit.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, dog friendly, perfect location!
Summary: We stayed at the Tides this past week and couldn't have been more pleased.  The hotel is very close to the beach, downtown shopping (lots of galleries, many cute boutiques even a Whole Foods for quick groceries) and within walking distance of a variety of restaurants. Judy was very friendly and helpful.  We intend on visiting fairly frequently from San Diego and now will always stay at The Tides.  Great little place! Perfect location, clean, cute rooms, friendly staff, pool, pup friendly- what more could you ask?!
Manager Response: none

Summary: What an awesome place!   The staff is wonderful; the hotel is charming and the location is ideal!   The first evening of our reservation (initially) overlapped with a group who has been coming (to The Tides) for years --- yet there was an outside chance that one of the rooms required by this group would come available.   They "stalked" that room for weeks -- until it finally did come available -- and then called me on my cell phone to inform me.  Now THAT'S customer service!  While The Tides warns you of potential traffic noise --- and they offer ear plugs "just in case" --- I must say we didn't notice the PCH noise at all.  If that is a concern of yours --- put it aside as the traffic dies down relatively early in the evening and doesn't pick up too early in the morning.   We
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Delightful, charming, comfortable, homey - wonderful spot
Summary: I actually found out about The Tides Inn on tripadvisor.com. My cousin and I wanted to spend a few days in a beach town prior to a business trip to Irvine. We hadn't decided on any particular beach town -- just trying to find a relaxing place to stay. When I came across the reviews for The Tides Inn, I knew we'd found the place.  We were greeted very warmly when we arrived and continued to receive superior customer service throughout our stay. The rooms are not fancy, but they are very comfortable. The little kitchenette was nice to have and we spent some time in the chairs on the front porch of our room. The bathroom was a bit small, but we managed just fine.  The only thing I didn't like was my own fault. I confused "ocean view" with "ocean front." I had expected a room on the
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's a lovely place with a good character. Spotless clean and perfect service. Only a bit close to the road, otherwise perfect. We stayed in one of the rooms with kitchen. (well the american version of a kitchen: no stove, but microwave, fridge..) its a white friendly room with a lot of space, big Tv with a list of all chanels.
Manager Response: Hi, We love your review and thank you for the lovely comments.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Safe travels. Linda

Summary: Very charming and well maintained hotel.   The room was clean and had a bread and breakfast charm.  Pool was great and loved the fireplace.  Great location never had to drive once we got there.  Even though they are right on the Pacific Coast Hwy you would never know it.  The staff was very accessable and willing to help.
Manager Response: Location.  Location.  Location.  We love where we are also! Thank you for your recent stay and for your kind comments.  Our fabulous staff is always pleased to hear feedback from guests.  We are hoping for a return visit soon. Regards, Linda

Summary: We loved our stay at the Tides.  This little hotel is quaint, charming, and well maintained.  The room was impeccably clean, the pool was great, the service was friendly.  It is on PCH, just 3 blocks from the center of town and 1 block from the beach.  Everything is in walking distance.  The only thing that would make it better would be if it were overlooking the beach, but then you would pay A LOT more for that.      This has to be the best place in town for the price.  Especially if you come on your birthday and get the bday special.  And the friendly management even upgraded our room.      Be aware that it is on PCH, which is a noisy highway, but then most of the other hotels are also located on this street, so I am sure they would all be just as noisy.  They do provide ear
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the wonderful review. Yes, it would be nice to be on the beach but our upstairs rooms do have a slight water view.  We are thrilled you took advantage of our Birthday Special--such a great deal and we appreciate your taking the time to review us. Linda

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel in a great location
Summary: The Tides Inn stands just off the main Highway passing down the Pacific Coast Highway and offers excellent value in this lovey town. We only stayed here the one night which was regrettable as we were felt to be made very welcome from the moment we stepped into reception.  Rooms very well equipped, more a suite than a room and would not go amiss in more expensive boutique hotel.   A lovely if underused pool area to the front of the property just adds to the excellent value of this property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent another 4 nights in Laguna Beach at the Tides Inn.  Our second stay here to be repeated when we come to Orange County.  Wonderful staff; extremely customer oriented, affortable accomodations considering it is Laguna Beach CA afterall.  Nice pool and lounge area.  Rooms spic and span.  Great location within walking distance of absolutely everything.  Make sure you walk North one block, cross PCH 1 towards the ocean and take the cliff walk that trails all the way back to the Laguna Beach city beach.  Wonderful views of the magnificent Pacific Ocean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have stayed here many times over the past decades.  I find The Tides' location, friendliness, and room comfort a real reason we return there each time I come back to Laguna.   No stuffy air conditioned sterile rooms here.  Pool relaxing and advice from staff honest & quite spot on for restaurants, beaches.  I grew up in Laguna & won't think of another place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We got married at the end of Sept and my family and friends occupied 18 of the 20 rooms at the hotel. Judy was so helpful from the start helping us make arrangements. This was a destination wedding so we were not from the area. Judy, Joe and Dale were exceptional! The rooms were clean and the pool area was a great spot to meet up in the morning and hang out at night. There is even a wood burning fireplace at the pool! And whie our party was a large one, the staff was mindful of the other parties staying at the hotel that weekend as well. Our friends gave the place rave reviews! Thanks for helping make great memories at The Tides.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As soon as we saw The Tides Inn - it felt so cozy, comfy and homey.  The room was exceptionally well taken care of and so clean.We used our kitchen every day and we didn't need to worry - all the supplies were there. Definitely coming back and want to stay at The Tides again.There was only one thing wrong - we didn't get to stay long enough!!!  Dale , Judy and Joe are so friendly, and always available to help.  Great job y'all....The Canadians will be back!....with more Maple Syrup too!....don't go anywhere, now!!! Wendy and Marylou
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently spent four days at the Tides attending a 50's high school reunion from Tokyo, Japan for about 40 classmates.  This was our second time at the Tides for our reunion and we could not have picked a better place.  The owners, Linda and Dale, and the resident managers, Judy and Joe, were most welcoming and helpful.  The Tides has a great pool; and nicely appointed, clean and comfortable rooms.  There is also a great area for barbecuing and to just sit back and relax.  The Tides is within walking distance of several good restaurants and a short walk to the beach. Our room was on the second floor and had a refrigerator, coffee maker and a very quite AC unit.  Many rooms have small fully equipped kitchenettes and all have large flat screen TV's.  If you like small, clean,
Manager Response: Great review and we thank you so much.  Your Tokyo group is so much fun and we loved having you as repeat guests.  That is a great compliment to us and your taking the time to write is much appreciated.  Until next time,  Judy and Joe Resident Managers

Summary: My husband's high school class from Tokyo had a small "gathering" of about 40 classmates from the late 50's at this inn.  Since we occupied most of the rooms, the gathering was very intimate.  Our room was comfy, not fancy, but with everything we needed.  We were on the first floor with king bed, flat screen TV, AC, kitchenette with micro, small fridge, coffee maker, plates.  It was perfect for our needs.  We took over the pool area for breakfast and 3 dinners which were deliciously cooked on the barbeque and also in the largest room which had a kitchen.  It was only a few blocks to Laguna Beach for shopping and Las Brisas for a fine dinner out.  The staff was so friendly and accomodating.  We would definitely go back for a weekend.  In the summer, Laguna has a Sawdust Festival
Manager Response: Hello Tokyo gathering.  We loved having your group here for a repeat performance.  Your entire entourage was so fun....interesting, lovable, fabulous "inside" entertainment in the form of a live hula by one of your Hawaiin natives down fireside/poolside.  We so look forward to your next group visit.  Judy and Joe Resident Managers

Summary: Spur of the moment overnight stay at the Tides.  Chose hotel based on great TA reviews and rate.  Our room was basically a studio apt.  First floor with a very comfortable king bed.  Small kitchinette with microwave, fridge, toaster, and small sink.  Plates, silverware, and even some wine glasses.  Flat screen tv with plenty of network and basic cable channels,(did not really watch tv though).  Decent sized bathroom with shower only.  Think we must have got the last room,special needs room, shower had wall mounted fold up shower bench and two hand held shower heads, fine with us.  Staff very friendly and helpful.
