Shannon and I loved our stay and all the employees. Kinda like a bread/ breakfast place. There is plenty of places to eat and experience the beach life day and night !! We will be back many times and uee Room #204 !! thanks for the hospitality  Tides Inn  and we hope you will all come and experience this unique  atmosphere. John & Shannon
Manager Response: none

Summary: Dale has such an eye for details, beautiful pool & fireplace & bbq for outdoor relaxation, very comfortable bed, clean & nicely decorated room. Very helpful & attentive owner. Close to downtown, quiet, & this has the ambiance  of an upscale bed & breakfast! Love the place, prices were extremely reasonable for the area. Wished our visit was longer & we will be back, soon!  Mario & Shirley Moretti, Chicago, IL
Manager Response: Wow, Mario and Shirley, thank you for your glowing review of The Tides. We appreciate your noticing the care that has gone into the decor and ambience of this lovingly refurbished inn. We hope you tell your friends about it, and come back soon!

Summary Heading: Great value, very clean and very friendly staff
Summary: I booked some friends from Europe into the Tides Inn after spending a whole day in Laguna Beach looking for a nice place, not too expensive. I went to 6 Hotels and was on my way home when by accident I saw the Tides and made one more stop. I'm very happy I did. I was impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel.  Dale at the office was very friendly and  helpful. My friends loved it and next time I have company, I will save lot's of time by going to the Tides Inn first.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My stay at The Tides helped to make my Laguna Beach vacation a wonderful visit. The staff was super friendly. The room was clean & comfortable; the location perfect. It felt like a home away from home. I highly recommend this motel. I will definitely stay here on my next visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The cutest secret spot in Laguna Beach
Summary: We are longtime residents of Laguna Beach but have relocated out of state for work. Rather than bother friends during the Holidays, we chose to stay in a hotel and had heard that the Tides was charming.  What an understatement!  The Tides Inn is the quintessential Laguna experience.  Every room is decorated in it's own style - funky beach cottage but new and full of fun details.  It is everything you love about Laguna.  The rooms are clean and have an ocean view.  We brought our dog (they welcome pets).  I could not have been happier unless I was in my own home.  We walked downtown everyday to eat and shop.  We walked to the beautiful park and tide pools which are across the street from the Tides.  There are lots of hotels in Laguna Beach but this is a secret spot that is unlike
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just back from 2 weeks at Laguna Beach. Stayed at the Tides. Recommend it 100%. A special thanks to Dale & L inda who run it. They can't do enough to look after you We had 3 great rooms. Linen & towels changed daily. The pool area is lovely.  Ideal for bbqs. gorgeous seating area with fire for the evenings. Free internet which was excellent.  Photos to follow. The position is ideal, just park your car and a couple of minutes stroll to all Laguna offers. Would go back in a heart beat.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: An awesome place for a birthday weekend!
Summary: We took a chance on The Tides after reading favorable reviews and are glad we did. The price was fantastic, especially factoring in the birthday special ($70 for a 1970 birthday!). We loved the second story room and the fact that we could sleep with the window open. The kitchenette is a great feature and allowed us to bring our own snacks and drinks. We are very picky about the cleanliness of hotel rooms and this place was sparkling clean. Very comfortable beds - the only minor complaint is the too soft/flimsy pillows. The location was perfect for us because we did not want to have to drive far - Main Beach is a short walk away and Aliso Beach is a 5-minute drive. The staff was extremely helpful with restaurant selections and just providing a welcoming atmosphere. All in all, we
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent Value with more than 5 star service.
Summary: Mature couple visiting from UK. Stayed for 3 nights at this small  friendly hotel on the more affordable side of the highway. Room with kitchenette, good size, well equiped, very clean and lovely large comfortable bed. Could not wish for more friendly  or helpful service, nothing was too much trouble. Great recommendations for places to eat and where to visit. Good size pool, with loungers, pool toys, towels etc. BBQ and fire. If I had to make any criticism, could be a little noisy but value for money easily compensates. Would definately return for longer visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our friends stayed at the Inn at Laguna Beach while we stayed at The Tides.  They paid more for less.  The Tides has a super helpful staff, comfortable rooms, beautiful pool, and feels secluded though it is in walking distance from everything.  Try it!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stayed here fore 2 weeks whilst visiting my daughter who lives in nearby Irvine. We are from England and have never been to CA before. Laguna Beach in general was lovely, but this establishment in particular was just perfect for our needs. The rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable. We did have a problem with noisy neighbors initially, but a after speaking to the owner we were moved to  different rooms for the remainder of our stay and had no further problems. Cathryn the Manager was extremely helpful and friendly, nothing was ever too much trouble and we can't wait to stay there again in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: More than the sum of its parts
Summary: The Tides is an unpretentious, homey owner-operated little motel on the east side of the Pacific Coast Highway.    It lacks the glitz and amenities of the name brands, but the karma is unbeatable.  After a couple of nights, we found ourselves greeting new guests as they moved in as if they were coming to visit us.  The staff are friendly, helpful, and well-informed.  There is a very nice salt water pool and a delightful pool area for relaxing.  The location is perfect.  An easy five minute stroll south takes you to Ground Zero, Laguna Beach, where all the action is.  A five minute walk north takes you to a handy Pavillion supermarket and Jean Paul's famous coffee shop (do NOT ask for an extra shot.  He makes it the way God intended it. to be made!).  But best is five minutes
Manager Response: none

Summary: Here's real find. Large room, large bath, with a walk in closet, very nice sheets and towels, very clean and nicely decorated,$99 a night. That's in a town that usually runs much higher. The location is very good, you can walk to everything in town. Parking is free and there's a nice pool and patio/deck area with a great outdoor fireplace. The one draw back is there is some road noise from PCH during the day. At night it's dead quiet. No propblem sleeping. We will defintiely return.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value in a pricey area.
Summary: We booked our stay at the Tides after reading the wonderful reviews.  Cathryn was very friendly, helpful and accommodating.  We very busy so not around the hotel much, but the room was very comfy and clean, and it was great to have the kitchenette. The best thing was the price, very very reasonable.  Make sure you ask Cathryn if there are any specials available.   We did have to chuckle at the quote on the wall in our room.  (Apparently all rooms have a quote painted on the wall as part of the decor.)  The quote in our room was "Let your light shine", which was attributed to Oprah Winfrey.  Apparently in addition to all of her other astounding accomplishments, Oprah was also one of the authors of the Bible.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Cozy home away from home
Summary: The Tides is a small motel just off N. PCH in Laguna Beach, California.  Cathryn and Linda greet  you daily with a smile and are always there to answer questions that make your stay more enjoyable.  The rooms are clean and well-appointed.  This older style motor lodge was restored and remodeled into this lovely property.  It's not beachfront, but a short walk across PCH and you are there.  The views at Main Beach are gorgeous and my friend and I sat in the sun on a bench just outside Las Brisas restaurant and read for a while.  It sure beat the weather in Ohio that we were escaping. There are many fine restaurants in Laguna and the reviews here are full of them.  Our favorite was The Beach House at sunset for the great views and the sunset specials that make great dining a bit
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I took a quick trip to Laguna Beach for a get-away from the mid-west snow.  We stayed 2 nights at the Tides in Room 205 overlooking the pool and we loved every minute of our stay!  First of all Cathryn was an absolute doll and was so wonderful every step of the way. From her answer to my email inquiry, to checking in and checking out.  The Tides is on the East side of Pacific Coast Highway and sets back in it's own little private walled in area.  As soon as you drive up the entrance you literally feel you've stepped back in time into a darling Charming 50s Motel. BUT with all the upgrades of today!  As soon as we pulled up, I felt so cozy and immediately loved the every inch of their property!  In the pool area, there is wood burning fireplace with comfortable
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here on valentine's weekend and were pleasantly surprised by the good value on room pricing for location and the room itself.  This is more of a motel than a hotel with the outside access to room doors overlooking the parking lot and swimming pool.   Room was decent - clean and nicely decorated.  Pool area was nice with newer furniture and a nice new looking wood burning fireplace  in the corner with seating.  The location is quite good.  We were able to walk and jog to main laguna beach area and also walk to restaurants such as Las Brisas which is only a block away.   We walked to  Las Brisas for lunch sat outside enjoying margaritas and beers enjoying the beautiful view.  My wife needed something from the room and I was able to walk quickly back to the hotel and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Superb value for space and location, especially with kids
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights in the 'plate' room, eccentrically decorated along the walls with plates from every state and a few from overseas (including a few we spotted from our hometown of London, UK).  This kept our daughter amused, but what we loved most was the incredible space.  Room 212 is a massive bedroom with two large double beds,  separate living area including dining table and sofa and full kitchen (oven, microwave, fridge, freezer, all implements you would need to self-cater).  Also an en-suite bathroom (shower, no bath) and a large walk-in closet.  For our family suffering jet-lag, the flexibility of the space far surpassed our expectations.  It is also quaint and pleasing to be in.  There is no view of the sea, but the windows are large and the living space is light.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Laguna Beach is a must if your on a flydrive in California and a couple of nights at the Tides inn is the place to stay.  We arrived out of season so it was quiet and we were lucky enough to be given de-lux suite up the stairs overlooking the pool. The room was amazing very cosy with its own kitchen and on-suite facilities. With just a short walk to the town and beaches its a great place for families to visit. Very artie and cool is lugana beach plus made famous from the MTV series. There are some real nice cliffside restaurants with great views along the coastline and cool sunsets.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked directly through the Tides website for the best rate. Service was very friendly, nice to have free parking and free internet. Kitchen (no oven, but microwave) was a bonus. Good size room and bathroom, and very clean. Good location - short walk to downtown and to the beach, although disappointed in no beach view. Liked that this is a smaller, more quaint hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for two nights during our honeymoon. The staff was just super friendly, and did everything they could to help us. I got sick on day two, and they upgraded us to a better room for no extra cost.  I would recommend staying in one of the rooms that has kitchenette (no oven, just micro. But these rooms are the only ones with fridge).  The hotel is close to the beach (and to a busy road), but you cannot see the ocean. However, it's just a short stroll down to the beach.  Apart from the sickness, we had a wonderful stay in Laguna beach!! PS: You are allowed to smoke on the patios in front of the rooms, and by the pool. Nice for a couple of smokers from Scandinavia that was a bit surprised by California's strict smoking ban.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights - booked through Hotels.com - they had the best rate at the time.  Nice friendly staff, great location although it is just off the main route 1 (which actually the majority of hotels are).  You can expect a little noise but it wasn't bad all said.  It is a short walk to main centre and to the beach.  Rooms are really nice - stayed in 207 which had kitchenette which was fab as it saved us a bit of money.  Supermarket just a couple of blocks away.  Bed huge and very comfy.  Parking free.  Nice little pool although we never used it.  Great weather mid Sept.    Note:  having read some of the other reviews I think the rooms nearer the highway are not that great so just try and pick a room that suits you - you can email the hotel direct - they're quick at
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Tides Inn for 5 nights and thought it was fabulous!  From the moment I phoned to book the room (with Catherine) to the day we left, the service was great.  We had a room with a kitchenette and it was great - spacious and light.  I can't tell you how comfy the bed/pillows are!  The pool area is lovely.  There is also an outdoor lounge area with an open log fire - gorgeous.  There is also a big BBQ which probably gets used in the summer months.  The maid service is also very good.  The hotel is within walking distance of bars and restaurants and right across the road is access to the beach.  Laguna Beach has a main beach but it's also full of small coves.  We really did not want to leave.  It was so relaxing.  We would love to back back again someday.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: AM  PLANNING ON RETURNING NEXT YEAR.
Summary: Beds were comfortable. Had a seperate 3/4 kitchen, with a dining room table, that was fully stocked with dishes. Quaint decor. Heated large pool.  Fireplace-they supply the wood- with comfortable couches around it, by the pool, and a bbq.  They have beach towels, boogie boards,  chairs and hats to borrow. Price was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room smelled of something but was clean. There was a parking place outside the hotel. I can't write much about this place as I only remember the smell and I stayed shortly.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Great Getaway in Every Way
Summary: We're longtime visitors to Laguna Beach, and know and love the town for its natural beauty and its tradition of supporting the arts. Despite the lure of other, more expensive hotels in Laguna, each summer we choose to come back  to The Tides with our two young kids. The rooms are clean, welcoming and charmingly decorated (each room is distinctive, with freshly upholstered chairs/pillows, original artwork and stenciled quotes from famous authors on the beamed ceilings), the service is professional and very friendly courtesy of  Cathryn and the owners, Linda and Dale, and the prices very fair for what you get. We typically stay in the larger "plate" room (212), which has a separate kitchen/dining room and 2 double beds that offer plenty of room for us to spread out. We come to
Manager Response: none

Summary: My partner and I were traveling with my nephew and came across the Tides Inn. Manager Response: While we understand the basis of your complaint, it may have helped to have checked a map of Laguna Beach before checking in. The only problems we encountered were a locked pool when we would have loved to have been able to sit on the sun beds outside in the sun and a lack of a full length mirror.

Summary: I stayed at the Tides for 2 nights. It is an adorable little inn, and very convenient (I mean walking distance) to the beach and to downtown. You can park your car and forget about it.  The room was very clean. My only complaints were the bed was hard and there was nowhere to unpack (ie, no dresser, small closet with only enough room for one small suitcase) Since we werent staying long it was not much of an inconvenience.   The staff was extremely nice and made good restaurant recommendations.  If you stay in Laguna you must go to Pomodoro on Forest St!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose the Tides Inn for a few reasons (the pros):  the location is 1.5 blocks from gorgeous beaches, a Pavilions supermarket; walking distance from the downtown village & the Pageant of the Masters (there is a shuttle bus, nominal charge if you prefer); there is NO MINIMUM NIGHT STAY (shocking for high season); decently stocked kitchenette; there is a nice but small swimning pool/BBQ area; friendly front desk staff.  However, knowing before we checked in that this was a renovated "motel", our "cons" are realistic:  stained carpets; extremely small, hard-to-navigate parking lot; lack of privacy when sitting on the "terrace".  Overall, not such a bad place, good value for the money -- especially for Laguna Beach in high season.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 5 nights. Had to change room after first night as the inn was full. No assistance. Rooms are ok, but stained carpet and rooms not quite like the photos on the website.... Nice bed and not too noisy air-condition. Had to wait 3 days to borrow an iron, they had no ironing-board. Then they called us several times urging to get it back asap - we had hardly time to use it. What about buying one extra?? Found the place overpriced compared to what you get. Pool was out of work the whole stay. Laguna Beach is a very nice place, you can walk everywhere, the beaches are beautiful and there are many nice restaurants. Would love to come back to the city, but not necessarily the Tides Inn. Problem is it is hard to find any accomodation at all during high season in Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here 2 nights close to July 4th holiday:  Pros: Location(can walk to beach, movies, shops, resturants), free parking, nice pool and BBQ area, nice kitchenette, very comfy bed, AC.  Cons: downstairs rooms can hear loud walkers on level 2, bathrooms could use updating,.  Overall, this was a great place and I would stay again.  Down the street is a "Pavillions" supermarket where you can get stuff to BBQ or for the kitchenette.  You can walk to the beach down the street (1 block) or down the hill to the "main beach" (3 blocks)  Do not go to the terrible restuarant Las Brisas-over priced, bad food.  You could get a better meal at Baha Fresh!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My friend and I stayed at the Tides in Laguna Beach on Wednesday and Thursday night, March 16-18, 2005.  I lived in Laguna Beach four years ago- the following was important to me:  Hotel:  Had to have free parking, comfy bed and be very clean.  Had to have A/C.  Pool and building had to be in great condition.  The Tides had all of this, plus a wonderful front desk manager.  I did not require a view because the beach is a block and a half away, however we did have a small view from the room..  Location:  On coast HWY (aka PCH)- and it was two blocks from my favorite little restaurant, Las Brisas.  It's really just a great place for Margaritas and MEGA view and fun people watching.  You can walk everywhere- but remember that Laguna is a little bit "hilly", so wear comfy shoes if

Maid service was excellent. Room was clean and fresh. King bed was new and comfortable. Kitchenette was perfect for the kids and us. The price was a great deal. We paid almost half of what we normally pay in August for a room. The Inn has been remodeled and is decorated tastefully. The pool was clean and well maintained.
